loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a 55-year-old married mother of six. Currently all her children are working. Her husband drives a commercial vehicle and transports passengers to their destination for a fee. 

Comfort is very hard-working and is resourceful for her family. She trades in charcoal and also sells grocery products like biscuits, toffees, evaporated milk, and canned drinks in her neighborhood. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Comfort obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages in her community and retails them to her customers. 

Comfort wants to use the loan to buy charcoal in bulk and purchase additional grocery products to upgrade her inventory. She hopes the loan will enable her to increase her savings so she can pay for her children's educational fees. Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua’ which literary means "God’s family."

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of charcoal and grocery products.

loans.name: Pola

texts.es:
Pola  es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Pola es soltera tiene 29 años ha terminado de estudiar turismo y hotelera.
Desde hace dos años Pola se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, la visitaron en su casa le explicaron como es el sistema de ventas y ella acepto ser una vendedora.
Pola necesita un préstamo de 600 soles, para comprar mercadería de cosméticos.
Desde que esta en Finca, se siente respaldada por préstamos que son de mucha ayuda, ella esta experimentando un crecimiento en su negocio, sabe que puede contar con la institución, y ve como todo el grupo de mujeres va  creciendo. 
El sueño de pola es tener un negocio de jugeria, esta juntando sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Pola is a member of the Community Bank Sarita Colonia. Pola es single. She is 29 years old. She just finished studying tourism and hotel management. Two years ago, Pola started selling beauty products by catalog. They visited at home, they explained the sales system and she agreed to be a seller. Pola needs a 600 soles loan, to purchase cosmetics. Since she came to Finca, she feels backed by the loans that are of great help. She is experimenting a significant growth in their business. She knows she can count on the center and she sees how this group of women is growing. Pola’s dream is to have her own juice business, for which she is saving as much as she can.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia Ketewa is a forty-seven-year-old mother of four. Three of her children have graduated senior high school, while  the last is currently studying in junior high school. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops. Afia and her family live in their own house in Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Afia works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a petty trader and trades in onions. She buys them from local farmers in the surrounding villages and supplies to retailers in the cities. She has been in business for seven years. She also distributes onions to local food vendors to spice their meals. Afia wants a loan to buy onions on a larger scale so that she can cut down on business expenses, which include frequent trips to procure goods, and to maximize profit.

Afia is a member of a community group called “Yehowa Mma” (translated "Jehovah’s children"). Members in this group guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy onions in bulk.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.es: Marilyn tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y aun vive en la casa de su madre. Con mucha alegría y organización atiende a cada uno de sus clientes que acuden a sus cabinas públicas de Internet, las que hace 3 años viene administrando. Los primeros años de su negocio le resultó muy rentable, porque no contaba con competidores, pero ahora está sintiendo la presencia de la competencia, por lo que ve la necesidad de incrementar el número de computadoras que tiene y aumentar la velocidad de su conexión. Aun así Martilyn está contenta por la rentabilidad de su negocio, y por otra parte, cuanta con el apoyo de su madre que le ha facilitado el local, por lo que no tiene la necesidad de pagar alquiler. En consecuencia, aporta económicamente para las necesidades diarias de su casa y apoya a sus hermanos menores con  la compra de sus útiles escolares, asimismo cuando ella tiene que salir, sus hermanos atienden su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, se está integrando a un grupo de solidaridad, por ello, hace compromisos de pagar cada una de las cuotas fijadas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para re potenciar la velocidad de sus computadoras para su mejor conexión a la Internet.
texts.en:
Marilyn is 30 years old, single, and still lives in her mother's house. With great joy and organization she serves each one of the customers who come to her public Internet booths, which she has been running for 3 years. The first years of her business were very profitable, as she did not have any competitors, but now she is feeling the presence of the competition. For this reason she sees the need to increase the number of computers that she has and to increase her connection speed. Even so Martilyn is happy with the profitability of her business, and on the other hand, she counts on the support of her mother, who has provided the building, for which she does not need to pay rent. Consequently, she contributes financially to the daily needs of the house and to her younger brothers by purchasing their school supplies. Likewise, when she has to go out, her brothers take care of her business. This is her first loan with MFP. She is joining a solidarity group, therefore she agrees to pay each one of the payments established by her credit adviser. The money she is requesting is to upgrade the speed of her computers for her best Internet connection.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Upgrade her computers

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is a fifty-eight-year-old married man and a father of five. The first four born are currently in senior high and junior high schools. The youngest has yet to start school. His wife is a petty trader. She trades in food items such as yams, plantains, cassava, and the like. Kwame lives with the family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is farming and a busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.
 
Kwame is in the sand winning business. He acquires pieces of land, hires workers who dig for the sand and sells the product to building contractors in dump trucks. After winning the sand, the land returns to the owner from whom he acquired it.

Kwame has been in business for fifteen years. He hopes to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: To acquire a piece of land for sand winning

loans.name: Leonit Mejail

texts.es:
El sr. MEJAIL, es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en la provincia de Chincheros, pero él socio vive en la ciudad del Cusco en el barrio de santiago en qoripata francisco arumaga 180, CUSCO.

Nuestro socio tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, sin hijos, él socio es técnico en mecánica de mantenimiento, y el desea comprar maquinas para poder hacer pequeños trabajos y poco a poco poner su propio taller, el socio solicito el préstamo para poder comprar parte de su maquinaria.

El socio valora el préstamo y agradece al medio por el cual el podrá cumplir con su sueño y se compromete a efectuar con el pago total de su préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
MEJAIL is a native of the village of Cruz Pata in Chincheros province, but he lives in the city of Cusco.

Our member is 29 years old, single, and has no children. He is a mechanic and wants to buy equipment so that he can do small jobs and, little by little, set up his own workshop. He's applying for a loan so that he can buy some of the equipment that he needs.

The member is grateful that he can borrow money in this way and make his dreams come true. He commits to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy equipment.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is the 35-year-old, married mother of three children. All her children are in school. She and her husband operate a licensed chemist's shop in their village. It is Florence's desire to use the proceeds from her business in order to provide a better education for her children.

The pharmacy has been the major source of the family's livelihood for the past ten years. Florence has completed training in the dispensation of prescription drugs, and it is she who is the primary pharmacist for the surrounding villages. Florence has a passion for what she is doing, which is the main reason why people fill their prescriptions from her shop.

She is requesting a loan in order to purchase the assorted pharmaceutical drugs that are in the most frequent demand. The pharmacy's prescription drugs are delivered from Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.

Florence is grateful for this support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua,’ which literally means 'God’s family.'

loans.use: For the purchase of pharmaceutical drugs for her chemist's shop.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana tiene 20 años de edad, vive son su pareja y padre de sus 2 hijos, habitan en la casa de sus padres. Este año ha sembrado alverjas, papas y olluco en las chacras de sus padres, su esposo es el encargado de arar y preparar la tierra con las yuntas. Este tipo de trabajo se realiza en las chacras que han descansado de producir de 2 a 3 años. Ya que luego de este tiempo, resulta ser muy fértil y no requieren de muchos fertilizantes químicos. A Maximiliana le gusta el trabajo agrícola, ya que desde niña creció con estas labores, y ahora con la ayuda de su esposo el trabajo se hace más ligero. Sus planes a futuro son de seguir sembrando, además su madre le propuso traspasarle su tienda, a lo que ha aceptado, y empezará a trabajar en ella para que poco a poco pueda pagarle a su madre el valor de su bodega. Este es su 8vo préstamo consecutivo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha trabajado con responsabilidad, y en su cargo de tesorera cumple cabalmente sus funciones, así como con cada una de sus cuotas señaladas. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, asimismo para pagar parte del traspaso de la tienda de su madre.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 20 years old and lives with her partner, the father of her 2 children and they live in her parents' house. This year they have sowed peas, potatoes and yams in her parents' plantation fields. Her husband is responsible for the plowing and preparation of the fields. This type of work is carried out the fields only after they have been rested from cultivation for 2 or 3 years. This down time allows the fields to be very fertile and do not require many additional fertilizers. Maximiliana loves to be a farmer, something she has been doing since she was a little girl and now with the help of her husband her work is much lighter. Her plans for the future are to keep sowing and her mother also proposed giving her the store and she has accepted. She will start working in the store and with time she will be able to pay her mother the value of the grocery store. This is her eighth consecutive loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and all this time she has been participating responsibly. In her role as the treasurer she has been carrying out her duties and she has been making her payments on time. The funds that she is requesting now will be used to purchase fertilizers and some of the money will be used to pay for the handover of the store from her mother.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Ayawavi

texts.fr: Cette jeune dame célibataire a une formation en secrétariat bureautique, mais ne trouvant pas du travail elle a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle elle fait du traitement de texte et la photocopie. Cette activité est  rentable pour elle, elle veut l’agrandir en y associant les services téléphoniques et la vente de fournitures de bureau. Elle sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter une cabine téléphonique, de même que du matériel informatique et des fournitures de bureau.
texts.en:
This young unmarried woman has training in office secretarial work. But unable to find work, she opened her own shop, in which she offers word-processing and photo-copying. This is a profitable business for her. She wants to expand it by including phone services and the sale of office supplies. She's therefore requesting her first loan with WAGES to buy a telephone booth, as well as some computer equipment and office supplies.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy office supplies and a phone booth

loans.name: Safuratu

texts.en:
In Oda, a community in the Eastern Region of Ghana, a sizable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite appreciable numbers of the women are involved in palm oil production. Safuratu S. is one such women, actively producing palm oil. She has been in business for five years.

She buys the palm fruits from local farmers, processes it in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruit which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. A reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel water content.

Safuratu plans to use this loan to expand her business by buying palm fruits in bulk to be able to supply more customers. She believes the loan assistance will enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually to help improve her family's finances.

Safuratu is 40-years old. She is married and has two little kids who are currently in basic school. Her husband is a farmer. She is a member of a trust bank group called Ikushi Allah Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits in bulk

loans.name: Kingsford

texts.en:
Kingsford A. is into the palm oil production business. He buys palm nuts from farmers in his community and other nearby towns. He distributes the oil to retailers who come from other towns to buy by the gallon.

Kingsford is a 45-year old married man and the father of four children: three boys and a girl. The oldest three are currently in primary school. The last born has yet to start school. His wife is a hardworking woman. She is a farmer and a trader as well. She sells infant layettes. Kingsford lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a busy farming and trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Kingsford has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk. He wants to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
SARA T. D., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Madres Coraje”,  su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Dos de Mayo Nº 834, a 5 cuadras y media de la Municipalidad Distrital de Yarinacocha, en el distrito del mismo nombre, tiene 65 años de edad, Se dedica a la costura desde los 17 años, es madre soltera, oficio con el que educó a sus 3 hijos.

Ella tiene 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser y poder seguir desarrollando su pequeño negocio. En la actualidad, ya generó el primer puesto de trabajo directo, debido a que tiene una joven ayudante laborando en su pequeño negocio, ubicado en su domicilio.

Con este préstamo  de S/ 1,400. Nuevos Soles, invertirá en el arreglo de una máquina de coser y comprará materiales para confeccionar y diseñar todo tipo de ropa. Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque nunca alguna entidad financiera le otorgó un crédito; mientras que Manuela Ramos sin tanto papeleo,  confió en ella y la motiva a ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Sara T. D. belongs to the Community Bank "Madres Coraje". Her home is located in Jr. Dos de Mayo N. 834, approximately 5 blocks from the District Municipality of Yarinacocha, of the district with the same name. She is 65 years old. She has been a seamstress since she was 17 years old. She is a single mother and she managed to educate her 3 children through her business.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for 2 years. Her first loan was in the amount of S/300 nuevos soles, funds that she used towards the maintenace of her sewing machine to keep developing her small business. Currently she has created a store where she receives orders directly from customers, given that she has a young woman helping her with the small business, located in her home.

With this loan of S/1400 nuevos soles, she will invest in the maintenance and repair of her sewing maching and she will also purchase materials to make and design all types of clothing. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos because she has never received a loan from any financial institution before. Manuela Ramos, without too much paper work, believed in her and motivates her to be responsible with her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing. For maintenance of her sewing machine.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael O., 41, has been selling yams for the past five years to support her family. She is married and the mother of six children. Yam is one of the favorite staple foods that supply carbohydrate components in the diet. Rachael takes delivery of produce from farmers who provide her with a direct supply. This enables her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell at higher prices. She loves selling goods, the business from which she obtains a daily source of livelihood.

With this loan, she wants to buy yams in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children in school. Four of her children are currently in junior and senior high. Rachael belongs to a village bank called Yesu Abusua which literally means "God’s Family".

loans.use: To purchase yams from direct from farmers

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Hace más de 4 años viene trabajando en el hotel “Las Brisas”, ubicado en la carretera central a 5 cuadras de su casa. Su trabajo de recepcionista dice gustarle, y el dinero que gana ahí, le permitió apoyar a su madre con sus cultivos en momentos de necesidad, además le agrada mucho la agricultura, en especial la siembra de café porque considera que es un producto muy rentable, sobre todo en las fechas festivas. Ahora Milagros va a empezar sembrar sus propios cultivos en un terreno de la chacra de su madre, porque quiere convertirse en una agricultora próspera. También aprovechará su trabajo en el hotel para ofrecer a sus clientes los granos de café de su chacra, sin la necesidad de intermediarios. Milagros está muy entusiasmada con su proyecto de siembra de café, a la vez está conciente que le llevará  muchos años de esfuerzo conseguir una clientela regular. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y tiene buenas expectativas acerca de los grupos solidarios y su dinámica de trabajo, por lo cual, hace el compromiso de pagar puntualmente cada una de las cuotas señaladas por su asesora de crédito. Con el dinero que solicita comprará plantitas de café para empezar con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Milagros is 24 years old, she is single and lives with her paretns. For more than 4 years she has been working in the Las Brisas hotel, located on Central Road about 5 blocks from her house. She is a receptionist and she said she likes her job. The money that she earns has permitted to help her mother with the cultivations whenever she has needed the support, in addition, she loves agriculture, especially cofee because she considers it a very profitable product (especially on holidays). Milgros will start her own plantation in her mother's field because she would like to become a prosperous agriculturer. She will also continue with her work at the hotel to be able to offer her clients the coffee beans from her plantation, without needing a distributor. Milagros is very much looking forward to the coffee plantation project, but she is also mindful that it will take many years of hard work to earn a steady clientele. It is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she has good expectations with independent groups and their work dynamics. She has made the compromise to pay her dues on time as indicated by her credit agent. With the funds she is requesting she will purchase coffee seedlings to start her first plantation.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee plants.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A., 32, is a food vendor who cooks and serves rice and bean stew. She sells at the community center and in the gold mine field. She has good hands which has attracted lots of customers who buy from her stand. She has been in this food business for the last two years.

Gifty is married and lives with her husband and their four children in a mining community called Takroase, a suburb of Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a gold miner in the community. The mine has created lots of job opportunities for youth in the area. All of her children are currently in school.

Currently Gifty has been hit by inadequate funds to buy supplies. She is asking for a loan to buy rice, beans, meat, vegetable oil, charcoal etc. She believes that no help will come from anyone but you. She belongs to a village bank called Yesu Abusua which literally means "God’s Family".

loans.use: To buy maize, rice, meat, vegetable oil, charcoal etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet M. is a fishmonger who also sells fresh yam. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She procures her goods from big-time fishmongers in Yeji and Mankessim towns, who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for four years. According to her, most of her customers are also food vendors in her community.

Janet is 48-years old, married and has given birth to four children. Currently, two children are out of school and independent. The other two are pursuing education in senior high school. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates cocoa and foodstuffs such as cassava and also vegetables.

Janet believes the loan assistance will enable her to buy tilapia and other assorted fish in bulk to serve a larger market. This will eventually help to improve her family's finances and support her kids' education which is very dear to her heart. She is a member of a trust bank group called Joshua Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish in bulk

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica acaba de cumplir 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Tras haber concluido sus estudios superiores como profesora, ha implementado una bodega en la casa de su madre porque dice gustarle mucho estar en constante comunicación con la gente, además que tiene un buen beneficio económico. Años atrás, mientras estudiaba, vendía cosméticos a todas sus amigas, y este dinero que le sirvió para cubrir los gastos que requería su carrera, por ello que Mónica aprendió a generarse sus propios recursos. Ahora, mientras realiza su proyecto de tesis, a la par se ocupa de su negocio, con el cual podrá cubrir los gastos que vaya requerir para la obtención de su título profesional. El espacio donde puso su negocio, años atrás su madre tenía una bodega similar pero fracasó, Mónica no espera tener el mismo resultado, pues quiere convertir su tienda en un negocio rentable y sostenible, ya que también quiere que se convierta en la principal fuente de ingresos de su casa, para que su madre deje de  trabajar como empleada del hogar. Por tal iniciativa su madre se encuentra muy contenta y orgullosa de su hija. Este es el primer préstamo de Mónica con MFP, acaba de integrar un grupo de solidaridad, donde se compromete en pagar cada una de las cuotas en las fechas señaladas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará bebidas gaseosas y golosinas para la bodega que acaba de emprender
texts.en:
Monica has just turned 22 years old, she is single and lives at home with her parents. Having completed her post-secondary studies in teaching, she has set up a convenience store in the house because she says she loves with in constant communication with people, and it is of great financial benefit. Years ago while she was studying, she sold cosmetics to her friends, and that money helped her to cover the costs of her schooling. This is how Monica learned to generate her own resources. Today, while she is working on her thesis project, she is still running the business which will help her cover her costs while she acquires her professional designation. Where her store is now located her mother years ago set up a similar store but it failed. Monica does not foresee the same outcome, because she wants to convert the business into a very successful and sustainable one. She also wants to make this the principal source of income for the household so that her mother can retire from being the family breadwinner. For her great initiative, her mother is very happy and proud of her. This is the first loan for Monica through the MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has joined the group and she has compromised to pay the dues on the dates indicated. With the funds she will purchase soft drinks and snacks for the convenience store she has started.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon A. is a thirty-eight year old married man and the father of four children, all of whom are boys. The firstborn is currently in the senior high school and the rest are in the junior high and the primary schools. His wife is a hardworking woman. She is a farmer and a trader as well. She trades in infant layettes. Solomon lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase, a farming and busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Solomon deals in building materials such as roofing sheets, nails, cement, paint, etc. He sells in a store in the market square and has been in business for four years.

Solomon wants a loan to procure more goods to increase his stock. He is hopeful to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure more building materials to increase his stock

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: Nicanor tiene 54 años de edad, es casado, tiene 10 hijos, de los cuales 5 aun viven en su casa. Desde el momento en que se casó se dedicó a los cultivos, mientras que su esposa es la encargada de pastar las vacas y toros que poseen, los que les sirve para arar sus chacras. Cada viernes, viaja con su carga al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma para la comercialización de sus cosechas, en la foto, Nicanor nos muestra la herramienta llamada “arijo” que utiliza para el arado, y no sólo lo hace para sus cultivos, sino que también lo contratan para arar otras tierras. Gracias a sus ganancias con sus productos (papa y alverja) y su arado pudo mantener y educar a sus numerosos hijos, para los cuales desea invertir en un negocio o taller para cada uno, pues no quiere que sus hijos sean agricultores como él, porque dice que es una actividad muy dura. Nicanor siempre está muy atento para brindar sus servicios a los demás integrantes de su banco comunal, este es su 8vo préstamo consecutivo con MFP, donde ha venido pagando sus cuotas puntualmente. El dinero solicitado en esta oportunidad es para comprar insecticidas, para fumigar su siembra de alverjas que está siendo acechada por mosquitos.
texts.en:
Nicanor is 54 years old, he is married and has 10 children, 5 of whom are still living at home. Since the moment that he married he has been an agriculturer, and his wife has been in charge of shepherding the cows and the bulls that they use to plow the fields. Every Friday, he travels to the city of Tarma where he sells his products. In the photo, Nicanor is demonstrating a toold that is called an "arijo" that is used in the plowing process. He uses it not only for his cultivation but he also is contracted to plow other fields. Thanks his earnings through his products (potatoes and peas) and through his plow he has been able to support and educate his numerous children. He wants to invest in a business or a workshop for each of them so that they will not be farmers like him because he says it's very hard work. Nicanor has always been very attent to providing services to others in the Community Bank. This is his eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he has been on time with all of his payments. The money requested is to purchase insectides to spray his pea plantation because it is being ruined by mosquitoes.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase insecticides

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer B. is 39 years old. He is married and a father with two kids: one is currently in school and the newborn baby is still being breastfed.

Ebenezer is a dealer and supplier of phone cards and phone chips. He also provides repairs and services for his customers. He says the sale of phone credits has become a very lucrative business in Ghana because almost every Ghanaian desires to possess a mobile phone and always recharges his or her phone credit. He buys his supplies from agents at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

He requests this loan in order to enable him to increase his stock of mobile phone credits. He hopes the loan will enable him to increase his savings as well as to expand his shop to include the sale of mobile phones. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Yesu Abusua,’ which literally means 'God’s family.'

loans.use: To increase his stock of mobile-phone credits and unit transfer.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is thirty-seven years old. She is a married woman who has seven children. Five of them are currently pursuing education in the junior and senior high schools. Theresa’s husband is a food crop farmer. Theresa and her family live at a family house in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business. 

Theresa trades in clothing materials and jewelry. She buys textile fabrics, bedspreads, and all kinds of brand new clothes, including ladies’ wear and men’s wear, from Accra, a nearby city, and sells them in her shop in the market square in her community. Theresa has been in this business for seven years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy more textiles to serve her customers. 

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to upgrade her inventory and eventually make very good profits. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called "Abandenden" Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan

loans.use: To purchase clothes and jewelry.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua S. is thirty–nine years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a son who has completed senior high school and is currently in the teacher training college. Her husband is an electrician by profession. Akosua lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akosua is a trader. She trades in food stuffs such as yams. She procures tubers of yam from a town called Afram Plains in the region. She sells them in a store in the market to food vendors and others. Akosua has been in business for one year and desires to expand her business. She hopes to give her son the best of educations.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Percy

texts.es: Percy tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres. Sus padres eran agricultores y sembraban sin la necesidad de fertilizantes químicos, ya de adulto, trabaja con la misma dinámica para sus cultivos de alverjas, pero esta vez sus plantas no se están desarrollando como esperaba, lo cual no entiende el por qué, ya que sembró en chacras cosechadas de papa que ya estaba abonadas. Entonces, se verá obligado a comprar fertilizantes químicos para hacer que se desarrollen las alverjas y den buen fruto. A Percy le gusta mucho las labores agrícolas, en cada temporada siembra alverjas porque son muy rentables y una vez cosechadas las lleva a los mercados de Tarma para venderlas. En sus planes aun no está de hacer familia todavía, quiere sembrar en hectáreas numerosas para ganar más dinero. Percy es un joven muy inquieto y dentro de su grupo es muy bromista, este es el 8vo préstamo que viene trabajando con MFP y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser responsable en efectuar sus pagos en las cuotas señaladas. El dinero que solicita es para comprar de fertilizantes como la urea y nitrato para apurar el desarrolló de acorde al tiempo climatológico sus alverjas.
texts.en:
Percy is 26 years old, single, and lives at home with his parents. His parents were farmers and did their planting without the need for chemical fertilizers. Now that he's an adult, he uses the same method to cultivate his peas. But this time his plants are not developing the way he expected them to and he doesn't understand why since he planted on plots of land planted with potatoes that were already fertilized. So now he will have to buy chemical fertilizers to make the peas grow and produce good returns. Percy loves his agricultural work. He plants peas each season because they are very profitable. He brings them to the market to sell once they are harvested. He doesn't plan to have a family yet. He wants to plant many hectares to earn more money. Percy is a very lively young man and among his friends is considered the jokester. This is his 8th loan with MFP and all this time he has proved to be responsible about making his payments when they are due. The money he is asking for is to buy fertilizers, like urea and nitrate, to make his peas grow more quickly according to the climate.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
SONIA R. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Madres Coraje”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Puerto Maldonado Nº 287, cerca de la I.E. Fray Martín, en el distrito de Callería, tiene 42 años de edad, trabaja en la panadería Rosita, ubicada en su domicilio, su esposo trabaja como panadero y tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales 1 estudia una carrera técnica, 1 está en la secundaria y un bebé de 1 año, motivo por el cual trabaja arduamente en la “Panadería Rosita”.

 Ella tiene 5 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar insumos para elaborar panes y vender al público en general y a bodegas del barrio “El Arenal”. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,700. Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para elaborar los agradables panes y biscochos que ofrece panadería “Rosita” creada hace 42 años.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque sin tanto trámite puede obtener un crédito y mantener su negocio, logrando conservar el legado histórico del negocio
texts.en:
Sonia R. L. belongs to the “Madres Coraje” community bank. She lives at the Jr. Puerto Maldonado Nº 287, near the I.E. Fray Martín, in the Callería district. She works in the Rosita bakery, which is located in her home. Her husband is a baker. They have 3 children. One is studying for a technical career, one is in high school, and they have a 1 year old baby. This is why she works so hard in the Rosita bakery. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy ingredients to make her bread. She sells to the general public and to stores in the El Arenal neighborhood. With a loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy ingredients to make her pleasing breads and desserts that are for sale in the Rosita bakery, which was founded 42 years ago. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos because she can get a loan to maintain her business without so much paperwork. She has been able to conserve the historical legacy of her business

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy  supplies at wholesale

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
El sr. YURI, de 31 años de edad con un hijo de 4 años, es socio del banco comunal, ubicado en ramal cruz pata en chincheros, nuestro socio tiene su actual dirección en santa ana pasaje. La ñuzta c-4 Cusco, el socio está en la comunidad los fines de semana.

Nuestro socio tuvo que dejar su comunidad hace 12 años atrás para poder estudiar, debido a que en está no se cuenta con escuelas superiores y no hay mayor negocios que la agricultura, no hay postas médicas ni restaurantes, en la comunidad existe una bella laguna con una historia espectacular y un albergue que uno de los alcaldes anteriores hizo, pero a falta de mantenimiento se quedó vació y descuidado, el socio extraña mucho su comunidad y a sus familiares, pero el se fue a estudiar informática y marketing en la cuidad del Cusco, y abrirá una cabina de Internet en Cusco, aunque sus sueños reales son de invertir en su pueblo, el aún lo ve con lejanía, porque no hay apoyo privado; el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su cabina de Internet. El socio manifiesta que si alguien está interesado en invertir en su comunidad, pueden escribirle al correo electrónico yurici10@hotmail.com

Nuestro socio agradece este medio y el préstamo que se le otorga y se compromete en cumplir con el pago del mismo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Mr. Yuri is 31 years old, has a four-year old son, and is a member of the communal bank, located in the Cruz Pata branch in Chincheros. Our member’s current address is in Santa Ana Street, La Ñuzta C-4, Cusco; he is in his community during the weekends.

Our member had to leave his community after 12 years to be able to study, given that it does not have superior schools, nor major businesses outside of agriculture, nor first aid centers or restaurants. There exists in the community a beautiful lagoon with a spectacular history and a lodge that one of the earlier mayors built, but it needs maintenance and sits empty and uncared for. The member misses his community and family a lot, but he went to study computer science and marketing in the city of Cusco. He will open an internet café in Cusco, even though his real dream is to invest in his village which he sees somewhere in the future because there is no private support.

The member asks for a loan to invest in his internet café. The member indicates that if someone is interested in investing in his community they can send him an e-mail at yurici10@hotmail.com.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy internet stalls.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina L. is 33 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. All her children are currently in school. She lives in Takroase in the eastern region of Ghana. Regina is very hard working and lovely mother who encourages the youth to be serious with their God-given talents.

Regina sells beverages in her community bar, including Coca Cola, Pepsi, Malta, Sprite, and any other drinks frequently demanded by her customers. Regina started this business six years ago in order to take care of herself and support her husband in taking care of the family. Her husband is a palm plantation farmer who does not earn much to support her business. She therefore is requesting a loan to buy more assorted drinks so she can support her husband in providing for the children. She would be grateful for your support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Hannah Mma,’ which means Hannah’s children.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi, etc.

loans.name: Rerika

texts.es: Rerika tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 3 hijos, en una casa alquilada. Desde su infancia trabajó cuidando los animales que tenían sus padres, pero lo que ella anhelaba era tener un negocio de venta de ropa, sueño que no pudo realizar, ya que cuando formó a su familia, continuó criando animales, pero esta vez, junto a su esposo. Mayormente tiene cerdos, los cuales cría para vender su carne, esta actividad no le resulta muy costosa porque luego de su cosecha y selección de papas, las sobras, le sirven de alimento para sus cerdos. Rerika está muy contenta con la crianza de animales y las labores agrícolas que realiza en compañía de su esposo, sus metas son de adquirir una casa propia para el bienestar de sus hijos que aun están muy pequeños. En todo este tiempo que viene trabajando con MFP ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual en cada uno de sus pagos, y acaba de solicitar su 4to préstamo. Con este dinero comprará alimento concentrado para el rápido engorde a sus cerdos, y también abono para su chacra de papas.
texts.en:
Rerika is 25 years old. She lives with her partner and father of her 3 children in a rented house. She took care of her parent's animals beginning in her childhood, but what she longed for was to have a clothing sales business, a dream she could not fulfill, as when she formed her family, she continued caring for animals, but this time together with her husband. She has mainly pigs, which she raises to sell the meat. This activity has not been expensive for her because after harvesting and selecting her potatoes, the leftovers serve as food for her pigs. Rerika is very happy with caring for animals and the agricultural work that she carries out with her husband. Her goal is to buy her own house for the well-being of her children, who are still very young. In all this time that she has been working with MFP she has proven to be a client who is very punctual with each of her payments, and she has just requested her 4th loan. With this money she will buy concentrated food for the rapid fattening of her pigs, and also fertilizer for her small potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food for her animals

loans.name: Theodora

texts.en:
Theodora Y. is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with three children - two boys and a girl. They are currently pursuing education in primary school. Theodora’s husband works with a mining company. She lives with the family at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are into farming activities.

Theodora trades in textiles and secondhand clothes. She buys textiles and all kinds of secondhand clothes, most especially skirts and ladies slippers and shoes, from Accra, a nearby city, and sells in the market square in her community. She says she has a small shed from which she sells. She has been in business for three years.

Theodora wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure bales of textiles and shoes. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to upgrade her inventory and, eventually, make very good profits.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and shoes for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 56 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. She says some have completed senior high school while others are still in the junior high school. The firstborn is currently studying at the tertiary level. Her husband is in the sand-winning business. Grace lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming and commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.

Grace is a trader. She trades in food items such as yam, tilapia, and vegetables, and she sells on a tabletop in the market square. She procures tubers and other goods from a nearby town called Afram Plains. She has been in business for three years and desires to expand her business. She hopes to give all her children the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure food items for sale.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina tiene 51 años, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos que aun viven en su casa. Desde hace 5 años trabaja como personal de limpieza en un hotel de su barrio, esta actividad le dio el bienestar económico a su hogar estos años. Rufina inicia sus labores a las 7.00am hasta 2.00pm, regresa a su casa por las tardes para descansar porque a las 8.00pm regresa al hotel, pero ya no para limpiar, sino hacer los trabajos de recepcionista hasta las 7.00am del siguiente día. Lo bueno es que su salario es satisfactorio, pero a Rufina lo que más le gusta es realizar los trabajos agrícolas, por ello, los fines de semana y sus días libres acude a sus chacras para apoyar a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos que está dedicado a sus cultivos. Sus planes a futuro son de comprarse otros terrenos de cultivo, para que puedan sembrar alternadamente y duplicar sus ganancias, para sí no tener la necesidad de trabajar en el hotel. Rufina ingresa por primera en un grupo solidario, y está muy contenta de trabajar con los demás integrantes, además se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada una de las cuotas programadas por su asesora de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para los cultivos que viene realizando su esposo.
texts.en:
Rufina is 51 years old. She is a single mother. She has 5 children who still live in her house. For the last 5 years she has been working as a cleaning lady in a hotel in her neighborhood. This activity has provided for the financial well-being of her home for these years. Rufina begins working from 7:00am until 2:00pm, then returns home in the afternoons to rest because at 8:00pm she returns to the hotel, but this time not to clean, rather to work as a receptionist until 7:00am the following day. The good thing is that her salary is satisfactory, but the thing Rufina likes the most is to do agricultural work. For this reason on weekends and her days off she goes to her small farms to support her husband and one of her children who is dedicated to its cultivation. Her future plans are to purchase other fields, so that they can plant in rotation and double their profit, for herself to no longer need to work in the hotel. Rufina is joining a solidarity group, and is very happy to work with the other members, and likewise commits to pay punctually each of the installments scheduled by her credit adviser. The money that she is requesting is to purchase fertilizers for her husband's crops.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
VICTORIA V. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, tiene 49 años de edad, su número de celular es 961658431. Se dedica a la venta de madera al por mayor y menor, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo mayor de edad que la ayuda en su negocio.

Ella tiene 6 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar palos de escoba y leñas, con el fin de emprender un nuevo negocio en el sector forestal. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará 2500 piez de madera, de las especies capirona y tornillo, con el propósito de mantener y expandir  su pequeño negocio.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya por medio de créditos  y charlas que le brindan las promotoras, permitiéndola solventar sus gastos y seguir prosperando en el sector forestal.
texts.en:
VICTORIA V. V., is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Margaritas”, with her home located in the district of Yarina Cocha. She is 49 years old. Her cellular phone number is 961658431. She sells wood wholesale and retail. She is a single mother, and she has 1 older child who helps her with her business. She has been working for 6 years with Manuela Ramos and the first loan that she received was for a sum of 300 Nuevo Sol (Peruvian Currency). She used it to purchase broom handles and logs, for the purpose of starting a new business in the forestry sector. With this loan of 2000 Nuevo Sol, she will purchase 2500 feet of wood, of the capirona and tornillo varieties, for the purpose of maintaining and expanding her small business. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support by means of loans and chats that the promoters have given to her, allowing her to clear her expenses and continue prospering in the forestry sector.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood wholesale

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa K. is 47 years old. She is divorced and the mother of three children. Currently, two of her children are in school while the elder one is learning a trade. Her husband left for Kumasi is the Ashanti region and she was told that he has gotten himself a new wife without giving her notice.

Yaa has been sewing for 26 years now. She is a specialist in women’s wear and her skills and designs are first class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, children’s school uniforms, etc.

Yaa wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc., to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work Yaa has two apprentices to whom she is giving quality training for their future support.

She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with quality education. She belongs to the village bank called “Hannah Mma” which means “Hannah’s children”.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer cuenta con 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo, hace muy poco se mudaron a su propia casa. En los años de su infancia se dedicaba a las labores agrícolas con sus padres, pero ahora que formó su propia familia tiene nuevas visiones de vida, por ello que hace dos años puso una bodega en su casa, con el apoyo y motivación de su esposa. Y cuando tiene que ir de compras a la ciudad para surtir su bodega, van en compañía de su esposa, porque ella es muy buena buscando y negociando los mejores precios. Wilmer está muy contento por la prosperidad de su bodega, sus planes son de ir incrementando su negocio, para que sea más rentable, e ir comprando los utensilios y artefactos que hacen falta en su casa. Wilmer es un cliente muy dinámico y activo en cada una de las actividades que realiza su banco comunal, además es muy puntual en sus pagos. Este es el 9no crédito que viene trabajando con MFP. Y el dinero que solicita es para incrementar la mercadería de su bodega, así podrá captar mayor cantidad de clientela.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 24 years old. He lives with his partner and mother of his son. Not long ago they moved to their own home. In his childhood years he did agricultural work with his parents, but now that he has formed his own family he has new life visions. It is for this reason that two years ago he put a grocery store in his home, with the support and motivation of his wife. And when he has to go shopping in the city to supply his grocery store, he goes with his wife, because she is very good at searching for and negotiating the best prices. Wilmer is very happy with the prosperity of his grocery store. His plans are to increase his business, so that it is more profitable, and to purchase the utensils and appliances that are needed in his house. Wilmer is a very dynamic and active client in each of the activities conducted by his communal bank, and is also very punctual with his payments. This is his 9th loan working with MFP. And the money that he is requesting is to increase the merchandise of his grocery store, so that he can attract more clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina A. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has three daughters and a son who are all currently in the basic school. She lives with her family at Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Regina’s husband is food crop farmer. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband provide for the family. She has been in business for ten years now. She sells items such as gari, rice, groundnuts, tins of tomato, milk, sugar etc. She procures her goods from wholesalers in the big towns around such as Nkawkaw.

She seeks a loan to expand the size of her shop and also buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her save more to support her family, especially her children’s educations. She belongs to a trust bank group called Heaven. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana Y. is fifty-nine years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. She says all of her children are out of school and working. Juliana says she lives with her sisters in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

She is a trader. She trades in second-hand textiles – clothes for both sexes and also bed sheets. She procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days.

Juliana has been in business for two years and desires to expand her business. She is hoping to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To procure second hand textiles

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina A. is married with 3 children and received an education through junior high school. Since 1997 Georgina has worked as a trader in Elmina, selling goods such as food items, utensils and rubbers.  While Georgina works as a trader, her husband is employed as a mason. Georgina uses her income to help her husband in paying for her family’s expenses.  She will use the loan to purchase additional goods such as food items, utensils and rubbers in order to expand her business.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Georgina plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Anita Elizabeth

texts.es:
ANITA ELIZABETH S. S. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, vive en el distrito de Callería, ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 44 años de edad, trabaja como consultora de productos de belleza, su esposo trabaja como transportista y tienen 3 hijos.

Ella tiene 5 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para invertir en la venta de abarrotes al por menor en las afueras de su casa. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará prendas de vestir y productos de belleza para venderlas al contado y a corto plazo.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la ayuda a tener un capital con el que puede trabajar, beneficiando directamente a sus hijos.
texts.en:
ANITA ELIZABETH S. S. A., is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Margaritas”. She lives in the district of Callería, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 44 years old and works as a beauty product consultant. Her husband works as a carrier and they have 3 children. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 5 years, and the first loan that she received was for the sum of 300 Nuevo S. (Peruvian Currency). She used it to invest in retail grocery sales in the outskirts of her home. With this loan of 2,000 Nuevo S., she will purchase articles of clothing and beauty products to sell for cash in the short term. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, because she helps her to have capital with which she can work, directly benefiting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products.  Purchase of articles of clothing.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia N. is 30 years old. She is married and mother of one child (a girl). She lives with her husband and the children. Currently her child is in school in the community where they live in the eastern region of Ghana. Her husband is a diamond miner. They live in a community endowed with natural resources like gold and diamonds.

Leticia is a local manufacturer of Soaps. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to create her soaps. Leticia has ten years experience in soap manufacturing. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds to buy raw materials. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to increase her income to support her children's education. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Hannah Mma’ which means Hannah’s children.

loans.use: To scale up production of soaps

loans.name: Yesi

texts.es: Yesi de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en la casa de sus padres. El labrado de la tierra es parte de su vida, y su única fuente de ingresos, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo. Yesi tiene un bebé al que debe cuidar, por lo que se siente muy triste cuando su hijo llora mientras ella realiza sus tareas en la chacra llevándolo en la espalda, y como madre se siente impotente de no poder brindarle comodidad a su pequeño, ya que si Yesi no trabaja en el campo, su esposo solo, no avanza con las labores. Ahora siembran papa en las tierras que les prestó su padre, y sus cosechas le han resultado muy rentables, y de ello se siente muy feliz. Con este tipo de trabajo, sus padres le dieron comodidades, y eso espera alcanzar también para el bienestar de su familia, por eso, primero quiere comprar las chacras de sus padres para contar con su propio terreno de cultivo. Yesi en una mujer callada, pero muy responsable en efectuar sus pagos, este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y le tiene mucha estima y cariño a la institución por la oportunidad brindada. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para la chacra de papas que tiene sembrada en terrenos temporales.
texts.en:
Yesi is 22 years old. She lives with her partner and her two children in her parent's house. Working the earth is part of her life, her only source of income, and an activity she carries out with her husband. Yesi has a baby that she must take care of, for whom she feels very sad when her baby cries while she is carrying out her work in the small farm, carrying him on her back. And as a mother she feels very helpless since she can't offer her little one any comfort, since if Yesi does not work in the field, her husband alone does not make progress with the work. Now they are planting potatoes in the land that her father loaned them, and her harvests have been very profitable, and for this she feels very happy. With this type of work, her parents are comfortable, and she hopes to reach this too, for the well-being of her family. For this, first she would like to purchase her parent's small farms to have her own land to cultivate. Yesi is a quiet woman, but she is very responsible in making her payments. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she holds much esteem and affection to the institution for the opportunity offered. The money that she is requesting is to purchase fertilizer for the small potato farm that she has planted in temporary land.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Ablavi Emma

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale.  Elle fait face présentement à une rupture de stock. Elle veut se réapprovisionner et demande à WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter 05 sachets de bonbons, 05 cartons de tomate en bois, 04 cartons de détergents OMO, 06 cartons de couscous et divers autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who resides in Kégué, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. To earn an income, she does commerce in grocery items. She is presently coping with inventory shortages. She wants to resupply herself and is asking WAGES for her first loan, which will enable her to buy five bags of candy, five boxes of canned tomatoes, four boxes of OMO detergent, six boxes of couscous, and various other items. She is married and the mother of three.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to one daughter who has completed school and is also married. Veronica lives with her husband, who is currently jobless, in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Veronica is a trader. She trades in smoked fish and tilapia. She procures the goods from nearby towns and sells on a tabletop in the market square. She has been in business for four years and desires to expand her business. She is hoping to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Carmen Romelia

texts.es:
CARMEN ROMELIA A. D. RUÍZ, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Río Pisqui Nº 265, en el barrio “El Arenal”, en el distrito D. Callería, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 53 años D. edad, es comerciante independiente, su esposo trabaja en la Municipalidad  D. la localidad y tienen 4 hijos mayores D. edad.

Ella tiene 6 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto D. S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar pollos y bebidas, con el fin D. trabajar su capital y solventar sus gastos. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,800. Nuevos Soles, comprará ropas importadas y néctar D. cocona (fruta D. la zona), con el propósito D. mantener y hacer  trabajar su capital, permitiéndola solventar sus gastos.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya por medio D. los créditos  y las charlas que le brindan las promotoras (capacitación), permitiéndole prosperar en los diferentes negocios a los que se dedica.
texts.en:
CARMEN ROMELIA A. D. RUÍZ belongs to the community bank “Las Margaritas”. Her home is located in Jr. Río Pisqui, number 265, in the neighborhood called “El Arenal”, in the district of Callería, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 53 years old and is an independent merchant. Her husband works for the local municipality, and they have 4 grown children. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 6 years. Her first loan that she received was for the amount of S/ 300 Nuevos Soles. She used it to buy chickens and drinks, with the goal of working capital and meeting her expenses. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, because the help of the loans and the chats that the Capacity Promoters offer permit her to prosper in the different businesses that she works in.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy imported clothing and cocona (local fruit) nectar

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba I., 46, is the married mother of five children. Abiba is resourceful and enterprising: she has supported one child to graduation from high school through her business, and two more are presently in the junior high school. The rest are grown up, married, and living with their husbands.

Abiba and her husband, a farmer, live in a mining community. She operates a local restaurant and sells traditional local foods like "banku," which is prepared from milled maize grains, generally taken with hot pepper or soup. She has 20 years of experience in food production. She sells some of her food at a nearby pub in the community where she lives, and some of it is sold in the community's mining area.

Abiba reports that prices of raw materials have gone up significantly, and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditures. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business in order to scale up production and to maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She belongs to a village bank called "Hannah Mma," which means "Hannah’s children."

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Frederick K. is a forty-six year old married man and a father of three children, one of whom is a male. According to him, all of his children are attending senior high school. His wife is a hard working woman who works with him to operate a provisions store and boutique business. Frederick lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the town of Achiase. Achiase is a farming and busy trading community in the eastern region of Ghana. 

Frederick runs a provisions store and also owns a boutique shop. His store is by the roadside. He procures his goods from suppliers who distribute their merchandise from vans. Frederick has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to procure more goods to increase his stock. 

He is hoping to provide his children with the best of education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions for his store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali A. is 49 years old. She is married with five kids. She is resourceful and supportive of her family. Currently, two of her children are in school while the rest of them work. She lives in community named Takroase, which is located in the eastern region of Ghana. Takroase and its environs are full of mining businesses and palm nut plantations. This has created jobs for many young people in the community. Her husband is a diamond miner. 

Ali operates a local restaurant and sells local foods such as cooked rice balls and “waakye.” Waakye is prepared from rice and beans and is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch and supper. Ali has been in this business for the past 15 years. She says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford the cost. This has affected production quality adversely.  She is requesting the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality. The loan will be used to buy more raw materials including rice, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. 

She belongs to a village bank called ‘Hannah Mma’ which means Hannah’s children.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials including maize, rice, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent O. is forty–six years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says that two of her children attend university, one attends senior high school, and the youngest primary school. Millicent lives with her children in a family house in a farming/commercial town named Achiase, which is near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. Her brother helps her to take care of the children. 

Millicent is a trader. She runs a provision store by the roadside. Millicent procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda.
She has been in this business for two years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to procure provisions

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is a 40 year old woman. She is married and has four children. All of her kids are in school. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home in Takroase, a suburb of Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She is an achiever and a resourceful young woman. She loves selling goods, which is the business through which she makes a living. 

Esther has been selling crates of eggs at the community market for more than thirteen years. She treks to the surrounding villages in the Ashanti region of Ghana to purchase eggs in bulk from farmers and sells retail to her customers. Due to a lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to purchase enough stock to make a sufficient profit to support her family. She wants to use part of her profits to support her childrens' education. 

Esther would be grateful for your assistance with the loan.  The funds will enable her to purchase eggs in bulk and enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan will enable her to save more income to support her business growth. 

She belongs to a village bank called ‘Hannah Mma’ which means Hannah’s children.

loans.use: to purchase crates of eggs

loans.name: Ema Victoria

texts.es:
EMA VICTORIA C. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Productivas”, 
su domicilio está ubicado en el Jr. Walter S/N Mz. A Lt.6, cerca al “Aserradero Ezcurra”, en el Asentamiento Humano Santa Clara, en el distrito de Manantay, tiene 49 años de edad.  Ella tiene una bodega instalada en su propia casa; su esposo trabaja en la aserradero Ezcurra y tienen 7 hijos.

Ella tiene 3 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar productos de consumo básico para vender en su nueva bodega, ubicada en su propio domicilio. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000. Nuevos Soles, lo cual invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, entre otros. 

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya con créditos financieros, que permiten mantener y ampliar los productos que ofrece en su bodega, contribuyendo económicamente en su hogar.
texts.en:
EMA VICTORIA C. R. belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Productivas” (Productive Women). Her home is located at Jr. Walter S/N Mz. A Lt.6, close to the sawmill Ezcurra, in the Asentamiento Humano Santa Clara, in the district of Manantay. She is 49 years old. She has a shop installed in her own home; her husband works in the sawmill Ezcurra, and they have 7 children. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 3 years, and the first loan that she received was for the amount of S/ 300 Nuevos Soles. She used it to buy basic grocery products to sell in her new store, located in her own home. With this loan of S/ 1,000 Nuevos Soles she would invest in the purchase of basic grocery products like rice, sugar, vermicelli noodles, among others. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, because of the help with the financial loans, which permit her to maintain and increase the products that she offers in her store, contributing economically to her household.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vermicelli, toilet paper, salt, milk, etc.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Kokou K. est un jeune homme de 28 ans, célibataire sans enfants. il tient un cabinet de traitement de texte, de photocopie et de vente des accessoires de matériels informatiques. Cette activité lui est rentable. Il souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son activité en payant de nouveaux appareils qui lui permettront de mieux exécuter ses tâches. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie.
texts.en:
Kokou K. is a young man, 28 years of age, single and without children. He maintains an shop with equipment for text editing, photocopying and the sale of computer accessories and materials. This is a profitable business for him. With this loan he hopes to increase his business by buying new equipment, allowing him to improve his operation. He expects that this opportunity will improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new phorocopier and computer accessories for resale.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina T. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one daughter and three sons. She says that her daughter has completed school and is married. The youngest child attends primary school whereas her other two sons are out of school and work. Regina lives with her children and husband in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, which is near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. Regina works to support her husband in providing for the family.

She is a trader and operates a provisions store by the roadside. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. Regina has been in this business for two years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to procure provisions

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra A. is 26 years old. She is a divorced mother with one child, a girl. Sandra is an entrepreneur, dynamic, and very dedicated to her work. She divorced some few months ago and the child’s father is not taking responsibility for the child, which means the family burdens rest on Sandra’s shoulders.

Sandra has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for over seven years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts. She produces palm oil and supplies it to food vendors who use it to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods elsewhere when demand becomes very high. Her major business area is the neighboring country Togo in West Africa. She sends gallons of palm oil to retail at Togo and, when she is returning, she buys clothing materials and retails them in her community.

Prices of raw materials are very high making it difficult for Sandra to achieve her target. And it is her dream to achieve her target through loan support. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm nuts, and containers to increase her efficiency by producing in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her child’s education.

Sandra belongs to a village bank called “Hannah Mma” which means “Hannah’s children”.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nuts and containers

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
IRIS MANSICIDOR C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio ubicado en la Urbanización el Bosque Mz. D Lt 9., en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, tiene 35 años de edad. Es profesora, pero se dedica a la Venta de sabanas y productos Leonisa (ropa interior femenina).  Su esposo realiza producción de documentales y tienen 4 menores hijos.

Ella tiene 2 años y medio trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar productos Leonisa y dedicarse a la venta de dichos productos, contribuyendo con los gastos en su hogar. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000. Nuevos Soles, comprará productos Leonisa (ropa interior), sábanas, algunos productos de belleza y dedicarse a la venta de dichos productos, con el fin de solventar los gastos de sus hijos.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya con los créditos y trabajar su propio capital.
texts.en:
IRIS MANSICIDOR C. belongs to the community bank “Las Margaritas”. Her home is located in the Urbanización el Bosque Mz. D Lt 9., in the district of Yarina Cocha. She is 35 years old. She is a teacher, but she works selling sheets and Leonisa products (women’s underwear). Her husband works making documentaries, and they have 4 young children. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for two and a half years. The first loan that she received was for the amount of S/ 300 Nuevo Soles. She used it to buy Leonisa products and to work at the sales of those products, contributing to the expenses of the household. With this loan of S/2.000 Nuevos Soles, she would buy Leonisa products (underwear), sheets, some beauty products, and work selling those products, with the goal of meeting the expenses of her children. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos, because of the help of the loans and to work her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy things to wear (underwear), sheets, and beauty products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther K. is thirty-nine-years-old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one daughter and two sons. She says one of her children is in the junior high school while the others are in primary school. She says she lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Esther works to support her husband financially to provide for the family.

Esther is a trader. She runs a provision shop in the market square and sells footwear as well. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. Esther has been in business for over ten years and desires to expand her business.

Esther is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the university level.

loans.use: To procure more provisions for her store

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 29 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos en edad escolar, su esposo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y la casa que habitan es propia. Tiene un lavadero de motos y motocarros en la parte de afuera de su domicilio, este servicio lo viene realizando desde hace un año atrás y atiende desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Le gusta su trabajo porque de esa manera se relaciona con muchas personas, por lo demás Ana da una buena atención a sus clientes porque es lo primordial, nos dice. La rentabilidad de su lavadero radica en que se encuentra en un lugar muy transitable y aducen varios vehículos durante el día. Ana tiene 11 préstamos con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son solidarios y hay mucha comunicación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una bomba de pozo, un cabezal nuevo para sus mangueras y mandara a poner un techo adecuado a su lavadero, ya que se encuentra a la intemperie.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old. She is the mother of 2 school aged children. Her husband works in passenger transport and the house that they live in is their own. She has a carwash for motorcycles and cars in the outside part of her home. She has been providing this service for a year now, and she attends the carwash from 6 in the morning until 7 at night. She also has the help of her children. She likes her work because in this manner she interacts with many people. Ana gives good attention to her clients because this is of first importance, she tells us. The profitability of her carwash is based on the fact that she is located in a very busy location, and there are many vehicles throughout the day. Ana has had 11 loans with MFP and she likes working with the community bank because all her friends are alone, and there is much socialising. With the money that she is asking for, she would buy a well pump, a new head for her hose, and place an order to add an adequate roof on her carwash, as at the moment she can be found out under the sky.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer
