The money being requested will be invested in the purchase of beverages, and on fixing up her shop so as to be more inviting to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory of beverages.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Maritza del Socorro M. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Maritza tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Maritza es venta la de mariscos, ella dio inicio este negocio hace 7 años comprando las cantidades camarones y pescados en pequeñas cantidades, por lo que sus productos los ofrece de manera ambulante. Los propósitos de Doña Maritza son de mantener su negocio activo. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar los mariscos que sus clientes solicitan. El deseo de Doña Maritza es darle mejoras a su vivienda y aumentar su producción y obtener un lugar estable para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza del Socorro M., 49, is married and has 3 children who attend school. Maritza sells seafood. She started this business 7 years ago by buying small quantities of shrimp and fish. She sells her products as a traveling vendor. Maritza’s intention is to maintain an active business. The loan is for working capital to buy the seafood that her customers request. Maritza wishes to makes improvements on her house, increase production, and obtain a fixed place to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Melesio

texts.es: Melesio tiene 56 años, es padre soltero, reciente su esposa lo abandonó y le dejó con sus dos menores hijos. Él tiene un bote motor donde, junto a su cuñado, se dedican a la pesca en el río Ucayali, y venden sus pescados en el puerto, a los revendedores, o a veces tienen pedidos de una empresa que requiere mayores cantidades para procesarlos. En esta actividad ya lleva 30 años y le va muy bien; adicionalmente, Melesio trabaja también en la tala de árboles madereros, y con ambas actividades reúne el dinero necesario para el sostenimiento de su familia. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y ha notado que trabajar con su banco comunal es muy provechoso, porque entre todos los integrantes se apoyan mutuamente. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la pesca.
texts.en:
Melesio, 56, is a single father. His wife recently abandoned him, and she left him with their two youngest children. He has a motor boat. Together with his brother-in-law he fishes in the Ucayali River. They sell their fish at the port, to resellers, or sometimes they have business orders that need large quantities to fill. He has been doing this for 30 years, and he does well. Melesio also works cutting down wood-yielding trees. Through both activities he is able to get together enough money to sustain his family. This is his first loan with MFP. He has observed that working with his community bank is beneficial because all of the members support each other. The loan is to buy fishing materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fishing materials

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 59 años, es madre de 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes, en la actualidad vive sólo con su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a confeccionar ropa para niños y adultos en el pequeño taller que acondicionó en su casa para esto. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que sus clientes tienen confianza en su buena labor y la recomiendan, por ello que sus pedidos van aumentando. Con MFP ya y tiene 8 préstamos, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque entre todos los integrantes se entienden y tienen mucha comunicación. Con el dinero que solicita comprará telas, hilos y demás materiales para confeccionar ropa y llevarla a vender a los mercados.
texts.en:
Nelly is 59-year-old mother of 5 children who are now independent. She currently lives alone with her husband, who works in agriculture. For 18 months she has made clothing for children and adults in the little workshop that she has arranged in her house. What she would like from her job is that her clients have confidence in her labor and that they recommend her, so that requests for her work increase in the future. With MFP she has already held 8 loans, and she likes to work with her comunal bank because all of the associates understand one another and communicate a great deal. With the money that she is asking for she will by cloth and other materials to make more clohting, and to bring it for sale in the markets.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Nerva

texts.es: Nerva tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus padres y sus 2 hijos. Cuenta con 8 habitaciones construidas en un espacio dentro de su casa, los mismos que los alquila a jóvenes estudiantes o personas solteras. Con esta actividad ya lleva 7 años y le va muy bien, ya que sus inquilinos cumplen puntualmente con sus pagos y no causan ningún problema durante su estadía. Lo que le gusta a Nerva es que  conoce a varias personas, en su mayoría jóvenes  con los que puede conversar y muchas veces darles algún consejo. Para más adelante, también le gustaría acondicionar unos corrales en su casa para poder criar pollos. Este es su préstamo número 11 con MFP, y hasta el momento considera que su trabajo con su banco comunal es muy positivo y satisfactorio, tanto para su crecimiento personas, como para realizar adecuadamente cualquier actividad económica. El dinero que vienen solicitando lo invertirá en la reparación y remodelación de sus habitaciones, para que sus inquilinos se sientan mucho más a gusto.
texts.en:
Nerva is 43 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her parents and 2 children. She has 8 constructed rooms in a space within her house that she rents to young students or other individuals. This activitiy, which she has been carrying out for 7 years, has been going very well. Her renters complete payments punctually and never cause a problem during their stay. What she would like is to meet various people, who on the majority are young, with whom she can converse and give advice. Further on in the future, she would also like to arrange for corrals in her house to be able to raise chickens. This is her 11th loan with MFP, and she has, up to this point, considered her work with her comunal bank to be positive and satisfactory, in that it has helped her grow as a person much as much as it has helped her realize whatever economic activity she engages in. With the money that she is soliciting, she will invest in the repair and remodeling of her rooms, so that her renters will feel more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling her rooms.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
La señora Adela es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando por el Desarrollo”, del distrito Cabanilla, Provincia de Lampa, en el departamento de Puno; ella tiene 42 años de edad, ella madre es soltera, tiene 8 hijos, estudio hasta segundo grado de secundaria.

La señora Adela  viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado menor, ella solicito su primer préstamo de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo invirtió en comprar ovejas para el engorde, indica que las vende en la feria de Cabanillas, a veces ella vende en carne y lo lleva a la ciudad de Arequipa.

Ahora viene solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, este dinero piensa invertirlo en capital y comprar ganado mayor.  Este crédito será pagado en 06 cuotas.
 Ella se siente  contenta por pertenecer a Movimiento Manuela Ramos y agradece por confiar en ellas. Adela desea seguir mejorando en su negocio para educar a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Adela is an associate of the comunal bank "Mujeres Trabajando por el Desarrollo" (Women working for Development), of the district Cabanilla, in the Lamp Provence, in the State of Puno. She is a 42 year old single mother, has 8 chldren, and studied up until the second level of secondary school. Adela has worked with Movimento Maunela Ramos for 3 years. She buys and sells small livestock. Her first loan was of 300 new soles, which she invested in buying sheep to fatten them and sell in the fair of Cbanillas. Sometimes she sells it in the form of meat in the city of Arequipa. Now she is asking for a new loan of 3000 new soles, that she thinks she iwll invest in capital and more livestock. This loan will be paid in 6 quotas. Adela is happy that she belongs to Movimiento Manuela Ramos and is grateful that she can confide in them. Adela wishes to continue improving her business so that she can provide education to her younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell livestock.

loans.name: Henry Ronald

texts.es:
El Henry Ronald P. R. esta casado con la señora Mary Tania Averanga Paxi   tiene tres hijos pequeños, en la mañana el atiende la tienda y su esposa se dedica a los enseres del hogar a partir de las 14:00 después de recoger a sus niños del colegio la esposa es la que se encarga de atender la tienda.
El señor no trabaja con otra institución financiera es la primera vez que saca un crédito fue recomendado por una cliente antigua.
Su negocio consiste en la compra y venta de artículos de primera necesidad como arroz, fideo, harina, conservas y otros. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una zona comercial de la ciudad de La Paz por tanto tiene buena venta.
Gracias a este negocio el vive tranquilo con su familia y espera en un futuro poder comnparar un terreno para poder tener una casa, ya que el vive en casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Mr. Henry Ronald P. R. is married to Mrs. Mary Tania Averanga Paxi, they have three small children. In the morning he attends to their store while his wife takes care of the household. After picking up their children at 2 PM from school, his wife is in charge of taking care of the store. He does not work with any other financial institution and this is the first time that he is taking out a loan, an older customer recommended it to him. His business consists of the purchase and sale of essential goods, such as rice, noodles, flour, canned good and other things. His business is located in a commercial zone in La Paz, so sales are good. Thanks to this business he lives a peaceful life with his family and he hopes in the future to buy a plot of land to be able to have a house, as he currently lives in a house with their in-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renting contract for their store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn P. owns 1.5 hectares of land. She grows rice to meet the needs of her family. She is 45-years old and all of her five children are in school. Her husband, Rene P., is the one managing their farm. They have been together for more than 20 years already.To supplement their income, the couple also grows vegetables in their backyard.

Merlyn is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy four sacks of rice seed and three bags of urea fertilizers. Merlyn believes that her loan will bring her good returns and a good harvest. The loan will truly help her earn better income for their needs.

CEVI is reaching out to people, especially the poor, to start their own businesses. CEVI gives all its clients not just credit, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane Q. is managing a small rice field. She is 44-years old, married and has three children. Her husband, Pedro Q., is a barangay councilor. They work very hard to provide for all the needs of their family. Mary Jane worked as a volunteer social worker for a children's foundation before. She stopped volunteering when she got married because she needed to have more time at home than at work.

Mary Jane is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. Fertilizers are essential to improve the soil conditions. She needs fertilizers to increase her yield.

CEVI is a non-profit organization set up to respond to the needs of small businessmen. It not only provides credit to its clients, but offers training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn L. is a pig grower. She is 37-years old and has two children in school. She worked as a salesclerk in one of the department stores in Bohol before. She quit her job, got married and decided to manage a small piggery and rice farm. Aside from pigs and rice, Jovelyn also grows vegetables and raises chickens to supplement their income.

Jovelyn is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy piglets, pig feed and fertilizer. The loan will help her increase the size of her pig business. It will also help to increase her harvest to meet her family's needs.

CEVI is reaching out to people to start their own businesses. It gives its clients not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida J. manages a small sari-sari (variety) store business in her village. She is 43 years old and has two children in school. Her husband, Wilfredo J., is a farmer. They work together to support their family's growing needs. Aside from having a store, they own a 2-hectare rice farm. They have grown rice since they were married. Most of their harvest is intended for family use; the rest is sold in their sari-sari store for additional income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI (a Kiva partner). She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. The loan will help her attract more customers and increase her sales. Some of the loan also will be used to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to help start and have their own business. CEVI gives their clients not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Rufina Valeriana

texts.es:
La señora Valeriana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, del sector Chaquimayo, en el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 10 hijos, ella tuvo estudios de tercero de primaria (incompleta). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, es una de las fundadoras de su banco; ella se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, para poder adquirir ovejas para engorde y un poco de alimento balanceado. 

Ella desea seguir creciendo por ello viene solicitando un préstamo de S/ 1700.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir ganado mayor para engorde (toros) con lo que obtendrá mas ingresos, uno de sus deseos es poder comprase una casa en la ciudad de Juliaca y ver profesionales a sus últimos hijos; le gusta la forma de trabajo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Valeriana is a member of the community bank “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“ in the sector of Chaquimayo of the district of Cabanilla, province of Lampa, department of Puno. She is 48 years old, married and has 10 children. She did not finish Grade 3. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years an dis one of the founding members of her bank. Her business is raising cattle. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to buy sheep to fatten and some balanced feed. She wants to continue growing and so is requesting a loan for 1,700 soles which she will repay in six instalments. She will use this loan to buy adult livestock (bulls) as these will generate greater profits. One of her wishes is to buy a house in the city of Juliaca and to see her younger children have careers. She likes working with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle (bulls)

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda owns a small piggery business. She started her business in 2004 and still raises pigs to support the needs of her five children. Aside from pigs, she also owns a rice field. Her husband, Rodrigo, is sick. She alone is managing their business to earn a living.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy pig feed to grow her pigs. Currently she has five piglets and one sow. She wants to make the business grow to send all her children to school and to buy medicines for her husband.

CEVI is a non-stock, non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, start and have their own livelihoods. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Metrihon

texts.ru: Свой новый займ Мехрихон собирается потратить на обновления ассортимента весенней одежды. Она планирует съездить за товаром на потовый рынок, и поэтому подала заявку, чтобы покрыть часть своих дорожных расходов. Чтобы иметь хорошую реализацию сейчас, когда экономический кризис и торговля не такая как раньше нужно привозить только те товары, которые востребованы рынком. Мехрихон и собирается сделать это.
texts.en:
Metrihon plans to use her new loan to renew the assortment of the spring clothing. She plans to travel for the merchandise to the wholesale market and has applied for a loan to cover part of her travel expenses. To have a good turnaround of goods right now when there's an economical crisis and the sales are not as good as before, she has to bring only the merchandise which the market demands. Metrihon plans to do exactly that.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for the business travel expenses

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La señora Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, del sector Cagge,  el distrito D. Cabanilla, D. la provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, tiene 53 años D. edad,  es casada, y tiene 05 hijo, ella posee estudios D. segundo D. primaria. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace tiempo, actualmente ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado menor, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar ovejas, cerdos. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea comprar más ganado y tener buenas ganancias, indica que comprar el gnado D. la feria D. Cabanillas y lo venD. en lo mismo.

Ella agradece a Movimiento Manuela R.  por su apoyo a las mujeres.
texts.en:
Basilia is a member of the community bank “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, in the sector of Cagge, district of Cabanilla in the province of Lampa, department of Puno. She is 53 years old, married and has five children. She completed GraD. 2. She has been working with Manuela R. for a while. She currently buys and sells small livestock. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to buy sheep and pigs. She is now asking for an additional loan of 1,500 soles which she is committed to repaying in six instalments. She will use this loan to buy more livestock and make good profits. She mentioned that she buys her livestock at the market in Cabanilla and later resells them there as well. She thanks Movimiento Manuela R. for the support they proviD. to women.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Gulshodahon

texts.ru: После получения своего прошлого займа бизнес Гулшодахон заметно вырос. Ассортимент теперь включает не только мужскую одежду, но различные мелкие товары. Гулшодахон довольна, что получила займ на КИВА и расширила свой бизнес. В ее семье все в порядке, муж устроился на работу, а дети продолжают учебу в школе. Гулшодахон надеется на новый займ приобрести еще больше товара и увеличить прибыль.
texts.en:
After receiving her last loan, Gulshodahon's business has noticeably grown. The assortment of goods includes not only men's clothing, but also different kinds small items. Gulshodahon is satisfied that she took out a loan from Kiva and has expanded her business. Her family is doing well, her husband has found a job and her children continue studies at school. Gulshodahon hopes to use her new loan to buy more merchandise and increase her profits.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is for four borrowers and the group leader is Mr. S., age 27. S. makes his daily income by running a motor taxi. Besides his job, he also uses his motorbike to transport vegetables to the market for his wife to sell. He and his wife now live with their two children who are teenagers and attend school. The couple are sacrificing parents who want to invest in their children's future by providing them with an education.

Unfortunately, S. can't attract as many clients to take his service as before because his motorbike also needs to be repaired. Thus he would like a loan to add with his personal savings in order to buy a new motorcycle to replace the old one.

The other three borrowers include: S., a local farmer requesting a loan to use as capital in the farming business; M., who sells fresh flowers in the market and applies for a loan as capital to begin selling groceries; and R., who is a cleaning staff member for a company and is seeking a loan to cultivate rice.

The borrowers are villagers living in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Safrohon

texts.ru: Сафрохон 41 год, замужем и имеет 4 детей. Муж работает, а Сафрохон занимается предпринимательством. Старшие дети учатся в школе, самая младшая в этом году заканчивает 2 класс. Сафрохон торгует детской одеждой и привозит ее с оптовых рынков сама. Имеет собственный прилавок на центральном рынке и чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара решила получить займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Safrohon is 41 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is working and Safrohon is a business woman. Her older children are studying at school and her youngest daughter is graduating from second grade this year. Safrohon sells children's clothing which she brings herself from the wholesale markets. She has her own vendor space at the central market and decided to apply for a loan at Kiva to increase the assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Rotifahon

texts.ru: Ротифахон 38 лет. 10 послежних лет она занимается предпринимательством и  торгует детской одеждой. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. За детьми дома смотрит свекровь, а Ротифахон выходит на рынок торговать. Раньше года 3 назад Ротифахон не имела постоянной торговой точки и поэтому выезжала на различные рынки, где часы торговли были ограничены 5-6 часами. Сейчас она торгует целый день и прибыли остается больше. Она собирается расширить ассортимент и подала заявку на займ.
texts.en:
Rotifahon is 38 years old. For the past 10 years she has been an entrepreneur and sells children’s clothing. She is married and has 2 children. Her mother-in-law watches the children at home and Rotifahon goes to the market to sell. Earlier, around 3 years ago, Rotifahon did not have a permanent sales location and because of this traveled to different markets where sales hours were limited to 5-6 hours. Now she sells for the entire day and has more income left over. She plans to expand her product selection and has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand product selection

loans.name: Och's Group

texts.en:
There are three women requesting this small loan, all residents of the province of Siem Reap. The members have selected Mrs. Och O., 43, to be the group leader. Mrs. O. is a widowed mother who takes care of six children who are single; one of them, a daughter, is employed as a building worker and the others are still studying in the local public school.

O. currently earns a living as a rice trader. She usually orders rice from farmers to stock in her home to resell later to gain income. Because the mature rice seasO. is coming and the rice is now commanding low prices, she is proposing to buy rice to store for sale. Therefore, she decided to seek a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to be used to make that possible.

The other two borrowers are: T., a widowed villager raising pigs for sale, is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for raising, and L., who sells vegetables in the market and applies for a loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy rice to store for sale

loans.name: Ozor

texts.ru: Озору 29 лет, он женат и недавно у него родился второй ребенок. Озор не имеет постоянной работы и занимается транспортными перевозками – он таксист. Для этого он использует свою собственную машину, которую он приобрел на деньги, заработанные им в России. Приехав сюда в Таджикистан он решил таксовать. Заработок небольшой, но семью кормит. Озор решил получить займ на переоборудование своей машины с бензина на природный газ, который дешевле по цене и позволит ему увеличить свою прибыль.
texts.en:
Ozor is 29 years old, he is married and recently he had a second baby. Ozor does not have a permanent job and works in transportation – he is a taxi driver. He uses his personal car for this, which he purchased using money that he earned in Russia. After coming here to Tajikistan he decided to become a taxi driver. His earnings are small but he feeds his family. Ozor decided to take out a loan in order to convert his car from using gasoline to using hydrogen gas which is cheaper and will allow him to increase his earnings.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert automobile

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie M. is only a high school graduate, while her husband, Ariel, is a high school undergraduate. They got married at an early age and have four children. Two of them are now at the elementary level. According to them, having a family is difficult if you don’t have a stable job. With this, they help each other to earn a living for the sake of their children. Rosalie hopes and prays that with their hard work, they will be able to surpass every challenge that may come.

Rosalie and her husband have helped each other in cultivating their farm and vegetable business. To support her husband in providing the needs of their family, Rosalie engages in vegetable vending. She also sells onions and garlic in little bundles to further increase her daily income. She is now applying to borrow a loan of  5,000 PHP from the lenders that she can use as business capital. Rosalie believes that she would be able to increase their monthly income through the financial assistance.

loans.use: To obtain more capital for their farming and vegetable selling business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
“We must first seek the Lord’s guidance before starting another day of struggle.” This is something that Mercy R. has kept in mind since her childhood. She is now 50 years old, married to her husband Ricardo, and is blessed with one child. The couple lives happily in Barangay Lantap Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya.

Mercy is a vegetable vendor in the public market. Sometimes, when she has excess products, she sells them in their village at retail prices. Her husband works as a farmer and plants rice, sweet potatoes, and vegetables which she also sells. Their income is being used to satisfy their basic needs and sometimes gives financial support to their child who is already married. Thinking about their future, Mercy is planning to increase her merchandise, and for her to do this, she is now requesting to borrow a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP that she can use as additional capital.

loans.use: To build capital for her vegetable farming and selling business

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
“Grace comes from God, and action should be done by us,” said Domingo C.. Domingo is a resident of Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married to Lorna and gifted with seven children. Most of their children are high school graduates, while some of them, particularly the younger ones, are presently studying in the secondary and elementary levels. Domingo and his wife are working hard to support the education of their children and hope that someday they can graduate from college and have a better future.  

Due to the economic crisis that they are experiencing, the couple is having a hard time sending their children to school since their income from farming is not enough. Thus, Domingo came up with the idea of venturing into the hog raising business. He is planning to use his income from his hog raising for the education of his children and for farming assistance. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP as financial assistance to his business. Domingo will utilize the loan to buy at least three sacks of feed for his hogs and some will be used to buy some farming inputs.  He hopes that he will be able to improve his hog raising business, and at the same time, increase his crop production through this loan.

loans.use: To improve his hog raising and farming businesses

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo B. is one of the farmers residing in the rural village of Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married and blessed with six children: Three of them are high school graduates and some are still studying.  Because of financial problems, they could not afford to send their children to school since their income is just enough for the basic needs of their family.  

In this regard, Danilo wanted to increase his crop production by expanding his rice and vegetable farming.  For this, he is planning to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 16,000.00. The loan will also be used not only for his farming needs but also to restart his hog raising business which was stopped due to lack of financial support.  He believes that he will be able to increase his production and income and hopefully afford to send their children to school to pursue their college education.

loans.use: For farming needs

loans.name: Mark Anthony

texts.en:
Mark Anthony is 28 years old and his wife Loverlyn is 17 years old.  They are newly married and living a simple and happy life in Barangay Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They were blessed with a handsome baby boy named Mark Albert.  Both of them only finished their high school level due to poverty but despite this, they promise to do their best in order to give their child a better education someday. 

In order to earn a living for his family, Mark Anthony uses his tricycle to transport passengers from their village to their town.  He also works as a farmer on their small farm where he plants vegetables for extra income.  Mark Anthony is having difficulties supporting his family but never surrenders because of his love for them.  He wanted to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 for the maintenance of his tricycle.  He believed that he will be able to increase his income through the support of the lenders.  He also mentioned that patience and sacrifices are the keys to success.

loans.use: Tricycle Maintenance

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
“Nothing is impossible with God” says Angelita B., a resident of San Antonio Ilagan, Isabela. She is 46 years old and married to Frecisco B., a farmer. They have two children: Jemma, 27 years old, already married and Jenny, 18 years old, a high school graduate.  Angelita and her husband are trying to look for more opportunities to be able to send their youngest daughter to college.  

Angelita is engaged in the hog raising business.  To further improve it, she is borrowing a loan of PHP 5,000.  She plans to use the loan to purchase two piglets and feed.  This will be of great help to her family as an additional source of income. She is hoping that through their savings, her daughter can pursue her college education.  

Life is difficult but Angelita wanted to prove that no matter how hard life is, she will survive together with her family by patiently struggling out from poverty.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado operates a tricycle in their Barangay in San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. His transportation business enables him to earn a daily income to support his family, especially in providing the educational needs of his children. They live in a simple community where farming is the major source of income for most of the residents. 

Amado would like to borrow a loan amounting to 5, 000 PHP. He intends to use it for the maintenance of his motorcycle, to create a safer operation since it is their only source of income. Amado believes that the loan will help his family financially. He strives very hard in order to uplift their family from their poor living situation to a more progressive life.

loans.use: To maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Claribel

texts.en:
“In everything you do, put God first, and he will lead you to success.” This is the favorite saying of Claribel, a simple mother and a faithful wife to Armando Jr. They live in a rural place located in Barangay Manamtam, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Claribel only finished high school because they got married at an early age with no job at the beginning. Since then, the couple diligently looks for business opportunities to support their family and their future children. 

Claribel found work as a dealer of AVON products. She sells them to her friends and cousins. In this way, she is able to help her husband earn a living for their family while he cultivates their farm that they inherited from his parents. They help each other to have a better way of living. When she learned about the KIVA loans, she was encouraged to borrow at least 5, 000 PHP as working capital to her direct selling of AVON items. She hopes to become successful in her chosen career and that someday, it will become progressive.

loans.use: To build capital for her AVON selling business

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is 59 years old and already a widow. Her husband passed away five years ago and she was left with their four children. Ronald is 29 years old, Christian is 24 years old, and Erick is 21 years old and a graduate of a two year course in electronics. The youngest is Novelyn. She is 18 years old and presently taking a two year course in college.

For 17 years, Benilda has maintained her "sari-sari" store (community-based store) and has been able to expand it. Aside from retailing, she also ventured into selling “ukay-ukay” (used clothing) in their village. For the continuous development of her businesses, she would like to request a loan of PHP 30,000. She will use the loan to purchase different commodities needed in her store and to buy used clothes in bulk.

All the effort Benilda gives in the business is dedicated to her children, who never left her in times of trouble. She is very proud that, through her business, she was able to send her children to school. While still strong, Benilda does not want to depend on financial support from her children. She believes that she can still manage her responsibilities to them, especially for her youngest child. She also shared that, “Everything is possible if you are willing and happy to do what you’re doing.”

loans.use: To purchase different commodities and used clothing for her shops.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
For the future of his children, Ronald is working hard and patiently sacrificing. He is away from his wife Virginia while she is working abroad. They want to give their children a good education and, hopefully, a progressive way of living. Ronald is 35 years old and the children are still young enough that they have time to prepare for their college educations.

Ronald is working as a rice and corn farmer. He plants rice and corn in their 1.25 hectares of farm lot. Due to lack of financial support, he is now asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 28,000. He will use the loan to purchase agricultural inputs, such as fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides, and seed varieties. He will be very grateful if his loan is granted because it will really be a big help for his family.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs, such as fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides, and seed varieties.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane G. manages a small "sari sari" store. She is 39 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband, Ozne G., supports her all the way in her business. She wants to grow her store even more. In that way, she will be able to send her kids to school. She wants all of them to graduate college so that when they are older they can look for better jobs to support their future families.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will help her attract more customers. In this way, she believes she will be able to increase her income and better support the needs of her children.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It is organized to respond the need of small businessmen. CEVI does not just provide loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo A. Jr. is 30 years old and married to Gemalyn. They were gifted with one child. The family is happily living in Barangay San Roque at Centro Enrile, Cagayan. Domingo works as a tricycle driver in their town of Enrile, Province of Cagayan. His business serves as the main source of income for his family. He sometimes does furniture work but because he does not have enough capital, he just focuses in operating his tricycle.

When Domingo learned about Kiva lenders, he decided to request a loan of PHP 5,000 for the maintenance of the motorcycle he uses for his business. Hopefully he will save enough capital for his furniture business someday. Despite the hardship they are encountering, Domingo believes that God will not forsake them and they will overcome the challenges that may come.

loans.use: To pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 35 years old and living in the village of Cabisera 5, Centro, San Isidro, Isabela. She and her partner are not yet married but they have been together for more than 20 years and he is the father of their two children. Their son Dan is 18 years old and a high school undergraduate while their youngest is a high school student.

Juvelyn is a fish, meat, and chicken vendor in her village. She uses their tricycle as transportation in selling her products inside and outside of the village. For the continuous growth of her business, she is now requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 as business capital. She wants to satisfy her customers' needs. She believes that through her business she can continue to send them to school even for a two year course.

She strives hard to make her business grow and generate more income. She knows successful people keep moving forward and she always keeps herself motivated.

loans.use: To invest in her business selling meat, chicken, and fish.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
“Trusting God will always be of help,” said Felicitas A., a 59-year-old widow and resident of Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She has four children: Wilma, Samson, Joel, and Leticia. Two of them graduated from a vocational course, while the other two were not able to finish their college education due to financial problems.

Felicitas and her husband used to manage their farm together to support their family. However, now she is the one solely maintaining their rice field to earn a living. Some of her children are helping her in cultivating their farm. Aside from rice, they also plant vegetables that they can sell in their neighborhood for extra income. Their income from farming is not enough to sustain their needs. As a solution, Felicitas is now requesting a loan of 13, 000 PHP that will serve as her business capital. She is hoping that she will able to increase their rice and vegetable production through financial assistance and with her strong faith and determination.

loans.use: To maintain her rice field and vegetable farm

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena has been married to Johnas for three years already and their marriage is gifted with a baby boy named John Ashrow Miles who is now two years old. The couple is full of hopes since they are just beginning with their own family. Rowena and her husband started up their little sari-sari store business (community based store) which is of great help to their family needs.

Rowena aims to expand her business to have a better chance to succeed. For the first time, they request for a loan from the lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 for the improvement of their enterprise. The couple believes that they must start saving right now for their child’s education while the child is still young.

Rowena and her family are contented with their life at the moment. She hopes and prays that they will remain happy despite the problems that they may encounter. She believes that she can reach her dreams with the support of her husband. She also believes that God will always guide them to whatever decisions they will make, for God is the center of life.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Centro, San Antonio, Isabela. She is married to Reynaldo who works as a delivery boy of soft drinks. They have two children: Regine, 18 years old, an incoming college student next school year and Rhena, 10 years old, an elementary student. Gina is a kindhearted person who is always willing to help other people. She is also a responsible mother and diligent business woman.

Gina sells different kinds of footwear (slippers) for men and women and sometimes she also sells used clothes (ukay-ukay) in their neighborhood. She is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 10,000 that she can use as additional capital to purchase slippers in bulk and to continue her “ukay-ukay” business. She plans to send her eldest child to college and to take a management course thus, she really needs to work hard to increase her income and help her husband to meet their daily needs. Her retailing business has expanded and she hopes that it will remain strong until her children finish their studies.

Gina believes that we must keep our hearts open to dreams because as long as we continue dreaming, there is hope, and as long as there is hope, there is joy in living.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 39 years old and married to Juanito, a farmer. They live in the village of Cabisera 5, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela together with their three children: Janimar, 20 years old, who took an automotive course for two years; Joana May, 11 years old, an elementary student and John Jomer, 10 years old. Guillerma is thankful for having her loving family that chooses to be happy despite the hardships of life.

Guillerma chose hog raising as her business. At present, she would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 as business capital. She plans to use the loan to buy additional piglets and a feed supply. She dreams of sending her children to college and for them to have a better way of living someday. As a mother, she will do her very best to succeed in her endeavor.

She promised herself to work hard for the education of her children and provide them with their needs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and a feed supply

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is 40 years old yet single. He has been managing a barber and beauty salon shop for almost five years. He is also a wedding planner and arranges clothes for grooms and brides. He is satisfied that he can earn at least PHP 400 a day. His income is being used to support his parents and sibling’s basic needs.

Jomar’s business is most productive between November and May, as weddings usually take place during these months. Jomar is striving hard to expand his business by using his skills and asks for financial support from Kiva lenders. He requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to improve his business.

loans.use: Capital to improve business

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria is 55 years old and resides in Barangay San Roque Centro Enrile, Cagayan with her loving family. She is married to Arcelino, who is also her business partner. She has seven children, of which few are married, while others are still studying. Daria is doing her best to earn a living to support her children’s education and to improve her living conditions. 

She currently makes income by buying and selling recyclable materials such as empty cans, bottles, plastics, aluminums and so on. Aside from this, she also sells meat and fish in her village as an alternate source of income. For the development of her business, Daria requests a loan of PHP 10,000. The loan will not only be of great help in assisting her children’s education but also in improving her business and, through the income from her business, she can fulfill her dream of renovating her house.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Regzenlham

texts.en:
Regzenlham D. lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children are high school students. Regzenlham has a small retail business selling women’s fashion accessories such as earrings and necklaces.

In 2000, she rented a stall in the Narantuul market, the largest open market in Ulaanbaatar. Since then her business has expanded and her working capital has increased from 2,500,000 MNT (1 USD=1,500 MNT) to 4,500,000 MNT. Her husband is also involved in her small business. When she travels to Ereen, China (a border town where cheap goods enter Mongolia) to purchase elegant women’s fashion accessories, her husband runs her stall.

Regzenlham and her husband hope to send their two children to universities of their choice. She requests a loan to purchase more fashion accessories from Ereen to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion accessories for re-sale

loans.name: Ammie

texts.en:
Ammie D. is 37 years old and the mother of three children: Gizelle - 17 years old, a college student; Angie - 10 years old and Eljay 8 years old, both at the elementary level.

Ammie is a vegetable vendor in their village while her husband Efren works as a tricycle operator. They are living in the simple village of San Roque Centro, Enrile, Cagayan. With their tricycle transport and vending, the couple is able to earn money for their daily expenses, allowances, and for the tuition fees of their children.

In order to improve their businesses, Ammie is requesting to borrow PHP 7,000 to maintain her vending business and for the registration fee of their tricycle. They started their small enterprises in 1998 and still dream of making their businesses grow.

Ammie will be very thankful if her request is granted for it will really help her family and the realization of their dreams in life.

loans.use: To maintain her vending business and for the registration fee of their tricycle

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is married to Joel and blessed with three children: Jolina, 12 years old, an elementary student; Jericho, 7 years old, also in the elementary level and Jasmin, 2 months old. The family is happily living in the village of Cabisera 5 Centro, San Antonio, covered by the municipality of Ilagan, near the Pinacanauan River.

Elena is a food vendor. She sells different kinds of cooked foods in front of her house. Sometimes she also roams around their village to sell her products. Elena is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 that she will use to buy kilos of meat and different vegetables for her vending business. She aims to expand the business through the financial assistance. She is a woman full of hopes and is dreaming to be successful someday so as to save for her family and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy kilos of meat and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Ulziynyam

texts.en:
Ulziynyam B. is 20, married and the mother of one. Her husband, Byambatsogt, works at a Mongolian TV station as a sound engineer and her only son is two years old. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

In 2008 Ulziynyam started running a butcher stall at the local food market. She mostly sells the organs and heads of animals. In the summer, organs are more expensive. She would like to buy them at other times in the year, store them, and resell them when prices go up.

With her profit she built a little house on the plot of land that she inherited from her parents. Before she started her butcher shop, she was taking care of her infant. Now she hires someone as a babysitter. When the babysitter is absent she brings her son to work.

Ulziynyam requests a loan to buy more organs before the prices increase. She plans to expand her house and to enroll in a local university.

loans.use: To buy more organs before the prices increase

loans.name: Amgalan

texts.en:
Amgalan A., a 43-year-old married mother of one son attending elementary school, lives with her family in a "ger" (a nomadic Mongolian tent) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2004, after having worked for a tailoring company for 16 years, she and her husband Tugsbileg started a family tailoring business, beginning with one sewing machine and 300,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD=1450 MNT) in working capital. Amgalan gained many repeat clients in a short period of time because of her quality work, and as the number of her clients increased, she hired a tailor and bought another sewing machine. Her business capital has increased to 1,200,000 tugrugs, and average monthly income has reached 750,000 tugrugs.

With this loan, Amgalan will buy a cloth-cutting machine. Her dream is to help her son attain a quality education and be a good person.

loans.use: To buy a cloth-cutting machine

loans.name: Ursulo

texts.en:
Ursulo G. manages a small sari-sari (general) store. He is married and has three children. He wants to grow his business to supply their needs. He works also as a vegetable vendor. He goes out in the streets and sells cabbages, squash, and beans.

Ursulo wanted a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy a new refrigerator for storage of his merchandise. He wants to include selling beverages like Coke and Pepsi in the future. A refrigerator will truly be a help to realize his plans.


CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy a commercial refrigerator for use in his sari-sari store

loans.name: Baasanjargal

texts.en:
Baasanjargal Z. is 49, married, and the mother of three sons. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She is a professional tailor. Her husband Tsedenbal works as a driver in a private company.

In 1998, she started making and selling Mongolian traditional shoes. Over time, her quality traditional shoe has attracted more and more clients. When she started her business, her working capital was 150,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD = 1450 MNT), and her average monthly income was 240,000 tugrugs. As a result of hard work and 11 years of experience, Baasanjargal's working capital has grown to 500,000 tugrugs and her monthly average income has reached 800,000 tugrugs.

One of her sons is handicapped and stays at home. Baasanjargal says, "I'm working hard to increase my family’s income since we really need money for my youngest son's medical payments." She adds, "My hope is to have my own shoe-selling stall in the future."

She requests a loan to buy shoe heels and other raw materials to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy shoe heels and other raw materials.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị Chanh Group

texts.en:
"C. Nguyễn Thị (20201020028) is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Thị trấn Chờ- Yên Phong Bắc Ninh.  C. is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Nguyễn Thị C. (13).


C. is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, C. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  C. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201020029) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20201020030) is a 32-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Nghiêm Thị Thuỷ (20201020031) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Nguyễn THị Lý (20201020032) is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20201020033) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


6.  Nghiêm Thị B. (20201020034) is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


7.  Đặng THị L. (20202010035) is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Nguyễn Thị (20201020028) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thị trấn Chờ- Yên Phong Bắc Ninh.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nguyễn Thị C. (13).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. (20201020029) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị M. (20201020030) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nghiêm Thị Thuỷ (20201020031) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn THị Lý (20201020032) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20201020033) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  Nghiêm Thị B. (20201020034) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


7.  Đặng THị L. (20202010035) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bujinlham

texts.en:
Bujinlham L. is 69, married, and the mother of one daughter, Dariimaa, who is attending elementary school. Her family lives in a "ger" (Nomadic Mongolian tent) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Bujinlham retired in 1992, so to increase her family’s income she runs a tailoring business, making traditional Mongolian clothing, shoes and crafts containing many kinds of beautiful traditional decorative patterns.

Bujinlham requests a loan to buy raw materials to increase her business inventory. She says, "With the profit, I will save for my only daughter's future house".

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca C.  manages an auto repair shop. She is 43 years old and all of her 3 children are in school. Her husband, Filipino C. knows how to repair cars, motorcycles and other automobiles. This has been their business since they were first married and had children.

Rebecca is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. ( First Filpino MFI partner to go active in KIVA microfunds). She will use the loan to buy motor parts to improve their services and business. 

CEVI is helping her sustain and grow her business. It not only provides loans to its clients, but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for  her Auto Repair Shop.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, el distrito D. Cabanilla, D. la provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 54 años D. edad, es conviviente, y tiene 05 hijos, ella no recuerda hasta que grado estudio. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta D. golosinas en la plaza D. Cabanilla, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar más golosinas al por mayor para seguir con su negocio. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir mas golosinas e insumos para iniciar un negocio D. preparación y venta D. gelatinas; su deseo es poner una tienda bien surtida en su ciudad.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the community bank "Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“ of the district of Cabanilla in the province of Lampa, department of Puno. She is 54 years old and has a partner. She has five children. She does not remember what graD. she studied until. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years. She currently sells candies in the main square of Cabanilla. Her first loan was for 300 soles which she used to buy more candy wholesale in order to continue in business. She would now like to borrow 300 soles which she is committed to repay in six instalments. With this loan she will buy more candies and ingredients to open a new business preparing and selling gelatin. Her wish is to have a well-stocked store in her city.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candies wholesale

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man M., age 57, is a widowed and a villager in Phnom Penh City. She earns a living by selling groceries out of her home. She is a good mother of three children; two of them are employed as motorbike taxi drivers. This is the second cycle of the loan provided through Kiva. She used the first cycle of the loan to build a washroom to improve the family's sanitation. Man needs to borrow the second cycle of the loan of $ 400, to add to her saving in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her son, to replace an existing one.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Marcia Celestina

texts.es:
La señora Marcia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, en la comunidad de Quimsachata; el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y tiene 05 hijos, ella pose estudios de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, es una de las socias fundadoras; actualmente ella se dedica al engorde ganado ovino, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar más ganado (ovejas) para engorde. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir ganado mayor (toros) para engorde de las ferias de Cabanillas; para luego de engordarlos venderlos en la misma feria; su deseo es coprarse una casa y darle una profesión a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marcia is a member of the "Women working towards development" communal bank, in the community of Quimsachata, which lies in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the Puno region. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children. She has a primary school education. Marcia has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian feminist nonprofit organization) for four years. She is one of the founding loan members; currently she works at fattening livestock for sale. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase more livestock (sheep) to fatten. Currently she desires an additional loan of 2000 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments. With this loan, she would like to purchase additional livestock (cows) to fatten from the Cabanillas fair. After fattening them up, she will resell them in the same fair. Marcia's dream is to buy herself a house and give her children an occupation.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Maria Jesusa

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, en la comunidad Kocani Joven, el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 06 hijos, ella pose estudios de primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, es una de las socias fundadoras; actualmente ella se dedica al engorde ganado ovino, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar más ganado (ovejas) para engorde. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir ganado dos vacunos (un toro y una vaca) para engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas de Cabanillas; su deseo es conseguir vacas lecheras y producir quesos para los grandes mercados.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Women working towards development" communal bank, in the community of Kocani Joven, which lies in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the Puno region. She is 46 years old and is a single mother to six children. She has a fifth grade education. Maria has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement (a Peruvian feminist nonprofit organization) for four years. She is one of the founding loan members; currently she works at fattening sheep for sale. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase more sheep (ewes) to fatten. Currently she desires an additional loan of 1500 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments. With this loan, she would purchase two more sheep (one ram and one ewe) to fatten them up and sell them at the livestock fairs of Cabanillas. Maria's ambition is to obtain milk cows and produce cheese for the large markets.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Liliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 26 años de edad, es conviviente, y esta al cuidado de 02 hijos, ella estudio educación primaria nivel superior. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace pocos años, su negocio es la compra y venta de abarrotes en su tienda, ella desea realizar su primer préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que desea pagar en 06 cuotas, con el dinero ella pretende adquirir mercadería para poder llenar su tienda, su mayor deseo es educar sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Liliana is a member of the "Women working towards development" communal bank, in the Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the Puno region. She is 26 years old, lives with her male partner, and cares for two children. She completed her primary education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for just a few years. For her business, she buys and sells groceries in her store. She is hoping to receive her first loan of 500 soles, which she will repay in 6 installments. With the money, she will purchase merchandise to stock her store. Her greatest desire is to educate her children until they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchadise for her store

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, es conviviente, y tiene 01 hijo, ella posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar mercaderías para su negocio. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir mas abarrotes al por mayor, asimismo ella desea adquirir quesos, habas, chuño y otros productos de la región para poder llevar a vender en las ferias de la Joya en Arequipa, su mayor deseo es poner un negocio grande con todos los productos y educar a su hijo adecuadamente
texts.en:
Terese is a member of the "Women working towards development" Communal Bank, in Cabanilla district, in Lampa province, in the Puno region. She is thirty years of age, lives with her male partner, and has one son. She has completed her secondary school education. Terese has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. She is in the business of selling groceries. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase merchandise for her business. Currently she is requesting a second loan of 800 soles, which she will repay in six installments. She will use the loan to purchase wholesale groceries, and she also hopes to purchase cheeses, beans, potato starch, and other regional products that she can take to sell at the Joya en Arequipa fairs. Her greatest desire is to develop a large business with all kinds of products and to adequately educate her son.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wholesale groceries and regional products

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, en la comunidad Rosario, el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene 02 hijos. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, ella se dedica al engorde ganado ovino; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar más ganado (ovejas) para engorde. 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea incrementar su capital y poder adquirir ganado mayor (un toro), el mismo que lo manda a los camales de Lima para venta directa, su deseo es educar a sus hijos y brindarles una profesión adecuada.
texts.en:
Sabina Q. is a member of the Communal Bank, "Women Working for Development", in the Rosario community in the Cabanilla district of the Lampa province, department of Puno. She is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. For two years she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. Her business consists of raising livestock, including market lambs. Her first loan was for 3,000 soles and she used it to buy livestock. At present she is asking for a loan of 800 soles ($275), and she commits to repaying the loan in six installments. With this loan she will acquire wholesale livestock (a bull) to produce calves to later resell at market price. Sabina’s desire is to educate her children and to offer them the opportunity to have a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale livestock.

loans.name: Prak's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak A., age 62, has been selected to be the loan group leader by two other borrowers of the loan. Since 2000, Mrs. A. has been selling ice blocks in the village. Most of her clients are neighbors who live near her house. She is married to Mr. Sip, age 65, who makes an income by driving a trailer-motor taxi, and who helps her with selling the ice. The family has five children; three of them are single and the others are married and live independently. 

Mrs. A. is applying for a loan to repair a motor that is frequently breaking down and she plans to use half of the loan to improve her business capital. The others borrowers include; Mrs. S. who sells Khmer fritters from her home and requests a loan to use as capital to begin running a grocery store. And Mrs. S. who sells desserts at her store in the front of her home and is applying for a loan to expand her business. They all live in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair a motor and improve business capital

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La señora Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, el distrito D. Cabanilla, D. la provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 70 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene hijos, ella posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (primer grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 04 años, actualmente ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa al por menor; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar ropas para venta (chompas, pantalones, etc.). 

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo ella desea adquirir mas mercadería para su negocio, y seguir creciendo para ir a otros mercados D. la zona; un D. sus sueños es seguir trbajando hasta que las fuerzas ya no estén con ella.
texts.en:
Fortunata D. M. D. R. is a member of the Communal Bank "Women Working for Development, " in the the Cabanilla district of the Lampa province, department of Puno. She is 70 years old, married, with children. Her education is incomplete, having only completed first graD.. For four years she has worked with the Manuela R. Movement. She sells retail clothes. Her first loan was for 300 soles and she used it to buy clothes to sell (jackets, pants, etc.). She is requesting an additional loan of 1000 soles ($325), and she commits to repaying the loan in six installments. With this loan she will acquire merchandise for her business and expand her business to other zones. Fortunata desires to continue working for as long as she is able to.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, del Barrio San Juan, en el distrito D. Cabanilla, D. la provincia D. Lampa, departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 04 hijos, ella tuvo estudios D. primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, ella se dedica a la compra y venta D. quesos y carne, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió para comprar mas queso y carne en la ciudad D. Santa Lucia y Ayaviri para luego vender en la feria D. Arequipa y la Rinconada, asimismo se dedica al cultivo D. Quinua. 

Ella desea seguir creciendo por ello viene solicitando un préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa pagar en 06 cuotas. Con dicho préstamo podrá adquirir mas mercadería D. Ayaviri y obtener mas ganancias, uno D. sus sueños convertirse en mayorista y poder construir su casa, para lo cual necesita mas capital y viene trabajando con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
María C. D. M. is a member of the Communal Bank "Women Working for Development, " in the San Juan neighborhood of the Cabanilla district, in the Lampa province, department of Puno. She is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. She completed graD. school. For two years she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement. She buys and sells meats and cheeses. Her first loan was for 500 soles and she used it to buy cheese and meat in the city of Santa Lucia y Ayaviri to resell at the fair in Arequipa y la Rinconada. She also cultivates quinoa. She wishes to continue expanding her business, thus she is asking for a loan of 1,500 soles ($500) and she commits to repaying it in 6 installments. With the loan she will be able to acquire merchandise from Ayaviri and increase her profit. One of her dreams is to become a wholesaler and to build her own house. For this she will need more capital, and thus she puts forth much effort.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more meat and cheese to resell.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
La señora Ceferina es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando por el Desarrollo”, del distrito Cabanilla, Provincia D. Lampa, en el departamento D. Puno; ella tiene 54 años D. edad, ella es casada, es madre D. 04 hijos, ella posee estudios D. segundo D. primaria. 

Ella es socia nueva  con el Movimiento Manuela R., se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en su tienda, ella desea solicitar un préstamo D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, para comprar productos  primera necesidad como arroz, harina, mantequilla, etc. y asimismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas en 6 meses.

Su deseo es colocar una tienda más granD.  y tener un negocio donD. puedan obtener buenas ganancias. Ella se siente  contenta por pertenecer a Movimiento Manuela R. y le gusta los ahorros que posee.
texts.en:
Ceferina M. E. D. R. is a member of the Communal Bank "Women Working for Development," of the Cabanilla district, in the Lampa province, department of Puno. She is 54 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She completed second graD.. She is a new member of the Manuela R. Movement. She sells groceries at her store. She is asking for a loan of 500 soles ($175) to buy staples such as rice, flour, butter, etc., and she commits to repaying the loan within 6 months. Her goal is to establish a larger store and have a business that makes a good profit. She is very proud to be a member of the Manuela R. Movement.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staples to resell at her store.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Чураева Рано занимается шитьем национальных одеял – курпачей. Рано 57 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Ее старшая дочь помогает ей в ее шитье. Кроме этого она сама занимается их реализацией на рынках по Канибадаму. Основной доход семьи складывается от торговли, поэтому Рано старается каждый день выезжать торговать. Сейчас у Рано в планах приобрести новый ассортимент тканей, также у нее есть заказ на курпачи. Новый займ собирается погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rano C. sews traditional blankets – kurpaches. Rano is 57 years old; she is married and has 3 children. Her oldest daughter helps her with the sewing. In addition, Rano herself sells them at the markets in Kanibadam. The main income of her family comes from sales and this is why Rano tries to go out to sell every day. Right now Rano has plans to acquire a new assortment of fabrics, she also has an order for kurpaches. She plans to pay back the new loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Ascencia

texts.es:
La señora Ascencia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres trabajando por el desarrollo“, en el distrito de Cabanilla, de la provincia de Lampa, departamento de Puno, ella tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 07 hijos, ella posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (primer grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace pocos años, actualmente ella se dedica a la elaboración de panes (panadería), ella socia nueva por ello viene solicitando un préstamo nuevo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que piensa pagar en 06 cuotas, con dicho préstamo ella podrá adquirir insumos y materiales para seguir elaborando panes para distribuir a las tiendas de su zona.
