T. Chu Thị (20213010046) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Ninh 2 - 10 (10).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các P. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm nung trong cộng đồng địa P..  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  Vũ Thị P. (20213010047) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  Vũ Thị L. (20213010048) là 65 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

3.  Dương Thị T. (20213010049) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

4.  Trần Thị Binh (20213010050) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

5.  Nguyễn Thị T. (20213010051) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6.  Lê Thị M. (20213010052) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.704.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.

Về SEDA:
Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Juruhon

texts.ru: Хасанов Журухон житель города Яван. Возраст 58 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Уже около 10 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит коз для продажи. Как известно , при хорошем уходе за козами , они могут давать приплод до двух раз в год. Поэтому Журухон решил получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Он планирует купить коз , после получения прибыли за которых сможет женить сына. Кроме того он сможет обеспечить население качественным мясом.
texts.en:
Jurohon H. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 58 years old, married and has five children. He has been involved in animal husbandry for 10 years. He breeds goats for sale. It is known that when goats are well taken care of, they can be bred up to twice per year. This is why Jurohon decided to obtain this loan, so that he can increase his livestock headcount. He plans to purchase goats and use the profit for his son’s wedding. Besides this, Jurohon will be able to supply his customers with quality meat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goats

loans.name: Abavi Coco

texts.fr: Cette dame  et une résidente du quartier de Nétimé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de sacs de sortie pour dame en détail, elle exerce ce commerce au grand marché de Lomé et achète ses marchandises de l’Europe et aussi de l’Asie. Elle a beaucoup de clients parce qu’elle vend des chaussures de bonne qualité. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2005. Son stock actuel de marchandises ne lui permet pas de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 50 sacs de sorties dame de grande qualité.
texts.en:
This lady is a resident of the Nétimé neighborhood, an outlying district of the town of Lomé. She earns a living selling handbags for ladies; she has her sales point in the big open-air market of Lomé and buys her merchandise from Europe and also from Asia. She has many customers because she has good quality wares. She has been in this business since 2005. Her present stock of merchandise does not allow her to satisfy the demand of her clientele, so she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 50 excellent quality women's handbags.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of women's handbags for re-sale

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda S. J. is a 55 year-old mother of three. Her husband Jimmy is a tricycle driver (motorcycle with sidecar). She sells food in her small restaurant in the port of Lipata, Culasi, Antique, the northern port of the province. She also does buying and selling of salts in the market during market day.

She joins ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) four years ago to support her growing businesses. She applied for this loan to buy 70 sacks of salt for retail sale. She wants to purchase the salt to get a lower price from the wholesaler she is getting her stocks from in order to earn a bigger income. She will use some of her loan to finance her restaurant. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business and build a better house for the family.

loans.use: To buy sacks of salt for resale

loans.name: Ifeoma

texts.en: Ifeoma is 28 years old and married with five children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells cooked foods to her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Bibiola

texts.ru: Хасанова Бибиола проживает в городе Яван. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж работает подсобным рабочим на стройке. Сама клиентка занимается шитьем. Шьет национальные покрывала и вышивает их вручную. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы купить бычка, которого она сможет откормить и продать по более выгодной цене. Полученный доход сможет использовать для ремонта дома.
texts.en:
Bibiola H. lives in the city of Yavan. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as a construction worker. Bibiola is involved in sewing. She makes traditional blankets and embroiders them by hand. Bibiola wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase a bull that she can feed and sell at a more profitable price. She wants to use the profit to make repairs to her house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Since 2004, Charlotte A. has worked as a trader in Elmina, selling goods such as biscuits, Kalypo (fruit beverage) and drinks. Charlotte has received a junior high school education. She is married and has three children.  She is responsible for paying to support her husband in paying school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more drinks, biscuits, etc., for resale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save money to acquire land for farming.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, biscuits, etc., for resale

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.en:
Demetrio H. is a man full of determination. He is 46 years old. He is married and a responsible father to his six children. His wife is taking good care of him and their children. Demetrio goes into farming and at the same time he does pamiling (traditional gold mining) in their place. This is Demetrio's way of looking for extra income.

On the other hand, Demetrio also owns a mini grocery store, where he sells basic goods. Demetrio wants to extend his heartfelt gratitude to the lenders who gave the opportunity to him for such a loan. Demetrio now is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00. He is optimistic that his request will be realized.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hassane

texts.fr: Hassane S. est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il gère un magasin de pièces détachées dans un quartier populaire de Lomé. Il détient cette activité depuis 3 ans. Avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, Hassane désire accroitre la taille de son activité  en alimentant sa boutique. Il compte faire des livraisons en gros afin de donner à son commerce une renommée et accroître par conséquent ses recettes. Il souhaite avec cette opportunité améliorer les conditions de sa vie
texts.en:
Hassane S., 36, is married and the father of one child. He runs a spare parts store in a working class neighborhood in Lomé. He has had this business for 3 years. With this second loan from FECECAV, Hassane hopes to expand the size of his business by stocking it more fully. He intends to make wholesale deliveries so as to make his business well-known and thus increase his sales. He hopes to use this opportunity to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expanding the inventory of his store

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est une veuve qui a à sa charge ses trois enfants, elle est une institutrice mais son revenu ne lui permettant pas de couvrir les charges de sa famille, elle a débuté le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale en 2003. Elle fait face actuellement à une rupture de stock. Voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de riz, 07 bidons d’huile, 10 cartons de boîtes de tomates, des liqueurs et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This lady is a widow raising her three children. She is a primary school teacher but her salary did not permit her to cover her family's expenses, so she began selling groceries in 2003. She presently has many items that are out of stock. Wishing to replenish her inventory, she has asked WAGES for her first loan to buy 10 sacks of rice, 7 jerrycans of oil, 10 cases of tinned tomatoes, liqueurs, and various grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en:
Fumilayo is 42 years old and is married with four children.

She sells crates of drinks to her customers. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
O. Thérèse est née vers 1974 à Sakété dans le Département du Plateau au Sud du Bénin. Thérèse est mariée à OGOUTCHIBO Bénît. Thérèse est mère de trois enfants dont deux à sa charge; l'ainé Aïhatou vit avec la jeune sœur de Thérèse. Thérèse vend à manger tous les soirs au bord de la voie au quartier PK10 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Thérèse vend du riz, du haricot, de la pâte de maïs, de la pâte de manioc et de la pâte de causette d'igname. La clientèle de Thérèse est devenue beaucoup plus importante depuis quelques temps et Thérèse n'a pas les moyens financiers nécessaire pour bien répondre à la demande de cette clientèle. C'est pourquoi Thérèse sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé pour pouvoir mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Thérèse O. was born around 1974 in Sakété in Plateau County in the south of Bénin. Thérèse is married to Bénît Ogoutchibo and is the mother of 3 children, of whom two are still her responsibility. The eldest, Aïhatou, lives with Thérèse's little sister.

Thérèse sells cooked food every evening along the road in the PK10 neighborhood in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. She sells rice, beans, maize porridge, manioc porridge, and cocoyam stew. Thérèse 's clientele has grown recently and she does not have the means to respond to the demand of her clientele. This is why she is requesting the help of ALIDé to better cater for the needs of her customers. The significance of ALIDé in the local langauge of Bénin, Fon, is "a pathway always exists for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa, next door to Nigeria, where the GDP per inhabitant stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of maize, rice, cocoyams and condiments for stew

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has owned a small food-vendor store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 7 years. She belongs to Mwenge east group loan (Group code 2025). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. She works at her business for eight hours every day.

Maria is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items to add to her current stock, so as to improve her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Maria is 41 years old, married, and has three children: ages 20, 15 and 7. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more food items to add to her current stock so as to improve her business

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa S. is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of six children. She decided to open a small grocery store in her home in order to support her husband with their outgoings and household costs.

Now Salwa needs a loan with which she will increase her merchandise and provide her customers with a diversity of products. She is ready to work even harder and to make sacrifices in order to help add to her family income.

Note: The photo featured in this business profile is of Salwa’s husband. In Palestine, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman on the Internet. However, the loan is to Salwa.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise to provide her customers with a diversity of products

loans.name: Latifat

texts.en: Latifat is 42 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells provisions and building materials. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Mensah

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un travailleur dynamique qui a crée sa propre boutique de vente de produits génériques, il a appelé l’entreprise « Ets AGENCES DES PRINCES ». Il a reçu une commande que son stock actuel de produits génériques ne lui permet pas de satisfaire, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter plus de produits génériques. Il est marié et sa femme est une coiffeuse, ensemble ils ont eu 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a very dynamic worker who has set up his own shop selling generic pharmaceutical products. He calls his enterprise “Ets AGENCES DES PRINCES”. He received an order that his current stock of products prevents him from satisfying. He’s requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy more generic pharmaceuticals. He is married, and his wife is a hair dresser. Together they had three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a "bites"--maandazi (sweet fried breads) and kachori- (spicy Indian snacks)--seller in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Tupendane group loan (Group code 2005). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 50. Daily she works at her business.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for sale and flour for making bites, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Salma is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 9, 6, and 3.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  for sale and flour for making bites, to expand her business

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 43 years old and she is married with 4 children. She sells kitchen utensils such as pots, plates, spoons, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en: Edmund E. sells spare mechanical parts at Elmina Junction in Elmina. Edmund has received schooling through the university level and has been in business since 2007.  He is single with 5 dependents and holds the primary responsibility for paying his family’s bills.  His loan will be used to buy additional spare parts which will help him expand his business.  Edmund hopes to use his newly gained profits to save and also reinvest back into his business.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts which will help him expand his business.

loans.name: Gulsora

texts.ru: Хатамова Гулсора проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 28 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей.  Муж работает ремонтом жилых домов. Домохозяйка . Занимается воспитанием детей. Но решила получить кредит для того, чтобы купить бычка, после откормки , которого сможет продать его, а полученную прибыль использовать для ремонта дома. таким образом она сможет улучшить условия жизни своих детей.
texts.en:
Gulsora H. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 28 years old, married and has four children. Her husband works in home construction. Gulsora is a homemaker. She raises her children. However, she decided to obtain a loan in order to purchase a bull that she can feed and sell. She wants to use the profit to make repairs to her house and improve living conditions for her children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en: Abiola is 43 years old and she is married with a child. She sells frozen foods like turkey, chicken, etc. She also sells plastics like bowls, plates, buckets, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more frozen foods and plastics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Foluke

texts.en: Foluke B. is 35 years old and married with 2 children. She sells medicines to her customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. Foluke hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe M. is 37 years old. She's married and a mother of  4 children.  Her husband is a hardworking farmer.  They both work hard for their family. Fe became interested in business when she engaged in the buying and selling of bananas. Everyday she is busy with  the business.  She entertains walk in customers and also sells through peddling. Fe is always aiming for the improvement of her business.  Fe has decided to apply for  loan amounting to PHP 11,000.00. This amount is intended for the purchase of additional stocks of bananas. Fe is looking forward to the great help that  HSPFI, a Kiva partner, will extend to her.

loans.use: To purchase of addtional stocks of banana  for selling

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 004 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
H. Thị Hoa (35) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh pho Thanh Hoa. Hoa is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 4 (17.03.04).

Hoa is married and has 1 adult child. To making a living, Hoa owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community. Hoa has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $85) a month from these activities.

In 2007, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hoa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,442,600 Dong from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her 4th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Hồ Thị Hà (37) is a 61-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 Dong loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. T. Thị Ngoan (38) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 Dong loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. T. Thị Liên (39) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 Dong loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

4. N. Thị Hoa (48) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 Dong loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

5. T. Thị Lân (49) is a 44-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 Dong loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

H. Thị Hoa (35) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh pho Thanh Hoa. Hoa là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 4 (17.03.04).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Hoa thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hoa kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND. Vào 2007, Hoa đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hoa đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.442.600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Hồ Thị Hà (37) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. T. Thị Ngoan (38) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. T. Thị Liên (39) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

4. N. Thị Hoa (48) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

5. T. Thị Lân (49) là 44 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: Raw ingredients for food products

loans.name: Yawo Noulagbesu

texts.fr: Ce monsieur réside avec sa femme et ses 02 enfants dans le quartier d’Avenou qui est un quartier de la ville de Lomé. Pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille il a commencé le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Son stock actuel de marchandises est épuisé et pour se réapprovisionner il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 05 cartons de couscous, 02 cartons de lait en poudre, 05cartons de lait liquide, 05 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, des cartes de recharges
texts.en:
This gentleman resides with his wife and his two children in Avenou, a district in the city of Lomé. To provide for his family he started doing commerce in grocery items. His current stock of merchandise is exhausted, and to resupply himself, he’s requesting his first WAGES loan to buy: five boxes of couscous, two boxes of powdered milk, five boxes of liquid milk, five boxes of pasta, and some mobile phone cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle S. is a 41-year-old mother of eight. She works very hard to support the needs of her big family. Her husband is a laborer and a farmer who works a small parcel of land. She buys and resells vegetables in "talipapa," a small market in the village that sells all the basics necessities.

Annabelle joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) five years ago to get additional capital for her business. She applied for this loan to support her present business which she wants to sustain. She wants to buy volumes of vegetables during market day of Hamtic, the town proper, to sell in the village for the whole week in order to earn a bigger income. She hopes that she can save money for the education of her children and that she will be able to provide for all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
H. Céléstine est née vers 1971 dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Céléstine est mariée et mère de quatre enfants tous à sa charge. Céléstine vend chez elle à la maison de céréales ( maïs, sorgho, mil, haricot, etc.) ainsi que de l'huile d'arachide en bidon. Céléstine livre ses produits en gros aux revendeurs. Depuis un certain temps Céléstine enregistre une forte demande d'huile d'arachide et de maïs; mais elle n'a pas les moyens financiers nécessaire pour bien satisfaire cette demande. C'est pourquoi Céléstine sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé pour mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients.  

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
H. Céléstine was born around 1971 in the community of Sèmè-Podji, in Ouémé County in southern Benin. She is married and the mother of four children, who are all in her care. There, out of her home, she sell grains (corn, sorghum, millet, beans, etc.), as well as peanut oil in drums. Céléstine delivers her goods in bulk to retailers. For some time now, she has been noting a strong demand for peanut oil and corn, but she lacks the financial means necessary to satisfy it well. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé, so as to respond better to the demands of her customers.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and beans and drums of oil

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en:
Adenike is 32 years old and she is married with two children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs.

She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Margaret Kyamulabi‘S Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 26 years of age and divorced with five children aged between 2 and 10 years, including twins. Some of her children go to school and the rest are not schooling because she lacks school fees. She rents a one roomed house and doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day.

Margaret has a stall at which she sells roasted maize and onions and that is how she earns a living. It is located in Nakulabye Market in one of Kampala city suburbs. She doesn’t incur any transportation expenses as she buys from her place of work. Margaret receives about fifteen customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her monthly expenses include rent for both business and home, feeding the family and school fees. She has run this business for three years now.

This is her third loan since she joined MCDT and she has been with MCDT for one and a half years, working all this time with the same group members. Margaret wants to use this loan partly to pay school fees for her children and also to buy boxes of tomatoes and onions. She is hoping to go directly to farmers without involving suppliers.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions and maize

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is 35 years old and is married with 5 children. She sells cooked foods like rice, beans, etc. She also sells sachet water. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en: Modupe is 40 years old and is married with 3 children. She is a tailor and she also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Messah

texts.fr: Cette dame  est une coiffeuse, elle a ouvert son atelier en 2004 qu’elle a appelé « AMA COIFFURE ». Elle veut associer à son activité le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Pour pouvoir débuter cela, elle sollicite un premier crédit de WAGES pour acheter des tissages, perruques, des mèches, des laits et crèmes de beauté et divers autres produits de beauté. Elle est mariée.
texts.en:
This woman is a hairdresser who opened her own salon in 2004 that she calls “AMA COIFFURE”. She wants to include with it commerce in cosmetics. To be able to start this, she’s requesting her first WAGES loan to buy weaves, wigs, hair extensions, beauty milks and creams, and various other beauty products. She is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Future In Our Hands Group

texts.en:
This is Samuel A. F., Elizabeth M. B., Patrick A., John A. TarawA., Edmon K. and Henry Sesay. They work for a local non-governmental organization called Future In Our Hands (FIOH). This is the first time they are seeking a loan from SMT. Because non-governmental organizations' salaries are usually very small and do not allow one to do something big with their lives, they have  come to seek a loan from SMT to allow them to invest in something meaningful. Some of them will invest their loans in business and others will invest in the education of their children.

FIOH started its operations in 1993 and has it headquarters in Makeni with sub-offices in Mile 91 and Kabala in the north, and Pujehun in the south. FIOH focuses its operations on agriculture and food security. They also provide micro-finance services to local villages in their areas of operations. FIOH is doing well in serving the community people in their areas of operations, however, as a donor driven organization, they are often faced with financial constraints. 

Samuel (front row right), who is heading this group, is the Admin Officer of FIOH. He is forty-eight years of age. He was born in a village called Yele, in the Tonkolili district. He is married with six children between the ages of one and nineteen. His wife is a businesswoman. Samuel has worked as an Admin Officer for FIOH for three years now. He will use his loan to buy building materials for housing. Though he is not expecting to complete the building of his house with this loan, subsequent loans will certainly complete the building of his house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for housing.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana A. works as a baker and trader at Kissi near Elmina. She has been in business since 2002 and sells such goods as bread and sauce pans. She is married with 3 children and received an education through elementary school. While Christiana is trading her goods, her husband is employed as a farmer. Christiana’s loan will be used to purchase additional flour, margarine and sugar which she will use for producing her goods. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house and also educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional flour, margarine and sugar.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Nguyễn Thị H. is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. H. is the group leader of a 6 member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn 2 - 01 (1).

H. is married and has 2 adult children. To making a living, H. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community. H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000VND a month from these activities.

H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be the first loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị Hà is a 36 year old female who is requesting a loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: Anthonia sells foodstuffs and kerosene. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell. She is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter A. is married with 3 children and has received an education through senior high school. Since 2005 he has worked as a trader in Horkar, near Elmina, selling goods such as cosmetics. Peter’s wife is also employed as a trader. Peter uses his income to pay for his family’s financial expenses such as school fees and bills. He will use the loan to purchase additional cosmetics for resale and with his increased profits Peter plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie V. is a 38-year-old mother of six who lives in Pandan, Antique Province.  Pandan located on the coast at the north end of Antique, on the Philippine island of Panay.  The area's economy is heavily dependent on fishing, farming, and trade.  Virgie has four daughters and two sons; the eldest is an 18-year-old daughter who attends high school, and the youngest is a five-year-old son who's not in school yet.  Her husband, Rodgrigo, is a carpenter.

Virgie's main source of income comes from selling firewood and bamboo, the latter is used as a construction material.  She's been doing this for about three years.  Virgie also earns money by preparing and selling dried nipa leaves, which are used as roofing; nipa is a kind of palm tree that grows in wet, swampy areas.  Virgie plans to use the proceeds of this loan to buy more firewood and bamboo for resale.

Virgie hopes she'll be able to send her children to college some day.  She also would like to have enough money to be able to build a more durable house for her family.

loans.use: To buy firewood and bamboo for resale.

loans.name: Wara

texts.en: This is Wara D., age thirty-five. Wara was born in Makali, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a laboratory technician and the two have five children together. All of their children are still attending school, but for the youngest who is still suckling. Wara sells provisions and miscellaneous items. She is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help her strengthen her business.

loans.use: Expand  her business

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac D. is employed as a trader and teacher, selling provisions in Kissi near Elmina.  He has received an education through senior high school and has been in business since 2007.  Isaac is single and has 4 children.  He is responsible for paying school fees, bills, and housekeeping money for his family. His loan will be used to buy additional goods such as sugar, Milo (cocoa powder) and milk, for re-sale. He hopes to use the new profits to reinvest into his business and also pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: buy additional goods such as sugar, Milo and milk, for re-sale.

loans.name: Levenia

texts.en:
Levenia M. is an active member of HSPFI (a Kiva Partner). She lives in Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. She is married and a responsible mother to her two children. Levenia now is 31 years old. She has a mini grocery store. She sells different kinds of staple goods that her customers demand. She perceives that her business is indeed growing.

Levenia is gaining profit from her sari-sari (variety) store. From that, she has been able to purchase 1 karaoke machine. This machine will give extra income to the family. This would serve as paid karaoke machine, the customers will just insert a 5 peso coin then they would have their choice of songs. Every day, Levenia has an extra income.

Levenia is very much grateful for the help that HSPFI (Kiva Partner) extends to her. Levenia now is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000. This amount is intended for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: purchase of additional stock for her store

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona P. is a humble and dedicated single mother.  A member of ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) in Pandan, Antique, a beautiful town in the northern part of Antique. She joined the organization four years ago to get capital to support her small business.

She applied for this small loan to buy assorted fruits and vegetables to earn income for her only daughter who is with her. She hopes to expand her business by buying in bulk to get a lesser price during market day and get a bigger return when she sells during the other days of the week. She dreams that in the future, her business will grow and she will be able to save for her old age without depending on her daughter.

loans.use: To buy fruits & vegetables for resale

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina M. is married with 4 children and has received an education through senior high school. Since 1999, Justina has worked as a petty trader selling provisions at Kissi, near Elmina. While Justina works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a teacher.

Justina will use the loan to purchase additional goods for selling, such as flip flops and food supplies like rice. With her newly gained profits, Justina plans to save to build a house and also use some of the money to secure her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase additional goods for selling, such as flip flops etc.

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca sells cooked foods and drinks. She started this business in 2006. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. She is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 51 years old and she is married with 6 children. She weaves lovely hair styles for her customers and she also sells hair extensions. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 26 years old and she is single without children. She sells noodles, eggs and bread. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more noodles, eggs and bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more noodles, eggs and bread.

loans.name: Egamberdy

texts.ru: Мусурмонов Эгамберди житель города Яван. Возраст 59 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей. Работает в сфере животноводства.Он покупает молодых бычков , откармливает их и перепродает на мясо.Этим бизнесом он занимается уже 40 лет.  Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить бычка. Таким образом он увеличит поголовье скота, что даст дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en:
Egamberdy M. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 59 years old, married and has six children. He is involved in animal husbandry. He buys young bulls, raises them and then resells them for meat. He has been in this business for 40 years. Egamberdy plans to obtain this loan in order to buy a bull. This will allow him to increase his livestock and bring in additional profit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Idrisu

texts.en: Idrisu H. is married with 4 children and received an education through elementary school. Idrisu is a trader who sells sauce pans and charcoal at Kissi near Elmina, which she has done since 1999. While Idrisu is working at her trade, her husband is employed at Komenda college. Idrisu uses her income to pay for her family’s expenses such as school fees and bills. Idrisu will use the loan to purchase additional goods such as sauce pans and charcoal for resale and plans to use her newly gained profits to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods such as sauce pans and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fitila

texts.fr:
B. Fitila est née vers 1958 à Ekpè dans la Commune de Sèmè-Podji dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Fitila est mariée à NOUATIN Blaise agent retraité de l'Office des Postes et Télécommunication du Bénin. Fitila est mère de quatre enfants mais aucun n'est encore à sa charge. Fitila vend la pâte de maïs. Fitila en effet prépare cette pâte de maïs qu'elle emballe dans des feuilles de teck et la livre en gros aux revendeurs et aux propriétaires de restaurant. Fitila vend également en kilogramme le sel de cuisine ainsi que des plats en plastique. Fitila est dans la vente de pâte de maïs depuis trente (30) ans mais elle a besoin d'appui financier pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de bien répondre à la grande demande qu'elle ne cesse d'enregistrer tous les jours. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
B. Fitila was born around 1958 in Ekpè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, Ouémé County, in southern Bénin. She is married to NOUATIN Blaise, a retired representative of Benin’s postal and telecom department. She is the mother of four children, but none are still supported by her. Fitila sells pâte de maïs (a soft boiled polenta) that she wraps in teak leaves and delivers in bulk to retailers and restaurant owners. She also sells salt by the kilo, as well as plastic plates. She has been selling pâte de maïs for thirty years, but she is in need of financial support to boost her working capital, so as to respond better to the big demand, which is noticeably incessant every day.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and salt, and boxes of plastic plates

loans.name: A Primary School For The Hearing Impaired, Makeni Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a Hearing Impaired Primary School in Makeni. It was founded in 1987 to educate the hearing-impaired (deaf) children of Makeni and the country as a whole. This school is one of two hearing-impaired schools in the country. The school has a total of 150 pupils drawn from all over the country and a staff of twenty-eight teachers. Since its inception in 1987, the school has trained many deaf children in the art of reading and writing, lip reading, carpentry, sewing and agriculture. 

Unlike its counterpart in Freetown, this school teaches maternal reflective methods (lip reading) in addition to signing/finger reading. However, the school faces some great challenges. Many parents of the deaf tend to use the school as a dumping ground. They bring their children to the school and never again come to see how the child is progressing. Some parents do not care about giving support to their deaf children. And during holidays, some of the parents will never again bring the children back to the school.

This is the first loan this school is seeking from SMT/Kiva.  With this loan, they will be able to invest in some petty-trading in order to supplement their monthly salaries. Some however will use theirs to either buy pieces of furniture or in constructing houses. This loan will definitely improve the economic status of these teachers. 

Aloysius D. K. (left) is the head manager of this school. He has been a teacher at this school for twenty-one good years. Mr. K. was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. He is fifty-nine years of age, married with four children. One of his children is in secondary school, another in college, and the eldest are already grown-ups. With this loan, Mr. K. will pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Tuyet's Group

texts.en:
Tuyết Lê Thị was born in 1984. She lives with her husband and two children. She is a hairdresser and her daily income is $6. She is a hardworking woman and is the leader of the group. She wants to borrow $310 to expand her business.

There are 6 other Fund participants in her group:

Nguyệt T. Thị Trần was born in 1975. She needs $310 to invest her motor repair shop.

Tùy Đỗ Phương was born in 1962. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (approximately $230) to buy fruit to sell in the market.

Tùng Lê Đăng was born in 1970. He wants to borrow 4,578,000 VND (approximately $260) to buy chickens to sell in the market.

Hạnh Lê Thị Hồng was born in 1973. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (approximately $330) to buy pigs to sell in the market.

Hoa Quỳnh Thị Nguyễn was born in 1972. She wants to borrow 1,962,000 VND (approximately $110) to run a small business.

Lý Lê Thị was born in 1976. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $280) to buy fish to raise.

loans.use: To exand her hairdressing business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther H. is single with 2 children and received an education through elementary school. Since 2004, Esther has worked as a trader in Horkar, near Elmina, selling such goods as clothes, sauce pans and sandals. Esther uses her income to care for her family and also pay bills. She will use the loan to purchase additional goods like clothes, sauce pans and sandals for selling, and with her newly gained profits Esther plans to continue working on the house she has started building for her family.

She was out of stock as at the time this picture was taken.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods like clothes, sauce pans and sandals for selling.

loans.name: Olubunmi

texts.en: Olubunmi O. is 30 years old and married with 2 children. Olubunmi is a primary school teacher and she also has a shop where she sells stationery and eggs. She is requesting a loan of N20,000 to purchase more stationery to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more stationery to sell.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Носирова Дилором проживает в городе Яван. Живут со своей семьей далеко от города . Домохозяйка , муж работает  строителем по найму. Сама клиентка занимается домашним хозяйством. Имеет несколько голов мелко рогатого скота. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье овец и коз. Таким образом она сможет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Dilorom N. lives in Yavan. She lives with her family far away from the city. She is a homemaker, and her husband is a construction worker for-hire. Dilorom takes care of the household. She owns several sheep and goats. She plans to obtain this loan in order to increase the sheep and goat headcount. This will allow her to improve her family’s financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of additional livestock

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet W. is 33 years old and divorced with a child. She has a phone booth where she sells rechargeable phone cards, eggs, and women's bags. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N30, 000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Cette dame a commencé depuis 2001 la vente de poissons fumés, ce commerce est très rentable pour elle. Le poisson fumé est utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer des sauces telles que l’adémé, la sauce gombo, la sauce tomate. Beaucoup de femmes viennent acheter chez elle, elle vend à crédit à ses plus fidèles clientes et récupère l’argent dans les 8 jours. Elle fait face à une rupture de stock et voudrait se réapprovisionner alors elle demande à WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 03 paniers de poissons fumés.
Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle aide son époux dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
In 2001, this lady started selling smoked fish, a business that is very profitable for her. Smoked fish is used in Togolese cuisine for making sauces with adémé (a leafy green vegetable), okra, or tomatoes. Many women come and buy from her. She sells on credit to her most loyal customers and collects the money in a week’s time. She’s coping with inventory shortages and would like resupply herself, so she’s asking WAGES for her first loan to buy three baskets of smoked fish.

She is married and the mother of seven. With what she earns from her business, she helps her husband with day-to-day household expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy smoked fish

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina A. is married with three children and her husband works as a mason. Since 1989, Paulina has traded goods such as clothing in Elmina.

Paulina will use the loan to purchase additional clothing to sell and, with her newly gained profits, plans to reinvest back into her business and also save some money for her future.

She was out of stock when the picture was taken.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Jalgash

texts.ru: Жалгаш Отаерова проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 41 год, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Муж работает разнорабочим по найму. Сама же клиентка не сидит на иждивении мужа. Она имеет хозяйство с коровами. Коровы дают молоко , которое она продает , а так же производит кисло молочные продукты для продажи. Планирует получить кредит , который планирует использовать для покупки молодой коровы.
texts.en:
Jalgash O. lives in Yavan. She is 41 years old, married and has six children. Her husband works as a handyman for hire. Our client does not just rely on her husband. She has a small cattle farm. Cows provide milk that Jalgash sells, and she also makes dairy products for sale. She plans to obtain this loan in order to purchase a young cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a young cow

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
Alimatu B. is 28 years old and married with four children. Her third child is standing close to her in the picture.

She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more provisions to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther P. is 39 years old and married with a child. She sells building materials like washbasins, tiles, keys, padlocks, etc.

She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more building materials. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is forty-five years old. She is the mother of three children and still married. Her children are schooling in the primary and junior high schools. Mary lives with her family in a family apartment at a community called Oda which is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number are also involved in trading and other business activities.

Mary is a hairdresser by profession. She does both plaiting and perming. She says she started her salon six years ago and has since trained four young ladies in hairdressing who have since started their own businesses in other communities. She has a small store close to the local market where she works. Apart from hairdressing, she also trades in cosmetics. She operates her salon starting in the morning and switches over to the sale of cosmetics in the evening through hawking (selling door-to-door).

She believes the loan assistance will enable her to buy hairdressing equipment, fashion accessories, artificial hair and also pomades and other materials she will need to serve her clients satisfactorily. She hopes to increase her income to enable her to save more to support her children’s education.

Mary is a member of “Asempa Kanea” (translated: “Gospel Light”) Trust Bank group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and to support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials and fashion accessories

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
T. Julienne est née vers 1979 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Julienne est mariée à OWOLABI Luc. Julienne est mère de deux enfants: l'ainé est en deuxième année du cours primaire et le second n'a pas encore l'âge d'aller à l'école. Julienne vend des céréales et autres produits alimentaires: maïs, sorgho, mil, haricot, riz, farine manioc. C'est à la devanture de sa maison que Julienne expose ses produits. Julienne a en effet pour clientèle la population de son quartier. Julienne arrive à bien écouler ses produits mais elle a aujourd'hui besoin de plus de moyens financiers pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Julienne sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Julienne was born around 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to OWOLABI Luc and is the mother of two children: the eldest is in 2nd grade, and the second one is not yet old enough to go to school. Julienne sells grain and other foodstuff: corn, sorghum, millet, beans, rice, and cassava flour. There in front of her house, she displays her merchandise. Basically, the people of her district are her customers. She manages to have good product turnover, but she is now in need of funds for responding better to the demands of her customers. This is why Julienne is requesting a loan from Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, cassava flour, beans, millet, sorhgum and rice

loans.name: Asimadu

texts.en:
Asimadu is 36 years old and married with seven children. She sells tailoring materials.

Asimadu is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en: Bunmi O. is 43-years old and married with three children. Bunmi sells medicines and provisions. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions to sell

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie A. is 19 years old. She is married and a good mother to her child. Her husband goes into traditional gold mining. Margie and her family live in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City.

Margie is engaged in a mini-grocery store business and gasoline and rice retailing in their place. Margie works hard at her business. She wants to have savings for the education of her child.

Margie want to express her thanks to HSPFI (her Kiva Partner) for helping her business boom and gain profit for real. Margie is now applying for a loan of PHP 11,000. This amount is intended for the purchase of stock for her store and, of course, for the entire improvement of her business. Margie is now hoping for the best response to her request.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her mini-grocery store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Zinabu

texts.en:
Zinabu N. trades in cosmetics and clothing materials. She is 42-years old, married and the mother of four kids who are in junior high and basic school. Zinabu’s husband works as a farmer. Zinabu and her family live in a family house at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either into farming or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of business.

Zinabu buys cosmetics such as powder, assorted pomades, etc. and clothing materials from Accra, a nearby city, and sells in the market square in her community. She also treks to nearby centers to sell through door-to-door sales. She has been in this business for thee year now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can purchase cosmetics in bulk.

Zinabu believes the loan assistance will enable her to reach out to other market centers and eventually help to improve her family's finances. She is a member of a trust bank group called Adehyee Mma (translated, Royals) Trust Group. Members of this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothing materials in bulk

loans.name: Dédé Ameme

texts.fr: Cette dame vit dans le quartier de lomnava, un quartier au centre de la ville de Lomé avec ses deux enfants. Pour subvenir à ses propres charges et à celles de ses enfants elle a entamé la vente de boisson locale appelée « sodabi », elle s’approvisionne au marché local d’agoè. Le sodabi est une boisson alcoolisée qui est très appréciée au togo. Son stock étant épuisé elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 12 bidons de Sodabi.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in Lomnava, a district in downtown Lomé, with her two children. To support herself and her children, she started selling a local drink called “sodabi”. She gets her supplies at the local marketplace of Agoè. Sodabi is an alcoholic beverage that is highly appreciated in Togo. Her stock being exhausted, she’s requesting a loan for buying 12 containers of sodabi.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys S. is 37 years old and married with 4 children. She sells electrical materials like extension boxes, sockets, torches, wall switches, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Olusola

texts.en: Olusola is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs and kerosene. She is requesting the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua N. is forty-two years old. She is married and has two little kids who are currently in the basic school. Akosua lives with her husband and children in a community called Oda. Oda is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, a quite appreciable number of the women are involved in palm oil production. Akosua is one of these women who actively produces palm oil. She has been in business for five years. Her husband is a farmer.

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community; processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the food of the palm fruits which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (thus the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel water content. She desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruits in bulk to be able to supply to more customers.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “Adehyee Mma” (Translated Royals) Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret O. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has seven children. Four currently have completed school and are working, the rest are still in school. Margaret lives with her husband and children in a community called Oda. Oda is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities.

Margaret trades in child care products. She loves trading and started trading at age fifteen. The items she trades in include baby powder, napkins, pampers, diapers, toiletries, kids clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to include the sale of plastic materials like buckets, bowls and plates. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education.

She belongs to the community group called “Adehyee Mma” (Translated Royals) Trust Group. The group guarantees a loan through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay, if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To buy plastics like buckets, bowls, and plates for resale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Since 2004 Stella C. has worked as a trader at Kissi, near Elmina, selling foodstuffs such as maize and kenkey. She is married with 5 dependents and received an education through elementary school. While Stella works as a trader, her husband makes his living as a taxi driver. Stella is responsible for providing money to her family in order to keep the house running properly.

Her loan will be used to purchase additional maize in bags (some for making kenkey and some for immediate resale), and also to buy gari which she will then resell. Stella hopes to use the new profits from her business to build her own house.

At the time the picture was taken, she was arranging the kenkey into the cooking pot to be boiled.

loans.use: Ingredients for the foods kenkey and gari

loans.name: Oduola

texts.en: Oduola B. is 40 years old and married with 4 children. All her children are in school. She and her husband sell planks. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia A. is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She sells planks for making furniture. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru: Хошимов Рустамчон молодой мужчина 29 лет. Женат и имеет 2-х детей. У него среднее образование. Рустамчон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Рустамчон кредитуется 1 год. Когда он пришел в первый раз брать кредит, у него было малое количество скота. Сейчас у Рустамчона немного увеличилось количество мелко рогатого скота. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Рустамчон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Rustamjon Hashimov is a young 29 year old man. He is married and has 2 children. He has a high school education. Rustamjon fattens and sells livestock and his wife processes and sells milk. Rustamjon has been a borrower for 1 year. When he decided to take out a loan for the first time he had a small quantity of livestock. Now Rustamjon’s small livestock headcount has increased a little bit. His wife has only one dairy cow. Rustamjon plans to buy his wife one more dairy cow with a calf and he is grateful to our creditors for help in bringing these plans to fruition.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cow and calf

loans.name: Irisboy

texts.ru: Ирисбой – мужчина средних лет (38 лет), женат и отец 4-х детей. У Ирисбоя есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 35 овец и 15 коз. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти. Ирисбой каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Ирисбоя пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Ирисбой за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Ирисбой очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Irisboy is a middle aged man (38 years old), married, and the father of four children. He has a herd of small cattle comprised of approximately 35 sheep and 15 goats. His wife stays at home, but in her free time processes wool. Every morning, Irisboy takes his herds to the mountains to graze and in the evening, brings them home. At this time Irisboy has few large-horned cattle. He would like to take out a new loan to buy two medium-sized bulls. After feeding them for 3-4 months, he can sell them off for a good price. Irisboy is glad to cooperate with Kiva, because their loans have helped him very much.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and sale of livestock

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice C. has worked as a trader in Elmina and Takoradi since 2002, dealing in such goods as porridge and donuts. She is married with 2 children and received an education through Senior High School. While Beatrice works as a trader, her husband is employed as a security officer.

Her loan will be used to buy more maize, sugar and flour for the preparation of porridge for sale at the roadside for her customers who don't normally take their breakfast before leaving their homes. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build another house.

loans.use: For maize, sugar and flour

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina A. is 50 years old. She is married and happily enriched with five children. Unfortunately, she doesn't have her husband at this time. She lives with her children in Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City, Philippines. Catalina is determined to raise her family herself. She works hard for the education and other needs of her children.

Catalina is very much thankful to HSPFI (a Kiva partner) for helping her to manage a business. She delivers firewood to her customers located within the city market. She also engages in the buying and selling of bananas.

She has a particular buyer of her products in the city. There is a particular day in the week that they go to the city and attend the market day known as "tabo-tabo". There, they have their stall where they display and sell their products.

Catalina wants to improve her business. She needs money to make it bigger. This is to meet the demand of her customers. Catalina is applying for a loan amounting to 11,000 Philippine Pesos. From this, she could have a much higher income compared to her previous business transactions. Catalina is looking forward for the favor she is requesting from the organization.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and bananas for resale

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: B. Deborah is 35 years old and married with 6 children. She sells planks in a plank market in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more planks to sell

loans.name: Fakeye

texts.en: Fakeye D. is 30 years old and married with a child. He sells planks to make a living. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Rahmatkul

texts.ru: Рахматкулу 56 лет. У него есть жена и 4-ро детей. Три сына и одна дочь. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей.  Единственная дочь помогает по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Рахматкул пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Он давно уже кредитуется в нашей организации, и является хорошим пунктуальным клиентом.
texts.en:
Rahmatkul is 56 years old. He is married and has four children -- three sons and one daughter. His eldest sons are in Russia working, where they send back remittances to their parents. The parents save the remittances so that they can later be spent on the sons' weddings. Their only daughter helps in the house. The wife processes yarns -- and sells it herself at the market. And Rahmatkul raises cattle in the mountains during the day and returns late in the evenings. He has been borrowing from Kiva for some time now, and has always been a good and punctual client.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and sale of livestock

loans.name: Amirjon

texts.ru: Рустамов  Амирджон кредитор в Микроинвесте с 2006 года. Он занимается бизнесом по продаже мужского нижнего белья. Каждый свой займ он использует целенаправленно, на расширение товарооборота. Во время отъезда Амирджона  за товаром , на рынок торговать выходит его жена, как раз на снимке она сама. Его точка реализации расположена  в центре рынка города Худжанда. За товаром он ездит в Истаравшан два раза в месяц. Его жена благодарна Микроинвест,  за возможность увеличить в кредит свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Amirjon R. has been borrowing from MicroInvest since 2006. He sells men's underwear. He uses each of his loans to expand his trade turnover. When Amirjon goes to purchase his stock, his wife sells it at the market (as seen in the photo). His trading stall is right in the middle of the Khujand city market. Twice a month, he goes to Istaravshan to buy his stock. His wife is thankful to MicroInvest for the opportunity it has given them to expand their business.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling men's clothes

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилчону 42 года. Он женат и отец 4-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Комилчон занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление весны для Комилчона – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что весной скот стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Комилчон экономит на корме скота. С наступлением осени Комилчон продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Komiljon is 42 years old. He is married and the father of four children. His wife doesn't work, she stays at home and takes care of the home, feeds their cattle. Komiljon feeds and sells cattle. The spring season for him is the time to purchase cattle since they are cheaper to buy. Also, it is not as expensive to feed cattle during the spring -- they eat mountain grasses, and Komiljon can save on cattle feed. In the autumn, Komiljon will sell some of his fattened cattle, but he won't buy cattle. He will buy food for the rest of his herd.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and sale of livestock

loans.name: Savri

texts.ru: Зокирова  Саври  женщина 51 года , швея женских  кофт и шапочек. Она использует займ для производства своей продукции. Она  связав кофты продаёт их в магазины , которые перепродают с наценкой. У неё очень красивые кофты. Саври с 2006 года заёмщица в фонде. Следующий кредит хочет использовать для закупа нитей и краски для крашения товара.Она благодарна инвесторам KIVA за понимание и финансирование .
texts.en:
Savri Z., is a 51 year old seamstress who makes women's blouses and hats. She will use her loan to produce her goods. She sews blouses and sells them in stores that marks them up and sells them off. Her blouses are very beautiful. Since 2006, Savri has been taking out loans; with this loan, she hopes to buy yarns and dyes to color her products.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing blouses

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses O. is forty years old and married with five children. He is a tailor. He is requesting a loan of $275 to purchase more tailoring materials for making clothes for his customers. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring supplies

loans.name: Omariyeba

texts.en: Omariyeba L. is fifty-eight years old and married with five children. She sells women's and children's clothes in a big market in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan of $425 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлудахон Хакимова женщина , которая имеет цех по производству женских свитеров и халатов. Их продукция производится из трикотажных нитей. На снимке Мавлудахон в кофте собственного изготовления. Вначале своего бизнеса   она начинала сама, а теперь у неё набраны ученики , которые вместе с ней изготавливают продукцию.  Их продукция имеет большой спрос на рынке. У Мавлудахон свои постоянные клиенты , которые сами приезжают за товаром. Мавлудахон на свой займ хочет закупить нить , используемой на подклад кофт и халатов.
texts.en:
Mavludahon H. owns a women’s sweater- and robe-making factory. The products are made from tricot fibres. The photograph shows Mavludahon in a sweater made at her factory. When her business first started, she was a sole proprietor; however, now she hired apprentices who help with the production. Their products are in high demand at the market. Mavludahon has loyal clients who come to get the products themselves. Mavludahon wants to use this loan to purchase fabrics used for sweater and robe linings.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric purchase

loans.name: Shomuhammad

texts.ru: Раджабов Шомухаммд житель города Яван. Возраст 23 года . женат , но детей не имеет.Живет с родителями и семьей брата. Семья очень большая. Клиенту приходится много работать для того, чтобы прокормить семью. Работает в сфере животноводства. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота.А разводит он мелко рогатый скот. Разводит овец и коз. После откормки он продает их на рынке.
texts.en:
