Shomuhammad R. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 23 years old, is married, but does not have children. He lives with his parents and his brother’s family. The family is very big. The client needs to work a lot in order to feed the family. He works in the livestock sphere. He plans to get credit in order to increase his livestock count. He raises small livestock. He raises sheep and goats. After fattening them he sells them at the market.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Мамадчонова Гульчехра молодая девушка, которая занимается завозом и продажей веников. За товаром ездит сама Гульчехра в город Истаравшан. Она имеет своих поставщиков, которые иногда сами привозят ей товар.  Но во время мониторинга Гульчехра отсутствовала, была в отъезде за товаром. На снимке её мать, которая замещает дочь в её отсутствии. Гульчехра хочет, получив кредит  поехать за товаром и привести побольше партии веников по оптовым ценам. Гульчехра очень приветливая девушка , которая обслуживает клиентов на высшем уровне, поэтому у неё много знакомых клиентов , которые покупают товар именно у неё.
texts.en:
Gulchehra Mamadchonova is a young woman who is in the business of selling besom brooms. She obtains her goods herself in the town of Istaravshan. She also has suppliers who seldom deliver the goods to her. During the business monitoring, Gulchehra was gone to get her products. The photograph shows Gulchehra’s mother, who helps her daughter when she is gone. Gulchehra wants to use this loan to purchase and deliver brooms at wholesale prices. Gulchehra is a very friendly woman and provides great customer service to her clients. This is why she has many clients who purchase goods only from her.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase brooms at wholesale price

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is married with two children and was educated through Senior High School.  Since 2005 she has worked as a trader selling plantain chips at Kissi, near Elmina.  While Florence is employed as a trader, her husband makes a living through farming. Florence uses her income to help pay her children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more plantain which she will then fry and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to further her children's education.

loans.use: To buy plantain to fry and sell.

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.ru: Улаев Рамазон проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 36 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Уже шесть лет занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли . Имеет магазин рядом с домом , где торгует хозяйственными товарами и всякой мелочью. Хочет сделать ремонт в магазине . Но сначала планирует увеличить товарооборот , а затем когда он получит прибыль сможет сделать ремонт. Товарооборот сможет увеличить только , если сможет получить кредит сроком на десять месяцев.
texts.en:
Ramazon U. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 36 years old, is married and has four children. He has had a sales business for six years now. He has a store next to his home where he sells household products and a variety of small items. Ramazon would like to make repairs to his store. But first he would like to increase his turnover and after this when he makes a profit he will be able to make repairs. He will only be able to increase his turnover if he is able to get a loan for six months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en: Nickson C. has worked since 2005 as a trader and corn mill operator at Kissi, near Elmina.  He is married with three children and was educated through Junior High School.  While Nickson works as a corn mill operator, his wife is employed as a trader.  He is responsible for providing for his family by paying bills and paying his children’s school fees.  His loan will be used to buy a new machine for milling in order to increase productivity and expand the business. Nickson hopes to use the new profits from his business to buy a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a new milling machine to increase productivity.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Азизова Майрам проживаетв городе Яван. Возраст  31 год, замужем и имеет четверых детей. Муж работает дехканином и занимается земледелием, а она в свою очередь занимается животноводстовм. Обратлась к нам за кредитом . для того, чтобы купить молодую дойную корову. Это поможет ей получать молоко . и использовать его для своих детей. Кроме того, если будет лишнее молоко она сможет его продавать соседям . И таким образом зарабатывать деньги.Это улучшит семейное , финансовое положение.
texts.en:
Mairam A. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 31 years old, married and has four children. Her husband works as a supervisor and is in agriculture and also does animal husbandry. She has come to us for a loan so that he can buy a young milk cow. This will help her get milk and provide it to her children. Besides she can always sell the extra milk to the neighbors. This way she will be making money. It improves their family financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Holibek

texts.ru: Аширов Холибек проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 54 года. Имеет очень большую семью. Он женат и имеет восьмерых детей. Старший сын находится на заработках в Российской Федерации.Он помогает  отцу обеспечивать семью. Сам же Холибек занимается животноводством. Животноводством занимается уже шесть лет. Планирует поучить кредит для того, чтобы купить молодого бычка. После откормки он сможет его выгодно продать и таким образом заработать деньги. Прибыль использует для семьи , а на те же деньги сможет купить опять бычка. Так его бизнес сможет развиваться .
texts.en:
Holibek A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 54 years of age. He has a very large family. He is married and has eight children. The oldest son is earning money in the Russian Federation. He helps his father provide for his family. Holibek himself raises livestock. He has been raising livestock for six years. He plans to get credit in order to purchase a young bull. After fattening it he will be able to sell it at a profit and earn money this way. He will use the profits for the family and will use the rest of the money to purchase a bull again. This way his business will be able to grow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou N. née en 1972 est mariée avec 03 enfants. et 01 autre personne à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Nguèye -Nguèye depuis 4 ans. Fatou veut renforcer ses activités de commerce et d’élevage. Elle vend du savon et  du sucre et elle  fait un élevage de moutons pour améliorer les revenus de la famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatou N., born in 1972, is married and has three children, plus one other person to support. She has been a member of the village lending group Nguèye -Nguèye for four years. She wants to bolster her business raising livestock. She sells soap and sugar, and she raises sheep to improve the family’s income. The loan she’s requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in soap, sugar, and raising sheep

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Señora Nancy Josefina A. de González de 44 años de edad, es separada, vive en el Barrio Tacumbú de la Ciudad de Asunción, y tiene un hijo mayor de 21 años.

Doña Nancy es Costurera, se dedica hace 2 años a la Confección del Ajuar. Ella lo aprendio en cursos realizados por la Municipalidad de Asunción de Decoración y Bordado de Toallas, Pintura sobre Tela, Fabricación de Lencería Fina para Damas, Confección de Sábanas y Edredones, Pintura sobre telas para Sabanas y Manteles., etc.

Luego de su separación, la Sra. Nancy empezó con esta nueva idea de poner en práctica lo aprendido en los cursos tomados en un principio como aficion. Compró telas y elaboró unas muestras, los llevo a los Ministerios, las Escuelas, y Empresas donde había alguna embarazda. Habló con algunas amigas, y de ese modo emprendido su pequeña empresa en su domicilio.

Asi iban llegando los pedidos de Clienta x Clientas, o modo de reagalo en ocasión de algún Baby Showers.
texts.en:
Nancy Josefina A. de González is 44 years old, separated, and lives in the Tacumbú neighborhood in the city of Asunción; she has one older child who is 21 years old. Nancy is a seamstress, and for the past 2 years has dedicated herself to making household linens. She learned this by taking courses given by the Municipality of Asunción on Decorating and Embroidering Towels, Painting on Fabric, Fabrication of Fine Lingerie for Women, Making Bed Sheets and Comforters, Painting on Fabric for Bed Sheets and Table Cloths, etc. After her separation, Nancy had this new idea of putting into practice what she has learned in the courses that she had taken at first as a hobby. She purchased fabrics and made some samples, which she took to various ministries, schools, and companies where there might be pregnant women. She spoke with some friends, and in that manner launched her small company in her home. Thus the orders began arriving from clients, some of which were meant as gifts for occasions such as baby showers.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To  purchase different materials, such as: fabrics, threads, fittings, large towels, small towels, towels with hoods, and clothing for newborns.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin K. is 50 years old and married with four children. Toyin sells foodstuffs.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 43 years old and married with two children. She sells medicines in her shop.

She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: Arame S. née en 1972 est mariée avec 07 enfants et 01 autre personne à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Nguèye -Nguèye depuis 4 ans. Arame veut renforcer son activité d’embouche bovine. Elle compte acheter des sujets, le vaccin et le complément nutritionnel pour les engraisser avant de les revendre. Son objectif est d’augmenter les revenus de la famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Arame S. was born in 1972; she is married and has seven children of her own and one additional dependent. She has been a member of the Nguèye -Nguèye village bank for four years. Arame wants to bolster her cattle-raising business. She plans to buy more cattle, vaccines and feed to fatten her livestock before reselling them. Her goal is to increase her family income. This loan will be repaid in a lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle, vaccines and feed for her livestock business

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
Un integrante de este comite es Sra. Mirta C. C..  Ella tiene 39 años y tiene dos hijos. Mirta es una Sra muy sacrificada y se dedica en la venta de comidas por la mañana. Sus compras los realiza en el mercado numero 4 para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus hijos le ayuda en los trabajos de la casa y por la tarde se dedica en la venta de quiniela, que es un tipo de loteria local.  Ella dice que con la ayuda que la fundacion le dio está mejorando su situación económica y cada vez mas procura para salir adelante. 

Las otras mujeres del comite se dedican a actividades diferentes.  Las otras integrantes son: 

1	Nilda B. A..	- Despensa - 
2	Victoria G.. - 	Venta de merceria - 
3	Teodora O.. - 	Venta de ropa - 
4	Primitiva T.. - 	Vendedora Ambulante - 
5	Romina M.H.. - 	Venta de verduras - 
6	Mirta C. C. P. - 	Venta de comida y quiniela - 
7	Mirta V.. - 	Venta de carbon - 
8	Maria A. M.. - 	Despensa - 
9	Esmilce A. R. R. - 	Merceria - 
10	Maria C.M. R.  - Venta de empanadas - 
11	DelasNieves R.. - 	Venta de comidas - 
12	Vilma G.G.. - 	Ventas de detergente - 
13	Maria M.R. C. - 	Venta de ropa - 
14	Berenice B. B.. - 	Merceria - 
15	Karen E. A. R.  -	Venta de comidas  - 
16	Hermelinda Ferreira. - 	Venta de merceria
texts.en:
Señor Mirta C. C. is a member of this committee. She is 39 years old and has 2 children. Mirta sacrifices herself a great deal and sells breakfast foods. She buys her ingredients in market number 4 for the preparation of her meals. Her children help her with housework and in the afternoon she sells quiniela, a type of local lottery. She says that with the help that the foundation has given her she is bettering her economic situation and each time she works towards progress. The other women of the committee are involved in different activities. The other members are: 1. Nilda B. A. –pantry- 2. Victoria Gonzales –merchandise sales- 3. Teodora O. –clothing sales- 4. Primitiva T. –travelling saleswoman- 5. Romina M. H. –vegetable sales- 6. Mirta C. C. P, -sale of food and quiniela- 7. Mirta V. –charcoal sales- 8. Maria A. M. –pantry- 9. Esmilce A. R. R. –hardware sales- 10. Maria C. M. R. –empanada sales- 11. DelasNieves R. –food sales- 12. Vilma G. G. –detergent sales- 13. Maria M. R. C. –clothing sales- 14. Berenice B. B. –hardware sales- 15. Karen E. A. R. –food sales- 16. Hermelinda Ferreira –hardware sales-

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Haberdashery: yarns, bracelets, necklaces, nail polish, purses, bags; Clothing Sales: pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, and various other things

loans.name: Oyetunji

texts.en: Oyetunji B. is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She has a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N30, 000 to purchase more salon materials to make her customers hair. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more salon materials

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana N. is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She is a fashion designer. She makes lovely clothes for her customers to wear. She also sells sarongs and laces. Christiana is requesting a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to make more clothes. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Asta

texts.fr: Asta S., 53 ans est divorcée avec 02 enfants  en 03 autres à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Ndoucoura depuis 3 ans et demi Son activité  est la vente de tissus  Elle veut  renforcer son commerce pour avoir plus de revenus et participer à la dépense familiale  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Asta S. is 53 years old, divorced and has two children of her own and three more dependents. She has been a member of the Ndoucoura village bank for three and a half years. She sells cloth. She wants to bolster her business in order to have greater revenues and contribute to the household expenses. This loan will be repaid in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cloth

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions to make a living. Margaret is requesting a loan in the amount of N50, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases more provisions to sell

loans.name: Adebayo

texts.en:
Adebayo is 43 years old and married with three children. Adebayo sells engine oil from a tank and he makes a good profit. He hopes to expand this business.

He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more engine oil to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta G. âgée de 57 ans est mariée avec 10 enfants  en 02 autres à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Ndoucoura depuis 6 ans et demi Son activité  est la vente de poissons fumés, poissons séchés et légumes  Elle veut  renforcer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille  Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Anta G. is 56 years old. She is married and has 10 children of her own as well as raising two more dependents. She has been a member of the Ndoucoura village bank for six and a half years. She sells smoked fish, dried fish and vegetables. She wants to bolster her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay this loan in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell smoked fish, dried fish and vegetables

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas O. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She is a hair stylist and she makes beautiful hairstyles. Dorcas plans to purchase a pop corn machine and second hand fridge so that she can start to sell pop corn and cold drinks. She hopes to combine these businesses to enable her to make additional profit. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N50, 000 to purchase a pop corn machine and second hand fridge. She says thanks.

loans.use: To purchases a pop corn machine and second hand fridge

loans.name: Moyo

texts.en: Moyo A. is 40 years old and married with 3 children. Moyo sells sarongs and laces. She is an active LAPO client. She is requesting a loan in the amount of N50, 000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Ndiaya

texts.fr: Ndiaya S., 48 ans est célibataire avec une charge familiale de 04 enfants et 04 autres personnes. Elle est membre du banc villageois depuis 2 ans et demi Son activité  est la vente de tissus et de beurre de karité  Ndiaya veut  renforcer son commerce pour avoir plus de revenus Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndiaya S. is 48 years old and single. She is responsible for raising four children and four other dependents. She has been a member of the village bank for two and a half years. She sells cloth and shea butter. Ndiaya wants to bolster her business in order to make better revenues. She will repay this loan in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth and shea butter

loans.name: Kalule Alice‘S Group

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old and married with seven children, aged between 13 and 26 years. She owns a three roomed house where she is staying with ten people. She has access to electricity and piped water at home. Her family gets three meals a day. Alice sells second hand clothes in the Kawempe market. She uses public transport to and from shoping and she buys her supplies from the Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and school fees for her children. 

Alice sells to all categories of people and works six days week. She has been in this business for over three years. This is her eighth loan since she joined MCDT and has been with the organization for four years, working with the same group loan mates. Alice  wants to use this loan to buy more clothes for resale. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and eventually own a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Bisola

texts.en:
Bisola is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and kerosene.

She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel O. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She makes interlocking pavement stones that are used in the fittings of floors. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more materials like bags of cement and granite stones for making more interlocking pavement stones. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials to make pavement stones

loans.name: Marième

texts.fr: Marième N. âgée de 40 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants  en 01 autre à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Ndoucoura depuis 6 ans et demi Son activité  est la restauration  Elle vend le petit déjeuner et le déjeuner  Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille   Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Marième N. is 40 years old and has seven children of her own as well as one additional dependent. She has been a member of the Ndoucoura village bank for six and a half years. She sells prepared food: breakfast and lunch. Her goal is to improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay this loan in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell breakfasts and lunches

loans.name: Lydia Mukiibi‘S Group

texts.en:
Lydia is 20 years of age and married with one child aged three years. She rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with two people and takes care of her parents. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Lydia works in Kalerwe Market and that is how she earns her living. She buys her produce from farmers and uses public transport to and from the villages. Lydia sells to all categories of people and works seven days week. Her monthly expenses include rent for the business, feeding the family, and school fees. She has been in this business for five years now. This is her first loan ever since she joined MCDT two weeks ago. Lydia wants to use this loan to buy more produce from villages She wants her business to grow and hopes to own her business' premises.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra J. is 43 years old and married with one child. She sells provisions like toothpaste, body cream, sugar, etc. She also sells juice and drinks. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions and juice to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and juice to sell

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 38 years old and married with a child. He produces and sells various colours of paints used for painting houses. He is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more materials for producing more paints to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for paint production

loans.name: Nakubulwa Justine‘S Group

texts.en:
Justine is 32 years old and a single mother of three children between 10 and 14 years old. She rents a one-roomed house where she is staying with three people and doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has no access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Justine sells second-hand clothes door to door She uses public transport to and from shopping, buying from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda, which is how she earns her living. Her monthly expenses include rent for her accommodation and school fees for her children.

Justine sells to all categories of people and works six days week. She has done this business for over ten years now. This is her fourteenth loan ever since she joined MCDT seven years ago, working with the same group-mates. Justine wants to use this loan to buy more clothes for resale. She aspires to growing her business and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Hadjah Muwanga‘S Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is 45 years of age, married, and has two children aged 10 and 27 years. She owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with twelve people and doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has access to electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah sells charcoal in Bwaise and doesn’t incur any extra transport cost as she buys from her place of work and that is how she earns her living. Her monthly expenses include licence and school fees for her children. Hadjah sells to all categories of people and works six days week. She has done this business for four months now and before joining the charcoal business she used to fry eatables.

This is her tenth loan since she joined MCDT five years ago, working with the same group-mates. Hadjah wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal for resale. She would like to see her business grow bigger and wants to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola is 33 years old and married with 4 children. She has a shop where she sells shoes and bags. She hopes to own a big boutique in the future. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions to sell

loans.name: Pitusiray Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se denomina “PITUSURAY”, cuenta con 15 miembros, entre varones y mujeres, todos residentes en la provincia de Calca, ubicado a 1:30 minutos en carro público de la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios del banco comunal realizan diferentes labores, teniendo como principal actividad, la agricultura, la ganadería y el comercio minorista, en su mayoría los socios trabajan en turismo, alguno de ellos tiene tiendas de joyas, textiles, artesanías, restaurantes, hospedajes, casas familiares, los socios solicitan el préstamo para ampliar sus negocios y mucho de ellos, mejorar los mismos.

Nuestros socios están muy agradecidos y valoran el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus préstamos en las fechas programadas.
texts.en:
This village bank is called “PITUSURAY”. It has 15 members, both men and women, all are residents of Calca province, located 1 hour and 30 minutes outside of Cusco by public car. The village bank members perform different tasks, with the main activities being agriculture, livestock farming, and retail. The majority of members also work in tourism, some have jewelry stores, textiles, handicrafts, restaurants, lodges, and home stays. Members are asking for a loan in order to expand their busineses and many of them to also improve themselves. Our members are very appreciative and value the support given by this method, they all agree to comply with loan payments on the dates scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To implement their businesses.

loans.name: Ndiaya

texts.fr: Ndiaya F., 27 ans est une femme mariée qui s’active dans le petit commerce et la restauration. Elle veut acheter des paniers, du tamarin, des chèvres, des condiments, du bissap, du pain de singe et du sucre. Les  paniers et le tamarin seront revendus, les chèvres sont abattues pour qu’une partie de la viande soit vendue et l’autre partie préparée en soupe à vendre. Le bissap et le pain de singe  et sucre servent à préparer des crèmes glaces et du jus à vendre. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille   Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Ndiaya F. is 27 years old and married. She is active in both her small business and in food preparation. She wants to buy baskets, tamarinds, goats, condiments, bissap (hibiscus flowers), monkey bread (baobab fruit) and sugar. The baskets and tamarind will be resold; the goats will be butchered to sell some of their meat and also to prepare soup to sell. The bissap, monkey bread and sugar will be used to prepare ice cream and juice to sell. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions. She will repay this loan in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell baskets, tamarind, meat, soup and ice cream

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo A. is 34 years old and married with one child. He has a provision shop where he sells noodles, milk, sugar, etc. He is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en: Abiodun is 30 years old and married with one child. He is a photographer. He is requesting the loan of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase a digital camera and film. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera and film

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru: Машхуре 29 лет, замужем. Последние несколько лет занимается предпринимательством. Весной она продает зелень, летом и осенью кроме зелени она еще продает консервы и различного рода овощи. Для закупа зелени она выезжает в Худжанд (100 километров от ее дома) и для того чтобы успеть купить подешевле, она выезжает рано утром. Уже к 7 утра она раскладывает товар на прилавке и торгует до позднего вечера. Для Машхуры торговля основной вид деятельности и дохода. Она подала заявку на займ и планирует увеличить свой оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Mashkhura S. is 29 years old and married. For the last few years she has been an entrepreneur. She sells herbs during the spring and also various vegetables and canned goods during the summer and autumn. She travels to Khujand (100 kilometers from her home) for the herbs and has to leave home early in the mornings in order to buy at cheaper prices. By 7 o’clock in the morning, Mashkhura already sets up her goods at her market stand and sells until the late evening. Retail is the only business and income source for Mashkhura. She requested the loan in order to increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Olawunmi

texts.en:
Olawunmi O. is 35 years old and married with four children. She has a tailoring shop where she sews clothes and sells crates of eggs and drinks.

She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more crates of eggs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Fansat

texts.en: Fansat is 31 years old and married with a child. Fansat sells shoes and bags in her shop. The demand for her shoes and bags is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Hothia

texts.fr: Hothia D. est un commerçant basé au quartier Santhiaba. Ce pére de famille vend du matériel électroménager (frigo etc). Il solicite ce crédit pour renforcer son fond de roulement afin d'assurer une meilleure rentabilité de son activité.
texts.en:
Hothia D. is a merchant based in the neighbourhood of Santhiaba. This father sells home appliances such as refrigerators and so on. He is asking for this loan in order to increase his working capital so as to ensure a better profit from his business.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell household appliances

loans.name: Pequeño Milagro Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendadoras de Fundacion Paraguaya. 
 
Una integrante del comite es Sra. Lida Rosa C. quien tiene 35 años. Ella tiene cuatro hijos que se queda con su madre en la casa mientras ella se va a confeccionar sus prendas en una calurosa fabrica en la zona de San Antonio. Por los fines de semana Lida se dedica a hacer arreglos de cierre en su barrio.  Por la tarde tiene ventas de comestibles que sale en compañía de su hijo menor a ofrecer sus comestibles caseros hecha por Doña Lida.  De esta manera ella ayuda a su pareja con los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos.

Ella es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un dia a dia muy pesado. Su horario de trabajo es de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde. Tiene una casita pequeña hecha de materiales precarias como pedazos de maderas y chapas. 

Las otras mujeres del comite son:

Lida Rosa C.  - Costurera
Marina C.  - Vta de comestibles
Letizia T. - Vta de Comestible
Myrian N. - 	Vta de carne
Yolanda D. de Ruiz D.  - Peluquera
Lourdes C.	 - Manicurista 
Maria Dolores E.  - Vta de merceria
Blanca Leonor B.  - Vta de lenceria
Paola O.  - Vta de Lenceria
Ramona S.   -  Vta de golosinas
Maria Victoria G.	 - Vta de cosmeticos
Sonia V.	 - Vta de ropas
Angela G.	  - Vta de comestibles
Marta C.  - 	Vta de mercerias
Maria V. - 	Peluquera 
Felicia R. - 	Vta de merceria
Viviana G. -  Peluquera
Alicia A. - 	Vta de calzados
texts.en:
The current committee is in its fourth loan cycle of the Enterprising Women of the Paraguayan Foundation program. One member of the group is Lida Rosa C. who is 35 years old. She has 4 children who stay at her mother’s home while she works making clothing in a hot factory in the San Antonio neighborhood. On weekends, Lida dedicates herself to doing alterations in her neighborhood. In the evening she sells food with her youngest son who accompanies her as she offers her homemade goods. In this way she helps her partner with household and child rearing expenses. Lida is a hardworking woman who has a very difficult day-to-day life. Her workday runs from seven in the morning to five in the afternoon. She has a small house made from precarious materials such as pieces of wood and corrugated metal. The other women in the committee are: Lida Rosa C. - Seamstress Marina C. - Food Sales Letizia T. - Food Sales Myrian N. - Meat Sales Yolanda D. de Ruiz D. - Hairdresser Lourdes C. - Manicurist Maria Dolores E. - Haberdashery Blanca Leonor B. - Sale of Lingerie Paola O. - Sale of Lingerie Ramona S. - Sale of Sweets Maria Victoria G. - Cosmetics Sales Sonia V. - Clothing Sales Angela G. - Food Sales Marta C. - Haberdashery Maria V. - Hair Salon Felicia R. - Haberdashery Viviana G. - Hairdresser Alicia A. - Shoe Sales

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of cosmetics, such as: lipsticks, creams, shampoos, deodorants, colognes, etc; Tailor-made clothing and bed sheets to be sold; Sale of women’s, men’s, and children’s shoes (moccasins, sandals, flats, etc); and various other items.

loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna D. née en 1958 est mère de famille. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Ndoucoura depuis 3 ans et demi Son activité  est la restauration  Elle compte acheter du lait, du café, du niébé, des spaghettis, du beurre et du gaz pour préparer et vendre le petit déjeuner  Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille   Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Sokhna D. was born in 1958 and has children. She has been a member of the village bank of Ndoucoura for three and a half years. She prepares food to sell. She will use the loan to buy milk, coffee, cowpeas, spaghetti, butter and gas to prepare and sell breakfasts. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions. She will repay this loan in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To prepare and sell breakfasts

loans.name: Saydi-Vakkoskhon

texts.ru: Саъди-ваккосхон и его жена занимаются торговлей занавесочными тканями. Опыт работы несколько лет. Раньше они только продавали ткани, а сейчас в связи с жесткой конкуренцией на рынке теперь они предлагают услуги замера, пошива и далее развешивания занавесок у клиента. Этим они привлекают все больше клиентов. Саъди-ваккосхону 38 лет, имеет 3 детей. Он подал заявку на займ и собирается выехать на оптовый рынок.
texts.en:
Saydi-vakkoskhon and his wife are involved in curtain fabrics sales. They have several years of experience in this business. In the past, they only sold fabrics, and now, due to tight market competition, they also offer services of measuring, making and placing curtains at clients’ locations. These additional services attract more and more clients. Saydu-vakkoskhon is 38 years old and has 3 children. He requested this loan and plans to use the funds at a wholesale market.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of new assortment of goods

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is 38 years old and married with 4 children. He is a motorcycle mechanic. He also sells motorcycle spare parts. He is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Funmilayo sells bottles of drinks and wine. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bottles of drinks and wine to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bottles of drinks and wine to sell

loans.name: Nizomidin

texts.ru: Низомиддин в занимается куплей продажей скота и сухофруктов. Опыт работы составляет несколько лет, когда он перестал работать на своей прежней работе. Низомиддину 52 года, женат и имеет 4 детей. Кроме этого бизнеса в содержании семьи Низомиддину помогают его старшие сыновья, которые работают в России и присылают денежные переводы. Низомиддин подал заявку на займ и собирается увеличить объемы своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nizomidin is involved in buying and selling livestock and dried fruit. He has several years of experience in the business ever since he stopped working at his previous job. Nizomidin is 52 years old, married and has 4 children. Besides this business, his sons, who work in Russia, also help to provide for the family by sending money home. Nizomidin requested this loan to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and sell small cattle.

loans.name: Lisala Plus Group

texts.fr: Kiki N. est esthéticienne de formation. Elle habite dans un quartier au centre de Kinshasa où elle exerce ses activités commerciales depuis 1995.  Sa première activité de 1995 -1999 fut le restaurant qu’elle ouvrit avec un capital initial de $150 qui se transforma en salon de coiffure en 1999 suite à son état de santé. Le salon de coiffure a bien évolué de 1999-2003 suite à sa spécialité. De 2003 jusqu’à ce jour, Kiki a diversifié son affaire en y ajoutant l’habillement dame dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Elle vend des pagnes, des chaussures dames, robes, etc… Dans le souci de réaliser son ambition d’ouvrir un jour un magasin d’habillement importé mixte, Kiki a décidé d’intégrer un des groupes de l’IMF Hope dénommé « Lisala » en juillet 2008. Elle y a obtenu deux fois le crédit qu’elle a remboursé régulièrement et totalement. Le crédit qu’elle a reçu ce mois d’avril lui a permis d’acheter des pagnes et des chaussures dames en vue de renforcer de son affaire. Actuellement, son capital est de $400. Son activité génère un bénéfice de $60 par semaine. Kiki a 44 ans d’âge, célibataire et mère d’une fille âgée de 16 ans qui est élève.
texts.en:
Kiki N. was trained as an esthetician. She lives in a central neighbourhood of Kinshasa where she has been in business since 1995. Her first business, from 1995 to 1999, was a restaurant which she opened with $150 in startup capital. This business became a beauty salon in 1999 because of her health. The beauty salon did well between 1999 and 2003 because of her speciality. Since 2003, Kiki has diversified her business: she has added women's clothing in order to increase her income. She sells "pagnes" (colourful cloth worn by women and wrapped like a sarong), dresses and so on. In order to reach her goal o fopening a boutique selling imported clothing for men and women, Kiki decided in July 2008 to join one of the groups, "Lisala", of the MFI Hope. She has already received two loans which were repaid on time and in full. The loan which she received in April allowed her to buy "pagnes" and ladies' shoes in order to bolster her business. Currently, her capital is $400. Her business generates a profit of $60 a week. Kiki is 44 years old, single, and the mother of a 16-year-old girl who attends school.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy "pagnes" and ladies' shoes to bolster her business

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra D., 39 ans est mariée avec 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de banc villageois depuis 4 ans Son activité  est la vente de chaussures, de draps et de pagnes  Diarra veut  renforcer son commerce et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Diarra D. is 39 years old. She is married and is responsible for seven children. She has been a member of her village bank for four years. Her business consists in selling shoes, sheets and pagnes (traditional lengths of cloth used somewhat like sarongs). Diarra wants to bolster her business and improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay this loan in one lump sum at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell shoes, sheets and "pagnes" (lengths of cloth)

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph A. is 42 years old and married with 4 children. He sells medicine to make a living. He is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is 45 years old and a widow with 5 children. She produces soap locally for washing. She also produces cellophane. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more materials to produce more soap and cellophane to sell.  She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for producing soap and cellophane to sell

loans.name: Olmoshon

texts.ru: Олмосхон торгует косточками от абрикосов. Она занимается этим уже давно и получает хорошую прибыль, которая идет на содержание семьи. Олмосхон 34 года, имеет 3 детей. Ее муж работает в России и каждый месяц присылает денежные переводы. Олмосхон собирается закупить оптовую партию косточек которую ей предложили недавно и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Olmoshon sells apricot pits. She has been doing this for a long time and earns good profits that go toward supporting her family. Olmoshon is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband works in Russia and every month sends a money transfer. Olmoshon plans to purchase a wholesale quantity of pits which was offered to her recently and this is why she has applied to KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pits for resale

loans.name: Mancabou Mécanique Group

texts.fr: Christian M. gére un garage de mécanicien. Il est basé au quartier de Tiléne, il forme des jeunes au métier de la mécanique auto. Cet entrepreneur, marié et pére de 3 enfants, sollicite ce crédit pour développer son garage qui jouit d'une grande réputation dans la capitale du sud. Il pourra renforcer ses piéces détachées.
texts.en:
Christian M. manages a mechanic’s garage. He is based in the Tiléne district. He trains young people in the trade of auto mechanics. This entrepreneur is married and the father of three. He’s requesting this loan to develop his garage, which enjoys a great reputation in the southern capital. He will be able to enhance his inventory of spare parts.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mechanics

loans.name: Adebayo

texts.en:
Adebayo A. is 31 years old and married with two children. Adebayo is a fashion designer and he also sells provisions.

He is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and designing materials. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and designing materials

loans.name: Adekunle

texts.en: Adekunle A. is 39 years old and married with a child. Adekunle sells sarongs and laces. His customers are mostly women and young girls. He is requesting a loan for N50,000 to purchase more sarongs and laces to sell. He says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and laces to sell

loans.name: Bigué

texts.fr: Bigué S. est une femme mariée, âgée de 44 ans. Elle envisage avec ce prêt de renforcer son petit commerce de fruits pour mieux augmenter ses revenus et contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bigué S. is a married woman who is 44 years old. She envisions using this loan to bolster her small fruit business in order to increase her revenues and to help with day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruit

loans.name: Kazeem

texts.en: Kazeem O. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. He sells motor spare parts for a living. Kazeem is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more motor spare parts. He says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Seliat

texts.en: Seliat is 60 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Seliat says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед парень 36 лет, вместе с женой воспитывают 3 детей. Жена воспитывает своего третьего ребенка, двое старших ходят в детсад. Хуршед занимается предпринимательством, которое является основным источником дохода семьи. Хуршед собирается немного расширить свой бизнес и подал заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Hurshed is a 36 year old young man; together with his wife he is raising 3 children. His wife is raising her 3rd child, the two older ones go to preschool. Hurshed has an entrepreneurial venture which provides the main source of income for him family. Hurshed would like to expand his business a little bit and applied to KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El comité “Primavera” cumple actualmente su 3er ciclo del programa D. Mujeres Emprendadoras D. Fundacion Paraguaya. Sus integrantes ya realizan una actividad productiva, por lo que ya se desenvuelven cada una en su propia microempresa.  Reciben un crédito promedio D. 500.000 y lo utilizan para  fomentar y variar la actividad que ya estan realizando como ser:  compra D. insumos para la fabricacion D. comestibles, compra D. leche azucar, yerba, harina, sal, panificados y verduras para su posterior venta, compra y venta D. bebidas como refrescos, gaseosas , cervezas, vinos cumpliendo asi con el compromiso D. crecer y cambiar su forma D. vida.
texts.en:
The committee "Primavera" (spring) has currently completed its third cycle with the progam Mujeres Emprendadors D. Fundacion Parguaya (Entrepreneurial Women of the Paraguay Foundation). Its members realize productive activity, as each has developed in her own micro-finance business. They receive average loans of 500.00 and use them to encourage and vary the activities that they are involved in. They incluD. buying of groceries to prepare artisanal foods; buying milk, sugar, herbs, oatmeal, salt, rolls, and vegetables for sale; the buying and selling of drinks like refreshments, sodas, beers and wines. They are committed to growth and to changing their lifestyles.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for special events, artisanal jewelry, milk, sugar, vegetables and fruits, wine, oil, and corn. To make and sell artisanal foods like sausage, blood-sausage, tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla S. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale dans un quartier populaire de Lomé. Elle détient ce commerce depuis 3 ans. Elle a une forte potentialité d’accroître son commerce car la concurrence n’est pas forte dans sa zone d’intervention. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour augmenter ses recettes afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Abla S., age 45, is married and the mother of four. She is the owner of a grocery shop in a working-class district of Lomé. She has been in this business for three years. She has a strong potential for growing her commerce because competition is not strong in her area of operation. She is counting on this opportunity to increase her receipts in order to respond better to the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Renacer” se formó gracias al deseo de mejoramiento y superacíon del nivel de vida de sus integrantes ya que son personas de muy escasos recursos. Ellas reciben un crédito promedio de 300.000 y lo utilizaran para diversas opciones de compra como ser: compra de insumos para la fabricacion de comestibles, compra de leche azucar, yerba, harina, sal panificados y verduras, compra venta de melon, sandia, banana, naranja y frutas diversas para su posterior venta, compra de ropas de ocasión para la venta , compra-venta de calzados , compra-venta de productos cárnicos, compra-venta de lácteos,compra-venta de huevos etc. 

Las mujeres del grupo hacen estos actividades para tratar de aumentar los ingresos y mejorar su forma de vida. 

Las integrantes del comite son: 


Cynthia A. -	Vta de lencería  - 
Melania G. - 	Vta de comestibles  -                                                                                                                                    
Susana V.	 - Reciclaje - 
Patricia R.  - 	Copetin - 
Carmen Z.	 - Vta de articulos varios - 
Felipa A. - Vta de comestibles - 
Liz B. - 	Vta de frutas - 
Andrea G. -	Vtas varias - 
Maria Gloria P. - 	Vta de bebidas - 
Maria G. - 	Vta de bebidas - 
Maria M.	 - Vta de verduras - 
Dionisia de M. - 	Vta de frutas y verduras - 
Miriam B. - 	Vta de grasa vacuna y porcina - 
Nilda B.	- Vta de ropa usada - 
Gilda B. - 	Vta de verduras - 
Nery R. - 	Vta de ropas - 
Ramona R. de A. - 	Vta de frutas y verduras - 
Emilce P. - 	Vta de comestibles
texts.en:
The committee “Rebirth” was formed thanks to the wish to overcome and improve the quality of life of the members given that they are people with limited resources. The group members will receive an average loan of 300 PEN that will be used to purchase various items, such as: to purchase supplies to make food items, to purchase milk, sugar, yerba mate tea, flour, salt, baked goods, and vegetables, to purchase and sell melons, watermelon, bananas, oranges, and various fruits to be later sold, to purchase clothing for various occasions to be sold, the purchase and sale of shoes, the purchase and sale of meat products, the purchase and sale of milk products, the purchase and sale of eggs, etc. The women of the group carry out these activites in an attempt to increase their income and improve their quality of life. The group members are: Cynthia A. - Lingerie Sales Melania G. - Food Sales Susana V. - Recycling Patricia R. - Aperitifs Carmen Z. - The Sale of Various Items Felipa A. - Food Sales Liz B. – Fruit Sales Andrea G. – The Sale of Various Items Maria Gloria P. - Beverage Sales Maria G. - Beverage Sales Maria M. - Vegetable Sales Dionisia de M. - Fruit and Vegetable Sales Miriam B. - Sale of Bovine and Pig Fat Nilda B. - Sale of Used Clothing Gilda B. - Vegetable Sales Nery R. - Clothing Sales Ramona R. de A. - Fruit and Vegetable Sales Emilce P. - Food Sales

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, yerba mate tea, oil, flour, baked goods, meat, tapioca, and sweet potato, to be later sold; to make and sell handmade foods such as: butifarra sausage, blood sausage, tortillas, empanadas, croquettes, etc; Sale of beverages such as: sodas, wine, beer, soft drinks, and ice cream; to purchase bananas, apples, oranges, pineapples, melons, watermelon, etc, to be later sold.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru: Иноят открыла маленький  магазин у себя дома. Она живет в поселке, который начал свое существование 3 года назад и, увидев, что открытие магазинчика принесет хорошую прибыль, она решила этим заняться. Муж Иноят находится в России на заработках, а она вместе со своими тремя детьми живет здесь. Иноят решила немного расширить свой бизнес и поэтому решила получить займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Inoyat opened a small store in her home. She lives in a village that began its existence 3 years ago and having seen that the opening of a store will bring good profits she decided to do this. Inoyat’s husband is in Russia earning money and she together with her three children lives here. Inoyat decided to expand her business a little bit and this is why she decided to take out a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 30 years old and married with four children. He is a mechanic and he also sells motor spare parts.

He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more spare parts to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Omowunmi

texts.en:
Omowunmi O. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She sells fruits, like apples. 

She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more apples to sell. Omowunmi says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more apples to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Ibodullo

texts.ru: Ибодулло 52 года, женат и имеет троих детей.Ибодулло и его жена арендуют небольшой магазин в центре города. Кроме них в этом же магазине торгуют еще несколько предпринимателей. Сам Ибодулло является координатором местного общественного объединения занимающегося проблемами трудоустройства работоспособного населения. Эта работа постоянная и занимает большую часть времени Ибодулло. А по выходным дням он помогает своей жене торговать, а также выезжает на оптовые рынки за товаром. Кроме Ибодулло и его жены в этом бизнесе также работает их племянница (на фото), которой он платит заработную плату. Ибодулло подал заявку на КИВА и собирается выехать на оптовый рынок в соседний Кыргызстан  за товаром.
texts.en:
Ibodullo is 52 years old; he is married and has three children. Ibodullo and his wife rent a small store in the center of the city. In addition to them several other entrepreneurs sell their products in the store. Ibodullo is the coordinator of the local public association focused on employment placement of the able bodied population. This job is constant and takes up a large portion of Ibodullo’s time. On the weekends he helps his wife to sell and also travels to wholesale markets to purchase products. In addition to Ibodullo and his wife, his niece (in photo) also works in the business; he pays her a salary. Ibodullo has turned an application in to KIVA and plans to travel to a wholesale market in neighboring Kirgizstan for products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a wholesale quantity of products

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: Leonarda tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años respectivamente, Leonarda junto con su esposo se dedican a la fabricación y venta de cocinas solares, esto es normalmente a pedio sin embargo por ser novedoso y práctico tiene gran aceptación en la mayoría de la gente del campo ya que sus ventas las realizan en ese medio.  No tienen mucha competencia ya que este tipo de cocinas son innovadoras y bien aceptadas por los consumidores.  Con el crédito otorgado por Agrocapital, se esta incrementando su capital de operaciones  ya que su negocio ha estado incrementando su capacidad de producción y ventas, por otra parte, Leonarda ha venido cancelando con toda normalidad y buen cumplimiento. La familia de Leonarda se identifica con la institución ya que su primer crédito fue con Agrocapital  y en la actualidad solo trabaja con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Leonarda has 2 children who are 12 and 8 respectively. Leonarda and her husband dedicate themselves to the production and sale of solar kitchens; this is usually done on order, nevertheless, for being novel and practical it has become well accepted by the majority of people living in rural areas given that their sale is carried out in this setting. They do not have a lot of competition given that these types of kitchens are innovative and well accepted by consumers. With the credit granted by Agrocapital, they are increasing their capital for operations given that their business has been growing in both production and sales, on the other hand, Leonarda has been paying back her first loan regularly and fulfilling her commitment well. Leonarda’s family identifies with this institution given that their first loan was with Agrocapital and currently she only works with this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Arame

texts.fr: Arame N. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée. Elle s’active dans l’élevage bovin et aimerait augmenter ses revenus. Elle pourrait ainsi, avec activité, faire face aux besoins familiaux dont elle est quotidiennement confrontée.
texts.en:
Arame N. is 52 years old and married. She is active in raising cattle and would like to increase her revenues. Through her work, she would thus be able to cope with family needs, which she must confront daily.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise cattle and commerce in vegetables

loans.name: Сарвархон

texts.ru: Сарвархон сотрудничает с Микроинвест уже 1,5 года. За этот период она заметно увеличила свой оборотный капитал и улучшила свои жизненные условия. Ее бизнес – это купля продажа сухофруктов. 5 дней в неделю она выезжает на местные рынки и торгует там. И хотя ей уже 62 года она продолжает заниматься этим. Сарвархон замужем. Воспитала 3 детей. Она подала заявку на КИВА и собирается поехать на соседние рынки для закупа товара.
texts.en:
Sarvarhon has been working with MicroInvest for 1.5 years. During this period she has noticeably increased her working capital and improved her quality of life. Her business is the purchase and sale of dried fruits. 5 days per week she travels to local markets and sells there. And even though she is 62 years old she continues to do this. Sarvarhon is married. She raised 3 children. She has put her application on KIVA and plans to travel to neighboring markets to purchase products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Enoch

texts.en:
Enoch K. is a forty one year old married man and a father of six children; three sons and three daughters. According to him, his youngest children have yet to start school. The older children are in the junior high and primary school. His wife trades in food stuffs. Enoch lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment, in a town called Achiase. Achiase is in a farming area and a busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Enoch runs a provision store which is located on the main street. He also sells food stuffs. He procures his goods from suppliers who deliver in vans and sometimes he must travel to nearby larger towns to buy supplies.

Enoch has been in business for thirteen years and wants a loan to procure more goods to increase his inventory. He hopes to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions for his shop

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua Y. is thirty seven years old. She is married and has given birth to three children; one daughter and two sons. She says one of her children is in the junior high school while the others are in primary school. Akua lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Akua works to support her husband financially with providing for the family. Her husband is a carpenter by profession.

Akua is a trader. She runs a provision shop in the market square. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to sponsor all of her children to university.

loans.use: To procure provisions for her shop

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two daughters and two sons. She says one of her children has completed the junior high school while the others are in the primary schools. She says she lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Akua works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Akua’s husband is a farmer.

Akua is a trader. She prepares and sells pastries such as meat pies, doughnuts, chips (french fries), etc. Akua distributes to retailers in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns.

Akua has been in business for six years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the university level.

loans.use: To procure goods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa G., 37 ans, est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus, chaussures, parfums et divers accessoires. Elle souhaiterait améliorer ce commerce afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa G., age 37, is married and the mother of four. She is active in the commerce of cloth, shoes, perfumes, and various accessories. She would like to improve this business in order to be able to improve her family’s situation regarding health and schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth, shoes, perfumes, and various accessories

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel A. is a 53-year-old married man and the father of two daughters and three sons. He tells us that two of his children are in the senior high school and the others are in the junior high school. His wife is a hardworking woman who works with him in running his provision store. Emmanuel lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase, which is a busy farming and trading community in the eastern region of Ghana.

Emmanuel runs a roadside provision store. He also sells vegetables on a tabletop in front of the shop. He procures his goods from suppliers who come from other areas in vans to distribute goods, and sometimes he travels to bigger towns nearby to make purchases.

Emmanuel has been in business for two years and requests a loan to procure more goods in order to increase his stock. He hopes to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure provisions for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace F. is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both sons. She says both of her sons are in the basic school. She says she lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Grace works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is into mining activity.

Grace is a trader. She fries and sells yams in the day and in the evening. She serves the fried yam with ground pepper and fried fish. She sells by the roadside to passers-by. She procures tubers of yam from wholesalers in Accra and sometimes directly from the farmers.

Grace has been in business for barely a year now and wants a loan to procure yams and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the university level.

loans.use: To procure yams and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.en:
Bismarck O., 37, married, is the father of a 10-year-old boy who is currently pursuing his education in primary school. The family lives in a rented apartment at Oda, a farming community in the eastern region of Ghana, where most of the inhabitants are farmers.

Bismarck is a petty trader and trades in palm nut fruits. He purchases the palm fruits in bulk from farmers in the villages and supplies them to retailers in the cities. From this business, he supports his family and pays for his son's schooling.

He wants to use the loan as an opportunity to purchase palm fruits in bulk so that he may keep a supply in store, thus avoiding price hikes as well as cutting back on frequent traveling. He hopes to increase his income in order to continue to pay his son’s school fees.

He is a member of the trust group called “Adehyee Mma” (translated as "Royals"). In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan, and they support one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase palm fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Мархабо

texts.ru: Мархабо арендует прилавок в местном торговом центре Исфары. Она замужем. 36 лет и имеет троих детей. Воспитанием детей занимается свекровь, а Мархабо с утра до вечера торгует. Муж находится на заработках в России. Мархабо собирается добавить в ассортимент новые модели обуви и поэтому подала заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Marhabo rents a stall at the local shopping center in Isfara. She is married, is 36 years old and has three children. Her mother-in-law takes care of the children and Marhabo sells from morning until evening. Her husband is earning money in Russia. Marhabo plans to add new shoe styles to her selection and this is why she has applied to KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new shoes for sale

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa N. est une dame de 67 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle vend du poisson et fait en même temps de l’élevage. Elle souhaiterait développer son commerce afin d’augmenter ses capacités financières. Cette activité lui permet de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Awa N. is 67 years old; she is married and has one child. She sells fish and at the same time raises animals. She wants to develop her business more in order to increase her revenues. Her business allows her to better care for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fish

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is fifty eight years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children. Her three remaining children, who still live at home, are in school. Victoria has been working to help her husband to support their children. She bakes bread and fries dough nuts to sell at the elementary schools in her community. 

She buys the necessary materials in the city of Accra. Some of the ingredients she uses are flour, sugar, oil, etc. She has been in business for twenty two years. Victoria wants to use the loan to procure the materials in bulk to cut down on transportation costs. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called “Iku shi Allah”, where the members guarantee one another as collateral and support one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and oil in bulk.

loans.name: Florene

texts.en:
Florence A. is a thirty six year old married woman with five children; two boys and three girls. They are currently pursuing education in primary and junior high school. Florence’s husband works with a mining company. She lives with the family at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are into farming activities. 

Florence trades in textiles, fabrics, and second hand clothes. She buys textiles, fabrics, and all kinds of second hand clothes, most especially, skirts, blouses, ladies slippers and shoes from Accra, a nearby city and sells them in the market square in her community. She sells her products from a small shop.  Florence has been in business for three years and wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure bales of textiles and shoes. She believes the loan assistance would enable her to upgrade her inventory and eventually, improve her profits.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and fabrics.

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: Monsieur Dama S. est un homme marié qui a 35 ans, il habite au quartier Malamy Senghor de Thiès, il est boutiquier juste à coté de la caisse Jammy Xaleyi  et a décidé d’intégrer l’IMCEC  pour développer son commerce. Il est à son premier prêt  avec lequel il veut renforcer sa boutique, il réalise un bon chiffre d’affaire d’où un bénéfice de 150000fcfa. Ce bénéfice lui permet de rembourser les intérêts du prêt, d’entretenir sa famille et aussi d'investir  le reste dans sa boutique
texts.en:
Mr. Dama S. is a married man who is 35 years old. He lives in the Malamy Senghor district of Thiès and is a shopkeeper located next to the Jammy Xaleyi bank. He decided to join IMCEC to develop his commerce. He's on his first loan, with which he wants to enhance his shop. He's realizing good sales figures resulting in a profit of 150,000 francs CFA. This profit enables him to make loan interest payments, to care for his family, and also to invest the rest in his shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enhance his shop

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida D. is forty years old. She is the mother of two children and is still married. Her kids attend school in the primary and junior high schools. Vida lives with her family in a family apartment at a community called Oda. Oda is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in the farming activities. However, many are also involved in trading and other business activities. 

Vida is a hair dresser by profession. She does both plaiting and perming. She says she started her solon five years ago and has since trained five young ladies in hair dressing who have started their own businesses in other communities. Apart from hairdressing, she also trades in groceries. She has her grocery kiosk attached to her beauty saloon. 

This loan would enable her to buy hairdressing equipment, fashion accessories, artificial human hair, pomades and other material that she will need to serve her clients satisfactorily. She hopes to increase her income to allow her to save more to support her childrens education. Vida is a member of the Charity Trust Bank group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide support in repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials and fashion accessories.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: one son and four daughters. She says her son dropped out of school for no apparent reason. The rest are still in the junior high and the primary schools. She says she lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Yaa works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a retired agriculturalist.

Yaa is a trader. She runs a provision store in the market square. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns.

Yaa has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful she will achieve this expansion.

loans.use: To procure goods in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. is a fifty year old woman, still married and the mother of three children: two boys and a girl. One boy is in the Army, the other is an electrician and the girl is still in school. Rose’s husband is a retired educationist. She lives with the family at Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are into farming activities.

Rose trades in textiles and secondhand clothes. She buys textiles and all kinds of secondhand clothes, most especially skirts, blouses and ladies slippers, from the city of Accra. She sells them in the market square in her community. She says she sells in a small shed in the market area.

She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to increase her working capital so as to be able to procure bales of textiles and ladies’ slippers. She believes the loan assistance will enable her to upgrade her inventory and, eventually, to make very good profits.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles and ladies' slippers

loans.name: Fa Bineta

texts.fr: Fa Bineta N. est une femme de 49 ans, mariée. Elle fait un petit commerce en détail d’encens, de parfum et souhaiterait renforcer cette activité. Elle envisage avec ses revenus, de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Fa Bineta N. is a 49-year-old married woman. She has a small retail business selling incense and perfume and would like to bolster her business. With her revenues, she envisions doing better in providing for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell incense and perfume

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo T. est un boucher à Lomé. Agé de 35 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Kodzo exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans. Pour répondre aux besoins pressants de la population, il espère avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV acheter des bœufs, des moutons et des boucs pour l’abattage. Il souhaite aussi entreprendre l’élevage des chèvres et porc pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kodzo T. is a butcher in Lomé. He is 35 years old, married, and the father of two. He's been in this business for three years. To respond to the pressing needs of the population, he hopes to use this initial FECECAV loan to buy steers, sheep, and rams for slaughter. He would also like to take on the raising of nanny goats and pigs to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy steers, sheep,and nanny-goats for slaughter

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina B. is 42 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. She says all of her daughters are currently in the nurses training college while her son is into commercial driving. Georgina lives with her family in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.
 
Georgina is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles and clothes for both sexes and also in bed sheets. She procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. Georgina says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for barely one year and desires to expand her business. With this loan, she hopes to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To procure second hand textiles

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a fifty-year-old woman, still married and the mother of six children who are all pursuing education. Mary lives with her husband and children in a community called Oda. A sizable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number of the women are involved in palm oil production. Mary is one of such women who actively produce palm oil. She has been in business for eight years. Her husband is a food-crop farmer.

Mary buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community. She processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the meat of the palm nuts which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (the oil) is skimmed off and re-boiled to expel its water content.

Mary wants to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm nuts in bulk so as to be able to supply palm oil to more customers. She believes the loan assistance will enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and, eventually, help improve her family finances.

Mary is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and to support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris Y. is thirty years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Currently, they are all pursuing education in junior and primary schools. She lives together with her family in a family house in a town called Akim Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Doris works with zeal as a resourceful parent to support her family and provide for the children's schooling. She is a fish monger and also runs a small grocery shop. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She procures her goods from big time fish mongers in Yeji and Mankessim towns, who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for five years. According to Doris, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte B. is a fifty-year-old married mother of four. One of her children is currently with the police service, two are doing their own businesses and the last-born is pursuing an education in a teacher-training college. Charlotte lives with her husband in a community called Oda. Oda is in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, a quite appreciable number of the women are involved in palm oil production. Charlotte is one of these women who actively produce palm oil. She has been in business for five years. Her husband is a farmer.

She buys the palm nuts from the local farmers in her community; processes them in her house to produce the oil and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from the food of the palm fruits which has been cooked, pounded, sieved and boiled for hours. The reddish substance (thus the oil) is skimmed off and reboiled to expel water content.
