She desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying the palm fruits in bulk to be able to supply more customers.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to scale up production to serve larger market and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits in bulk

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega la señora María S. desde hace cinco años se dedica a su actividad de pulpería habiéndola establecido con mucho esfuerzo con el propósito de mantener a su familia compuesta por sus tres hijos los cuales busca la manera de cómo llevarles el sustento en sus estudios.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería y así seguir adelante en este negocio
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, María S. for the past five years has dedicated herself to her small grocery store. Having established it with much effort her intention was to maintain her family composed of three children, and she is hoping to find a way for support them in their studies. Currently she has sought Ceprodel to be benefited with a loan to purchase products for her small grocery store and in that way continue moving forward in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase product for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is sixty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, five sons and two daughters. She says some of her children are working while others are learning trades. She says one of her sons is in the university.

She lives with her family in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

She is a trader. She trades in toiletries such as washing soap, bathing soap, etc. She procures cartons of all kinds of soap from wholesalers in Oda. Adwoa sells on a table top in the community market. She has been in business for barely one year and desires to expand her business. She wants a loan to procure more goods to increase her stock. Adwoa is hoping to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy toiletries for resale

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Currently, they are all pursuing education in primary school. She lives with her family in a house in a town called Akim Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works with zeal as a resourceful mother to support her family and provide for the children's schooling.

She is a fish monger and sells all kinds of fresh and smoked fishes. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She procures her stock of fish from big time fish mongers in Mankessim town, who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for eight years. According to Akua, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Savza

texts.ru: Савза и ее муж (на фото) продают детскую одежду на центральном рынке города Исфары. Для этого арендуют маленький магазин размерами 3 на 4,5 метра. Савза и ее муж не имеют постоянной работы и занятие предпринимательством основной источник дохода. За товаром ездят по очереди раз в неделю, при этом один из них остается троговать. Савзе 49 лет, имеет 3 детей. Она  сотрудничает с МикроИнвест уже 2 года и собирается и дальше получать займы для расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Savza and her husband (on the photo) sell children's clothing on the central market of the town of Isfara. They rent out a small store of a size of three by four and a half meters. Savza and her husband do not have permanent jobs and their business is the only source of income. One of them travels to bring the merchandise once a week, while the other stays to do the sales. Savza is 49 years old, she has three children. She has been collaborating with MicroInvest for two years now and plans to take out loans again to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is forty-two years old. She is a married mother of four kids who are in junior high and basic school. Comfort’s husband works as a farmer. Comfort and her family live at a family house in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants of Oda are either farmers or trade in farm products. Very few people run different types of businesses.

Comfort trades in cosmetics and clothing materials. She buys cosmetics such as powder, assorted pomades, make-up, etc. and clothing materials from Accra, a nearby city, and sells in the market square in her community. She says she also treks to nearby markets to sell through door-to-door sales. She has been in this business for five years now and wants a loan to increase her working capital so that she can purchase cosmetics in bulk.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to reach out to other market centers and eventually, help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothing materials in bulk .

loans.name: Leonardo De La Concepción

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Leonardo M. se dedica arduamente a laborar en su negocio de ferretería el cual atiende muy amablemente todos los días con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos y así mantener su núcleo familiar.

Hoy en día el señor M. ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros para así mejorar las condiciones de dicho negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Leonardo M. arduously dedicates himself to working in his hardware business, which he amiable attends to every day with the intention of improving his income and in that way maintain his nuclear family. Today Mr. M. has sought Ceprodel to solicit a loan to purchase hardware products and in that way improve the conditions of said business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hardware products.

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr: Mame Yacine D. est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de drap de lit et rideaux qu’elle confectionne elle-même. Elle souhaite améliorer cette activité pour  appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Mame Yacine D., age 51, is married and the mother of seven. She is active in the commerce of bed sheets and curtains that she makes herself. She would like to improve this business to support her husband in caring for the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell bed sheets and curtains

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba I. is 35 years old. She is married and has two children. Currently her children are in school in the community where they live. She lives with her husband who is a farmer. Abiba never had the opportunity to attend school when she was a child due to financial challenges. It is her dream to see her children in tertiary education through her and her husband's efforts.

She prepares and sells kose in a nearby porridge joint where most people buy the porridge and the kose. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taking with what we call kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With a large customer base, Abiba wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, vegetable oil, pepper etc. to increase production. She hopes to make a good income to support her kids in school. She treks to tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her supply of goods. Abiba belongs to a village bank called 1st Kings.

loans.use: Ingredients for porridge and kose

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther Y. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has four children, two daughters and two sons. She says one of her children is in junior high school while the others are in primary school. She says she lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Esther works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband trades in second hand clothes.

Esther is a trader. She trades in all types and sizes of wood. She sells the wood in a kiosk at her place of residence. She procures the wood directly from the sawmill operators in her community. Esther has been in this business for barely one year now. She is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the university level.

loans.use: To buy wood for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah O. is 55 years old. She is married with seven children. Her husband farms cocoa and crops. At the moment, five are gainfully employed, one is in senior high school, and her last born has passed away. She is a local manufacturer of palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil. Palm oil is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale due to inadequate capital to buy machines for the processing.

In addition to the palm oil business, she is also produces and sells food like banku. Banku is prepared from milled grains and is taken with soup or pepper with fish. She has been in this business for the last three using the proceeds to cater for her family needs.

She says this has also slown due to current food prices in the world market. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. Sarah also needs the loan for the purchase of maize, vegetables, meats and fish etc. Sarah again believes this will help expand her business, provide more income to help her husband to provide food, and finance her children's education. Abiba belongs to a village bank called 1st Kings.

loans.use: Ingredients for food production

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel D. is a fifty-eight-year-old married man and the father of seven children, four sons and three daughters. Some are in senior high while others are in junior high schools. His wife trades in smoked fish to make some income to support him financially. He lives with his wife and children in a family house in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a busy farming and trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Emmanuel deals in soap production. He manufactures locally and distributes to retailers. He produces the soap from raw materials such as soda ash, detol and palm oil. He also sells in a store at the local market. He procures the raw material from nearby wholesale dealers. Emmanuel has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure the chemicals in bulk. He is hoping to give his children the best possible education.

loans.use: Materials for soap production

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is 28 years old. She is married and has three children. All her children are still in school and her husband is a buyer and seller of diamonds. She lives with her family in a village called Takroase in the eastern region of Ghana. Grace is very hardworking and supportive to her husband in providing food and shelter for her household.

She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood which stocks items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. It has been her dream to make an expansion by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and foodstuffs like tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs. She has been in this business for six years now. Grace belongs to a village bank called 1st Kings.

loans.use: To expand store inventory

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has five children, three sons and two daughters. Her children are in primary and junior-high school.  Her husband is a farmer.  Kate lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. 
. 
Kate works as a trader to support her husband and provide for the family. She runs a provision store in the market square. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure provisions

loans.name: Muzambil

texts.ru: Свой третий займ на КИВА Музамбил собирается и дальше вкладывать в свой бизнес. В ее личной жизни произошли некоторые изменения. Ее муж срочно выехал на заработки в Россию, где ему предложили хорошую высокооплачиваемую работу. Поэтому Музамбил осталась в магазине одна и решила привлечь на работу свою племянницу. Музамбил надеется, что заработок мужа и ее доход от торговли помогут достойно вырастить своих двоих маленьких детей.
texts.en:
Muzambil plans to use her third loan from Kiva to invest into her business. There were some changes in her life. Her husband has left to work in Russia where he was offered a good high paying job. This is why Muzambil was left in the store by herself and decided to attract her niece into the business. Muzambil hopes that her profits from the business and her husband's income will help them to decently raise their small children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Both of her children are in the primary school. Mary lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver. 


Mary is a trader who works to support her husband financially.  She trades in textiles and ladies’ underwear. She sells her goods at the local market and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Mary buys her materials from wholesalers in Accra. She has been in business for more than eight years now and is seeking a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She hopes to provide all of her children a college education.

loans.use: To buy textiles and underwear.

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en:
Kwasi B. is a fifty-eight-year-old married man and a father of four children, two sons and two daughters. His two eldest children have completed school and are working. The rest are in senior high and junior high schools. His wife is a professional midwife in the local government hospital. Kwasi lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a busy farming antd rading community in the eastern region of Ghana. 


He is a farmer and also runs a drugstore in his community. He sells drugs such as paracetamol (also known as acetaminophen), syrups and other kinds of tablets. His drugstore is located at the local market square. He visits the farm early in the mornings to make time for the drugstore later on in the day. He procures the drugs from nearby bigger towns. Kwasi has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk. He hopes to provide his children with the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure drugs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret B. started her local restaurant 20 years ago in Takroase, a suburb of Akim Oda, where she lives. Takroase is a mining community where most of the young ones have occupied themselves with the mining business. She identified the opportunity of providing food when she realized people need good, tasty meals to satisfy their hunger. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood.

She is now 38 years old and married with eight children. Six of her children are in school while the rest are working. She serves many kinds of local dishes like fufu, banku and fried fish, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

She says demand for her food is increasing but her problem has to do with funds to buy more raw materials. She requests a loan to buy increased supplies of cassava, maize, fish, firewood, etc., to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. Margaret belongs to a village bank called 1st kings.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish and firewood

loans.name: Siaw

texts.en:
Siaw M. is forty years old. He is married and the father of five, three sons and two daughters. The first born has completed senior high school. The rest are in the senior high and junior high schools. His wife runs a general store. Siaw lives with the family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a busy farming and trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

He is a school proprietor. His school has from stage one to the junior high level. According to Siaw, he has hired both professionals and non-professionals as knowledge facilitators. He wants a loan to buy additional textbooks to build the school’s library. He is hopeful to build the school to the senior high level.

loans.use: Books for the school library

loans.name: Akwasi

texts.en:
Akwasi A. is a thirty-five year old married man and the father of four children, three of whom are boys. He says all of them are still in the primary school. His wife trades in textile materials. Akwasi lives with the wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a farming and busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akwasi has a sand winning business. What he does is he acquires a piece of land and hires workers to dig for the sand which he then sells to building contractors in tipper trucks. Akwasi says that after winning the sand, the land returns to the owner from whom he acquired it.

Akwasi has been in business for six years. He is hopeful to give his children the best possible education.

loans.use: To acquire a piece of land for sand winning

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is 56 years old. She is married and has eight children. Two of her children are in school, three are working and, unfortunately, she has lost three of them. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits. Mercy has been selling grocery items for the past twenty years to take care of the family. She has no regrets about what she does but her only challenge is having enough funds to buy more raw materials. She takes delivery of stock from Akim Oda and retails to her customers. She therefore requests a loan. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, and other items to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. She also sells cooked rice with stew in addition to the grocery business. Mercy belongs to a village bank called 1st Kings.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her grocery store

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
A.	Julienne est née vers 1957 à Abomey Calavi dans le Département de l’Atlantique au Sud du Bénin. Julienne est mariée à JOHSON Prosper comptable de profession. Julienne a trois enfants tous scolarisés; un seul est encore à charge; les deux autres sont majeurs. Julienne et sa famille vit au quartier SCOA-GBETO à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Julienne vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.) dans sa boutique. Julienne a déjà eu trois crédits avec ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a hissé son activité au niveau où elle est actuellement. Julienne achète ses articles à Tokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Julienne veut développer son activité à la hauteur des attentes de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Julienne demande un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Julienne was born around 1957 in Abomey Calavi, in Atlantique County in southern Benin. She is married to JOHSON Prosper, an accountant by profession. She has three children, all schooled. One of them is still in her care; the other two are of age. Julienne and her family live in the SCOA-GBETO district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells various goods (candy, cookies, canned milk, sardines, and tomatoes, sugar, pasta, and soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, etc.) in her shop.

She has already had three ALIDÉ loans that she repaid. With those loans, she raised her business to a level at which it currently is. She buys her goods in Tokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She wants to develop her business up to the expectations of her customers. This is why she's asking ALIDÉ for a fourth loan.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Candy, cookies, canned milk, sardines, and tomatoes, sugar, pasta, and soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, etc.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар подает свою третью заявку на КИВА. Прошлый займ по подсчетам Санобар принес ей приличную прибыль, и она решила купить своим детям DVD-проигрыватель. Это приобретение означает для нее еще один большой плюс в улучшении жизненных условий. Санобар собирается и дальше развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sanobar is applying for a loan for the third time on Kiva. By Sanobar's calculations her previous loan has given her a good profit and she decided to buy her children a DVD player. This purchase means a huge plus in improvements in living conditions for her family. Sanobar plans to continue to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert A. is 45 years old. He is married and the father of five children: four sons and one daughter. The last born is currently in the senior high school. The rest have all completed school and are working. His wife trades in infant layettes. Robert lives with the family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a busy farming and trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. He is an auto electrician by profession. He mends electrical problems in clients’ vehicles. He says he also charges their vehicles’ batteries. Robert has a shop at the lorry station in his community. He also has some apprentices who are in training. He has been in business for over eighteen years. He wants a loan to buy more car batteries.

loans.use: To buy car batteries

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte A. is 22 years old. She is single and she lives with her mother and younger siblings in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Charlotte works to make some income to provide for the family.  She supports her mother financially and helps meet her younger siblings’ demands.

She is a trader. She prepares and sells pastries such as meat pies, doughnuts, and chips. Charlotte distributes to retailers in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure food in bulk for distribution to retailers

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora Y. is a twenty-nine-year-old trader. She is married with one child who is currently attending school.  Her child is in school with the help of the government's free compulsory education. It is Dora's daily dream to provide quality education for her child and for the children who are yet to come. 

 
She lives at a family house in Takroase in the eastern region of Ghana. Within the community, there are diverse businesses, including miners and farmers. Dora owns and operates a grocery store with items like rice, canned food and drinks,cooking oil, biscuits, candy and evaporated milk. Dora says commodity prices are rising in the market, making it difficult to meet her target. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned food and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock in different varieties, she hopes to make more income to provide for her child's educational needs. Dora belongs to a village bank called 1st Kings.

loans.use: To buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned food and drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 45 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to five children: two sons and three daughters. She says some of her children are in school while others are doing apprenticeships. Mary says she lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She says she lost her husband four years ago.

She is a trader. She trades yam and smoked fish. She sells at the local market and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Mary procures tubers of yam and the smoked fish from wholesalers in Accra. She has been in business for over 20 years now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to sponsor all her children to the university level.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel F., a 35-year-old trader, is married and the father of three children. Two of the children are in school and his last born is still breastfeeding. Samuel is a very resourceful and hardworking father whose hard efforts bring livelihood to the family.

Samuel supports his children through the sale of used belts and socks. The selling of used belts and socks has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new socks, belts and even clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore the selling of used products like socks and belts has created a business for many men. He has been in this business for the past ten years. Samuel travels to a nearby city called Accra to purchase his stock of goods.

Samuel wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used socks and belts to increase his inventory. He believes this loan would help him to save for his children’s future and also enable him to rent a store to trade in. He mostly sells through hawking, that is: house-to-house selling.

Samuel belongs to a village bank called “1st Kings” and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used socks and belts

loans.name: Sarita Group

texts.es:
Foto: De izquierda a derecha, Elízabeth del Socorro L., Catherine Azucena R. Jirón e Iveth de los Angeles Jarquín Gaitán.

El grupo solidario Sarita está integrado por doña Elizabeth L.  quien se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante, ofrece ropa usada y nueva, tiene cinco hijos, dos de ellos le ayudan a comercializar y el resto son menores y van a la escuela, tiene tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad.

La otra integrante es doña Iveth Jarquín quien vende carnes en su domicilio desde hace dos años, ofrece carne de res y cerdo. Ha crecido en su negocio, con el crédito compró mas producto y así tiene cada vez más clientes.

Doña Catherine Azucena R. que es la coordinadora del grupo, ella se dedica a la elaboración de Sandalias específicamente de un estilo que es el llamado de trenzas; tiene seis años de experiencia en este oficio, junto con su esposo instalaron un taller  en la casa de su mamá, sueñan con tener su casa propia y poder instalarlo con más condiciones.
Tiene un niño pequeño de 5 años, va a la escuela, ella lo atiende y hace labores de la casa y el tiempo restante lleva las cuentas del taller y ayuda a elaborar, por ahora ha contratado un ayudante y así tener mas tiempo para administrar mejor el negocio. Expresa que el crédito que obtuvo en Adim lo utilizó en la compra de materiales como pega, cuero y suelas.

El grupo espera siempre ser un grupo puntual, esto les ha dado mucha satisfacción y oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
Photo: From left to right, Elízabeth del Socorro L., Catherine Azucena R. Jirón e Iveth de los Angeles Jarquín Gaitán. The group Sarita is formed by doña Elizabeth L. who as a walking saleswoman, sells clothing. She offers used and new clothing. Elizabeth has 5 children, two of which help her in business. The rest are young and go to school. She has been selling clothes for three years. The other member is doña Iveth Jarquín who has sold meats from her house for two years. She offers beef and pork. She has grown in her business, with the loans she buys more product and in doing so, each time she has more clients. Doña Catherine Azucena R., who is the coordinator of the group, sells sandals, spicifically of a stile that is called "braided." She has six years of experience in this work. Together with her husband she installed a workshop in her mothers house. They dream to have their own house and to be able to build it with more amenities. She has a small boy of 5, who goes to school. She cares for him and completes chores around the house. The rest of the time, she carries out the accounting of the workshop and helps in constructing sandals. For now she has contracted a helper and because of this she has more time to administrate her business better. She expresses that the loan that she obtained in Adim was used to buy materials like glue, leather, and soles. The group wishes to always be a punctual wone. This has given them a lot of satisfaction and opportunity for work.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve the sandal workshop that is described.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort B. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: one son and four daughters. She says some of her children have completed school and are working. Others are still in the junior high school and the primary school.

Comfort lives with her children and husband in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband works at a sawmill company in their community. She is a trader. She trades in second-hand textiles – clothes for both sexes and also bed sheets.

She procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. Comfort says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for seven years and desires to expand her business. She is hoping to improve her standard of living and sponsor her children to higher levels of academia.

loans.use: To procure second-hand textiles

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S., 47, is married to a photographer and has five children, three sons and two daughters. One is a teacher while the rest are in the senior high and the junior schools. She lives with the family in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Afia trades in foodstuffs such as yams, procuring the tubers all the way from the northern part of the country and selling them from a store in the market to food vendors and other customers. Afia has been in business for three years and is requesting a loan to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best of educations.

loans.use: To procure tubers of yam.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel D. is a 27-year-old man. He is married with one child. His child is in school. Emmanuel is a Christian dedicated to the service of his maker, God, and a very resourceful father. His daily dream is to be able to work hard to provide his child with quality education for a better future career. 

Emmanuel's wife is a trader. He and his wife live together at Takroase in the eastern region of Ghana. He owns and operates a grocery shop in a busy local market and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned food, peanuts, evaporated milk etc. 

Emmanuel needs loan support to expand his business. With the loan, he wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc., to increase his stock. He hopes to save more to finance his child's school fees.  Emmanuel belongs to a village bank called Divine and would be grateful for your loan support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua Appiah-Tuah is 52 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all sons who have completed senior high school and are currently working. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua lives with the husband and the children in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akosua is a trader. She trades in footwear. She sells all sorts of footwear for both males and females. Akosua hawks to sell her goods in her community. She procures the footwear from Accra. She has been in business for two years and desires to expand her business. Akosua says she is also in the palm-oil production business. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate P. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has  four children, two sons and two daughters, in primary and junior high school. Kate lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She works to support her husband and family financially, and especially to meet the children’s school needs. Kate’s husband is a farmer who cultivates food and cash crops.


Kate is a trader. She runs a provision store on one of the principal streets in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.  Her intention is to expand her business and give her children the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure more groceries

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D. deals in palm oil. She produces the palm oil and distributes to retailers who come from other towns to buy by the gallon. Ama procures the palm nuts from farmers in the nearby communities at good prices. She has been in business for six years and wants to expand her business.
Ama is 30-years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all sons who are in junior and senior high schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a house in the farming/commercial town of Achiase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana.
Ama is requesting a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk. She hopes to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel A. is the pastor of a church and the proprietor of a school in the community where he lives. His school has created opportunities for the community and is where most parents send their wards to. He has run the school for the last 15 years now. The school has crèche to junior high school level. Right now, the intake is increasing because of the quality tuition the school offers to the public. Samuel has also employed competent teachers who handle the students with care. His only challenge is to find funds to allow the school to expand to accommodate more students.

Samuel is 52-years old, married and a father with five children. Two of his children have finished senior high school, one is still in senior high school, while the rest are in primary school. Samuel belongs to a village bank called Divine.

Samuel needs a loan to build additional classrooms and employ more teachers to handle the students in the future. With this loan, he believes that his dreams can be achieved. Samuel would appreciate your support.

loans.use: To build additional classrooms and employ more teachers

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine P. is a hairdresser by profession. She has a shop on one of the streets in her community. She has some apprentices in training. She is requesting a loan to procure hairdressing materials such as cream, lotion, artificial hair, etc. to enable her to provide quality services to her clients.

Catherine is 35 years old. She is divorced and has three children: one son and two daughters. She says all of her children are still in basic school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the farming/commercial town of Achiase, near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Catherine works very hard to make enough money to take care of her children.

Catherine has been in business for seventeen years and wants a loan to procure supplies in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure hairdressing materials

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is 35 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters. Some are in junior-high school and others are in primary school. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua lives with the husband and the children in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akosua is a trader. She trades in coconut cooking oil. She sells to retailers on credit for a period of two weeks. She procures the oil all the way from Axim in the Western Region, where the oil is less costly. Coconut is readily come by in the region, hence, the low cost of the oil. She has been in business for two years and desires to expand her business. Akosua is hopeful to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys D. is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children: three sons and four daughters. She says three of her children are currently in the primary school. The others are out of school and working. Gladys lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband works with the railway corporation in the community. She works to support her husband financially.

Gladys is a trader. She trades in textile fabrics and school uniforms. She sells at the local market and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She also trades in bags. Gladys buys the materials from wholesalers in Accra. She has been in business for more than 22 years now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy textile materials and underwear

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. is a fifty-eight year old married man and the father of five children: two sons and three daughters. Some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high schools. His wife trades to support him financially. Michael lives with his wife and children in a family house in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a farming and a busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Michael trades in agro-chemicals. He sells all kinds of agro-chemicals such as pesticides, insecticides, etc. and all kinds fertilizers. Michael sells in a store at the local lorry (truck) station. He procures the chemicals from nearby agricultural offices.

Michael has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure the chemicals in bulk. He is hopeful to give his children the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure agro-chemicals in bulk

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice M. is 44 years old. She is widowed and has given birth to one child, a son. She says her son is currently in the university. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works very hard to make enough income to take care of her son.

Alice runs a drinking spot. Her spot is located near the local market. She says she has attendants who serve the customers who come to buy. She wants a loan to procure all kinds of drinks such as malt, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Pepsi, etc. Alice has been in business for 25 years. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure more drinks

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.es:
Foto De izquierda a derecha: Angela María U. R., Eddy José E. C. y María Luisa P. S..

Este es el grupo solidario Restauración, conformado por las señoras María Luisa, quien se dedica a la venta de truchas, que son productos variados como : carteras, billeteras, calculadoras, discos , etc. El  señor Eddy José E. es coordinador del grupo, las integrantes lo eligieron como coordinador por este ciclo, quien vende truchas en el mercado y en su casa vende granos básicos, esta parte la atiende su esposa, tienen varios años de dedicarse a estas actividades.
Doña Angela María U. es la ultima integrante de este grupo, ella hace y vende  tortillas en su casa por las tardes y por las mañanas vende pan, café y leche en el mercado municipal. Tiene dos niños en edad escolar, ellos le ayudan a vender en la casa y van a la escuela más cercana, su esposo le ayuda con el gasto, está trabajando en Costa Rica y le envía remesas para que se ayude con los gastos del hogar. Ella sueña crecer en su negocio para salir adelante y poder tener un tramo en el mercado y no vender ambulante sino en un solo puesto y ofrecer desayunos completos, con el crédito compró inventario como leche, café, azúcar, maíz y leña.

Este grupo es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, responsables, y semi-analfabetas, pero con muchos deseos de superación. Estos señores abonan todos los Lunes, es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores. 


Trabajan con Adim porque una de las clientas le animó que se integrará en un grupo solidario, así ella conformó su grupo con dos amigas cercanas y obtuvo el préstamo. Están contentos porque sienten que la institución confía en ellas y expresan que se proponen a quedar bien en los pagos.
texts.en:
Photograph from left to right: Angela Maria U. Ramirez, Eddy Jose E. Calderon, y Maria Luisa Pavon Sanchez. This is the united group Restauracion (Restoration), made up by: Mrs. Maria Luisa who is in the sale of merchandise such as purses, wallets, calculators, compact discs, etc. Mr. Eddy Jose E. is the coordinator of the group, elected by the members for this cycle. He sells merchandise in the market and in his house he sells basic grains which is attended to by his wife, activities they have engaged in for several years. Doña Angela Maria U. is the final member of the group, and she makes and sells tortillas in her house in the afternoon and in the morning she sells bread, coffee, and milk in the municipal market. She has two school age children who help her sell in the house and go to the closest school. Her husband helps her with the household expenses by working in Costa Rica and sending money. She dreams of growing her business to move forward and to be able to have a spot in the market and not sell on the street but in just one stand and to offer complete breakfasts. With the loan she will buy inventory such as milk, coffee, sugar, corn, and firewood. This group is from the city of Masaya, responsible, and semiliterate, but with a strong desire to overcome. These people pay their loan every Monday which is the best day to pay, after the weekend when the sales are the best. They work with Adim because one of the clients became excited to become a member of a united group and therefore formed the group with two nearby friends and obtained a loan. They are happy because they feel like the institution believes in them and they express that they plan to be prompt in their payments.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more items to offer to their customers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence B. is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters. Some are in the junior high school while others are into apprenticeships. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and the children in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Florence is a trader. She trades in all kinds of vegetable cooking oil. She hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell her products in her community. Florence says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Most of her customers are food vendors. She procures the oil all the way from wholesalers in Accra.

Florence has been in business for two years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure vegetable cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel K. is a twenty-eight year old married man and the father of one child, a son. He says his son is currently in the nursery school. His wife works to make some income to support him financially. She trades in eggs. Emmanuel lives with the wife and son in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a farming and a busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Emmanuel deals in mobile phones and accessories. He owns a shop in front of the house in which he stays. He has in stock all kinds of cell phones and their accessories. He procures the goods from big stores and wholesalers in Accra.

Emmanuel has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more phones and accessories to increase his stock. He is hopeful to give his child the best education possible.

loans.use: To procure more mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина успешно погасила свой предыдущий займ и собирается немного освежить ассортимент своих товаров. После последнего займа Тахмина взяла в аренду магазинчик сделанный из пластика и алюминия и теперь может смело оставлять товар ночью на хранение тут же в магазине, а также летом условия для торговли стали лучше, так погода в Таджикистане очень жаркая. Тахмина подает новую заявку на КИВА и собирается погасить новый займ в течении 2 месяцев.
texts.en:
Tahmina successfully paid off her previous loan and plans to slightly refresh her product assortment. After her last loan Tahmina rented a small store made from plastic and aluminum and now can safely leave her products at night in the store, and in the summer too the sales conditions became better as the weather in Tajikistan is very hot. Tahmina has put in a new application on KIVA and plans to pay back the current loan over 2 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Aleman Group

texts.es: El banco comunal alemán  es un grupo nuevo que se ha formado con socias que ya han trabajado en anteriores bancos comunales, de manera que son personas con ganas de trabajar y ayudar al crecimiento de sus patrimonios en sus hogares. El crédito que han obtenido es para invertirlo en sus negocios y obtener mayores ventas y ganancias, los componentes del banco comunal se dedican a la venta de comida, venta de pan, y otros a la venta de cosméticos.Otras actividades a las que se dedica el grupo son: VENTA DE ROPA, EMPLEADO, MOTO TAXISTA, VENTA DE ROPA, PANADERIA, COMERCIANTE, VENTA DE COMIDA Y ASADITO, VENTA DE COMIDA, VENTA DE PAN, VENTA DE COMIDA, EMPLEADO, SECRETARIA, PANADERIA y EMPLEADA.
texts.en:
The German communal bank is a new group that has formed with partners who have already worked in previous communal banks, so that they are people with the desire to work and to help grow the wealth of their homes. The credit they have obtained is for investing in their businesses and to obtain greater sales and earnings. The components of the communal bank are selling food, bread and cosmetics. Other activities to which the group is dedicated are: selling clothing, employment, Moto taxi driver, bakery, retailer, selling and roasting food, and secretary.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Muhtasar

texts.ru: Мухтасар 35 лет. она занимается покупкой косточек от абрикосов и затем дальнейшей их переработкой. Ядра от косточек, которые она вместе с семьей раскалывают дома она сортирует и затем реализует на рынках. Доход от этой деятельности небольшой, и поэтому кроме бизнеса Мухтасар работает в одной организации. Она собирается немного расширить свой бизнес и поэтому обратилась с заявкой на КИВА.
texts.en:
Muhtasar is 35 years old. She purchases apricot pits and processes them. She sorts and then sells at markets the kernels from the pits, that she splits with her family at home. The income from this occupation is not large and this is why in addition to her business Muhtasar works in one organization. She plans to grow her business a little bit and this is why she has applied to KIVA

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Brazil Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Danelia Isabel E. A., Francisca Antonia G. M. y Guillermina del Socorro Monge G..

Llegaron a tener crédito con Adim porque una cliente les habló del tipo de crédito que recibían, donde confiaban en la honorabilidad de los clientes.

Este grupo es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, está conformado por las siguientes personas:
Doña Francisca  vende frutas en el mercado de masaya, ofrece frutas de la temporada que son las más baratas, compra en el mercado y las vende al detalle donde saca mejores ganancias , es soltera y su hijo de 18 años le ayuda en el puesto.

Doña Guillermina del Socorro Monge elabora comidas rápidas y las vende en su casa de habitación, tiene diez años de dedicarse a esta actividad la que le ha generado ingresos para mantener a seis hijos que ha criado sola.

Doña Danelia Isabel E. es la coordinadora del grupo, es una joven mujer madre de un hijo de edad escolar, tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa donde ha invertido algunos ahorros y el financiamiento de Adim. Sueña dar estudio a su hijo y mejorar su vivienda, expresa que esta contenta de trabajar con Adim porque ella nunca había tenido oportunidad de un crédito por no tener garantías y ahora ella va a quedar bien a la institución que confía en ella.

Estos señoras abonan todos los Martes, para ellas es el mejor día para abonar, después del fin de semana que las ventas son mejores y así garantizan la cuota del préstamo.
texts.en:
Photo from Left to right: Danelia Isabel E. A., Francisca Antonia Garcia Martinez and Guillermina Socorro Monge Garcia. They received the credit with Adim because a client spoke to them about the type of credit they received where they trusted the reputation of the clients. This group is from the city of Masaya and consists of the following people: Doña Francisca, who sells fruits in the market of Masaya, offering seasonal fruits that are cheapest; she buys them in the market and sells them in detail where she earns more. She is single with and 18 year old son who helps her. Doña Guillermina Socorro Monge, who prepares fast meals and sells them from a room in her house; she has been doing this for ten years and it is the one activity that has generated income to maintain six children that she raised alone. Doña Danelia Isabel E. a young mother of a school-aged son age who is the group’s coordinator. She has small grocery store (pulpería) in her house where she has invested some savings and the financing of Adim. She dreams of giving her son an education and to improve her house, expressing that she is happy to work with Adim because she has never had the opportunity of a loan and not having guarantees. Now she is going to look good to the institution that trusts her. These women pay every Tuesday. For them it is the best day to pay after the weekend when sales are better and they can guarantee the loan payment.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to offer customers & to increase sales

loans.name: Ametauna Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Ametauna 1º ciclo, está ubicado en el barrio El Pajonal donD. todas son del barrio y se conocen entre ellas. Todas las señoras tiene sus negocios propios como ser: promotoras D. cosméticos, venta D. comida, peluquería, venta D. joyas, venta D. masetas. Las socias aceptan que existe gran competencia D. créditos en las diferentes entidades financieras, y algunos créditos individuales. Las socias D. dicho banco sacaron el crédito con el objetivo D. hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su capital. Parte D. ellas trabajan en otras instituciones financieras.
texts.en:
The cooperative bank Ametauna First Cycle is located in the El Pajonal neighborhood, where the women know each other. They all have their own businesses, such as cosmetics sales, food sales, hairdresser’s, and jewelry sales. The members realize there is great competition for loans with the various financial institutions, as well with some individual credit. The members of said bank took out credit with the objective of helping their businesses grow and to augment their working capital. Some of them work in other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mil Flores Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:   Angela María L. J., Josefa Paulina B. y 
María Teresa
texts.en: Photograph from Left to Right: Angela María L. J., Josefa Paulina B. and María Teresa

loans.use: To purchase more products to offer to customers, including basic needs such as grains, detergents, meats, sweets/snacks, etc.

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.es: Las socias D.  la banca comunal "cristo vive", son socias que  viven en el barrio guapurú. Existe un parentesco consanguíneo: la familia A.; son hermanas. Formaron el grupo con el propósito D. contar con un capital D. trabajo. Las socias integrantes desempeñan diferentes actividades como: venta D. cosméticos, venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes y venta D. comida, el socio participante venD. accesorios D. plásticos, todos los socios generan  un movimiento económico diario. En cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que están conscientes D. la misma; y comentan  que la administración del crédito, favorece para mejorar en el crecimiento D. su negocio. El crédito que se les otorgó, según expresiones, esta destinado surtir sus tiendas (negocios establecidos), para las promotoras aprovechar las ofertas  y el socio para participante para incrementar su mercadería. Efectivamente las socias comentan que ya tuvieron créditos anteriores  en otras instituciones microfinancieras.
texts.en:
The members of the Cristo Vive (“Christ Lives”) cooperative bank live in the Guapurú neighborhood. There is a family relationship within the group: the A. family; they are sisters. They formed the group with the aim of attaining working capital. The members undertake various activities such as cosmetics sales, bread sales, general stores, and food sales. The male colleague in the group sells plastic goods. All members generate income on a daily basis. Insofar as the competition, suffice it to say that they are aware of it, and they comment that the loan assistance helps them improve the growth of their businesses greatly. The loan granted to them is destined to help them supply their stores (established businesses), for the merchants to take advantage of sales and to increase their merchandise supply. The members comment that they have had previous credit with other microfinance institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jackelline Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Jackelline V., trabajo desde muy joven en diferentes instituciones con ingresos de asalariada, y a pesar de su corta edad logra comprar un terreno en la calle 47 de Chasquipampa. Ella deja de trabajar y forma una familia y se dedica integramente a su hogar, atendiendo además a un hijo con un problema de salud desde su nacimiento y con el fin de lograr ingresos para levantar una construcción sobre el terreno ya adquirido decide aportar a la familia con otro tipo de ingresos y empieza a elaborar masas tales como empanadas, berlines, queques y tortas sin pensar en el agradable sabor que ella tenia en la repostería que elaboraba.
Es así como empieza a vender en pequeñas cantidades en la zona sur dejando inicialmente en pocas cantidades, hoy ella ya vende su repostería en dos de los colegios con mas alumnado de la zona sur y además preparando este tipo de manjares por contratos de clientes que ya la conocen y conocen de su repostería, ella hace este trabajo en el hogar y así puede atender a su familia de manera normal como ella lo desea.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jackelline V. has been working since she was very young in different institutions with salaried income. Despite her young age, she has bought a piece of land on street 47 of Chasquipampa. She stopped working and formed a family and is totally devoted to her household, attending to her son who has had a health problem since birth. To receive revenue in order to get contruction going on her already acquired land, she has decided to supplement her income by starting to mass produce empanadas, berlins, cakes and pastries, without even thinking of the agreable flavor that she makes in the production of the pastries. Thus she began selling small amounts in the south, beginning only with small quantities. Today she sells pastries in two of the schools with the most students in the south, and further prepares these types of dishes in contracts for customers who already know her or know of her pastries. She does this work at home so she can attend to her family in a normal way as she wishes.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build capital.

loans.name: Alexa Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Eloísa Edelia O., Francis Yamileth Arias V. y  Vilma de los Angeles F. L..

 Este grupo tiene su domicilio en  la ciudad de Masaya, estas tres mujeres tienen actividades comerciales diferentes, se conocen desde hace muchos años y tienen una gran confianza una en la otra. 

Doña Eloísa es comerciante en el mercado vendiendo frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene un hijo de 4 años que va a la escuela, su esposo trabaja en una empresa textilera y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Doña Francis es la coordinadora del grupo, ella tiene un puesto de truchas en el mercado donde ofrece productos como: baterías, tijeras, hilos, calculadoras etc., además vende detergentes de forma ambulante dentro del mercado y en su casa sus hijos le ayudan a ver una pequeña pulpería. En el mercado le ayuda su esposo a ver el puesto y ella realiza las compras y hace los pedidos. Sueña con terminar la casa que están construyendo en terreno propio y muy pronto trasladarse a vivir ahí.

Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.
texts.en:
Photograph from Left to Right: Eloísa Edelia O., Francis Yamileth Arias V. and Vilma de los Angeles F. L.. This group is domiciled in the city of Masaya. These three women have different commercial enterprises, have known each other for many years, and have a great deal of confidence in each other. Eloísa is a merchant at the market selling fruits that she buys at wholesale. She works as a street vendor during the day, and has a 4-year-old son who is in school. Her husband works at a textile enterprise and helps with the household expenses. Francis is the group’s coordinator, and runs a stand at the market where she sells products such as batteries, scissors, thread, calculators, etc. In addition, she sells detergents at the market and from her house where her children help her tend to a small general store. She helps her husband tend to their stall in the market, making the purchases and orders. She dreams of finishing the house they are building on their own land, and hopes to move there soon to live. They comment that Adim has helped them learn how to better manage their businesses with the help provided, as well as helped improve their standards of living.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various products to offer to customers and increase their sales.  The products are various and for a number of uses, such as: nail clippers, calculators, threads, needles, clocks, decals, etc.

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es: El banco creciendo juntas es un grupo conformado por 13 socias entre las cuales podemos encontrar un varón que es el presidente el banco, Juan Carlos se dedica a trabajar como chofer desD. hace 8 años atras lo que demuestra que tiene muchas experiencia en el rubro del transporte, por otra parte el resto del grupo se dedica a: la venta D. comida, benta D. refrescos, venta D. pan, venta D. ropa, venta D. cosméticos y algunos incluso requirieron el crédito para uso personal.
texts.en:
The Creciendo Juntas (“Growing Together”) cooperative bank is a group comprised of 13 members, in which we can find one male who is the president of the bank. Juan Carlos has dedicated himself to working as a driver for the past 8 years, demonstrating that he has a great deal of experience in the transportation arena. The rest of the group dedicates itself to: food sales, beverage sales, bread sales, clothing sales, cosmetics sales, and some also required loan funds for personal use.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mejor Progreso Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Mayra del Socorro G., Matea Hipólita S. G., Rita de los Angeles C. y Ligia del Rosario L. R..

El grupo solidario El mejor progreso son originarios de la ciudad de Masaya, tienen varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim porque sienten que es una institución que ha confiado en ellos, expresan que se sienten como parte de la familia de Adim. Todas las miembros del grupo venden en el mercado municipal.

Doña Ligia es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene un puesto en el mercado donde ofrece frutas y verduras, con seis años de tener esta actividad ha sabido como es el giro de su negocio, expresa que ella ha visto como en cada préstamo le va quedando un mayor inventario en el negocio. Ella es una madre joven de treinta y cuatro años de edad con cuatro hijos adolescentes sueña con que ellos puedan estudiar la secundaria completa para que se defiendan en la vida. Su esposo es agricultor en tierras familiares y la producción de él, ella se la compra y la vende a mejor precio en el mercado.
Todo lo que ha logrado le anima a seguir trabajando y quedando bien en Adim, esto se lo hace saber a su grupo y por eso se encarga de ir a dejar el abono para garantizar la puntualidad.

Doña  Mayra del Socorro vende productos varios como detergentes, pastas de dientes, jabones etc. Tiene cinco años de vender en el mercado, ella compra a empresas que ofrecen productos al por mayor y así le queda un mayor margen de ganancia, no tiene hijos a su cargo y su esposo está en Costa Rica trabajando, le envía remesas de poco dinero pero que le ayudan a sus gastos.



Doña Matea vende perecederos, tiene cuatro hijos jóvenes solteros que viven con ella, todos estudian y el mayor cursa la Universidad, con más de treinta años de trabajar en el mercado expresa que hasta ahora logra obtener un crédito que es en base a la confianza y está clara que debe de ser puntual con su pago. Su esposo trabaja como artesano de madera y le ayuda con los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos.

Doña Rita de los Angeles C. vende truchas y productos varios, ella es viuda vive con dos hijos que le ayudan a vender en el puesto, un varón de veintiún años y una mujer de veinticinco ambos solteros. Ella expresa que su negocio le ha dado para vivir, en Adim ha aprendido a invertir bien su dinero y el del prestamo.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Mayra del Socorro G., Matea Hipólita S. G., Rita de los Angeles C. and Ligia del Rosario L. R.. The supportive group members of El Mejor Progreso are from Masaya city. They have worked with Adim for several cycles because they feel that it is an institution that has believed in them. They feel like they are part of the Adim family. All of the group members sell in the municipal market. Ligia, the coordinator of this group, has a stall in the market where she sells fruits and vegetables. With six years of experience, she knows how her business goes. She has seen how with each loan she is able in increase her inventory. She is a young mother of 34 with four adolescent children. She dreams that they will be able to finish their high school studies so that they can take care of themselves. Her husband is a farmer on family land. She buys what he produces and sells it for a better price in the market. Everything that she has achieved encourages her to keep working and staying with Adim. She lets her group know this, and that is why she is in charge of turning in the payment to make sure it is on time. Mayra del Socorro sells various products like detergent, toothpaste, soap, etc. She has been selling in the market for five years. She buys from businesses that sell wholesale. That way she gets a bigger margin of earnings. She does not have children to take care of, and her husband is in Costa Rica working. He sends her remittances of not very much money, but it does help with her expenses. Matea sells perishables. She has 4 single children who live with her. They all go to school, and the oldest goes to the University. She has more than thirty years of working in the market. She knows that a loan is based on trust, and it is clear that they payment should be on time. Her husband is a wood craftsman, and he helps with the educational expenses of the children. Rita de los Angeles C. sells trout and various products. She is a widow, and she lives with her two children. Her son is 21, and her daughter is 25. They are both single. They help her sell at her stall. Her business has given her a living. In Adim she has learned to invest her money better, and she has learned about loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetales, products not grown in  Masaya like: broccoli, lettuce, carrots, onions, etc.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis A. L. tiene una tienda  y taller de vidrieria, en la casa de su padre, el trabaja desde hace 10 años, muy dedicado al oficio, en la colocacion de vidrios, realiza trabajo en puertas, ventanas y boxes de baño, es un joven soltero, que colabora con la mantención de la familia.
Por esa dedicación al trabajo llego a adquirir con sus ahorros una tienda donde instaló juegos en red e Internet, además de puntos de llamadas, es cliente recomendado por su hermano Juan A. quien es cliente de Emprender desde hace más de tres años.
Solicita este crédito para aumentar maquinaria en su taller, es una persona responsable según referencias.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis A. L. has a glass shop and studio at his father's house. He has worked there for ten years, is very dedicated to the craft and the installation of glass, he produces doors, windows and bathroom stalls. He is young and unmarried, he works to help maintain the family. Therefore he is dedicated to his work, and with his savings has come to acquire a store where he installs internet and web games, and further call points. He is a customer who was recommended by his brother Juan A., a customer of Emprender for more than three years. He requests a loan to increase his shop machinery, he is a responsible person with references.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grinder and a compressor.

loans.name: Cumplidas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal las cumplidas está compuesto por 13 socias y socios, mismos que se conocen muy bien entre ellos, la presidenta del banco es la sra. Nancy que se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 10 años atrás, por otra parte el resto del grupo se dedica a: También a comercializar diferentes articulos, venden hamácas, cosméticos, cotillones y ropa. Los socios del grupo están concientes de la responsabilidad que asumen al contraer una deuda por lo que trabajan bien juntos.
texts.en:
Las Cumplidas community back has 13 members. They know each other very well. The president of the bank, Nancy, has over 10 years of business experience. The rest of the group sells different items like hammocks, cosmetics, decorations and clothes. The group members are aware of the responsibility that they assume with a loan, and they will work well together to meet that responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: La Oportunidad Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Andrea Josefa C. J., Azucena del Carmen H. y Wendy Gutiérrez V..

El grupo solidario La Opotunidad es originario de la ciudad de Masaya, ellas por igual venden comida y refrescos en sus casas, son bien conocidas por esta actividad en sus barrios.
Doña Azucena del Carmen H. vende Refrescos, repostería, chocobananos y gaseosas. Ella inició en el grupo desde hace varios ciclos y es la coordinadora del grupo porque es comprometida con sus abonos y así anima a las miembros a no tener errores ni atrasos en sus pagos. Tiene tres hijos de edad escolar de  doce, ocho y tres años, ellos van a la escuela mas cercana a la vivienda. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, trabaja en una empresa embotelladora y le da para el sustento, ella expresa que su negocio es de ella y compra lo que ella quiere para ella y sus hijos. Sueña con mejorar su negocio y así mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.

Doña Andrea es una mujer joven con una familia numerosa de 5 hijos adolescentes, ellos estudian en la escuela del barrio, le ayudan en el negocio de la venta de comida, su esposo trabaja de chofer de taxi y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, del negocio ella asume gastos extras del hogar como ropa de los hijos, cuadernos, etc. Su negocio le garantiza la alimentación del hogar y es por esto que ella es muy importante en las decisiones del hogar.

Doña Wendy  se dedica a la venta de fritangas en su casa todas las noches, ofrece platos como : pollo asado, enchiladas, tacos, refrescos y helados. Es madre soltera con una niña pequeña de tres años, vive con su mamá. Piensa trabajar para poder obtener sus propios electrodomésticos y así ser independiente.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Andrea Josefa C. J., Azucena del Carmen H. and Wendy Gutiérrez V.. The solidarity group La Oportunidad (The Opportunity) is from the city of Masaya. The members all sell food and drinks from their homes, and are well known for this activity in their neighbourhoods. Azucena del Carmen H. sells refreshments, sweet snacks, chocolate bananas and soft drinks. She founded the group several loan cycles ago, and is the group coordinator because she is responsible with her repayments and this motivates the other members to not have errors or delays in their repayments. She has three school-age children, 12, 8 and 3 years old. They go to the school closest to where they live. Her husband helps her with living expenses. He works in a bottling factory, earning money to support his family. She says that her business belongs to her, allowing her to buy what she wants for herself and her children. She dreams of improving her business, and in this way improving the quality of life of her family. Andrea is a young woman with a large family of 5 adolescent children. They study in the neighbourhood school, and help her with her business selling food. Her husband works as a taxi driver and helps her with household expenses. From the business she is able to cover extra household expenses such as clothes and books for their children. Her business guarantees the nutrition for the household, and it is for this reason that she is plays a very important role in the household decision-making. Wendy works selling meals from her home every night, offering dishes such as roast chicken, enchiladas, tacos, drinks and ice-cream. She is a single mother with a 3 year old daughter. Wendy lives with her mother. She hopes to work in order to buy her own household appliances, and in this way become independent.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food supplies including: sugar, rice, meat, tortillas etc. to cook and sell prepared meals

loans.name: Cereza Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Linda Urania F. L., Suyen de los Angeles H. S. y María Milagros A. M. .

El grupo solidario Cereza está compuesto por tres mujeres trabajadoras, originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, empezaron a obtener crédito con Adim a través de referencias con clientas de la institución que les dijeron que se prestaba con fianza solidaria por no tener garantías. 

Doña Linda Urania es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida, vende en el mercado municipal comidas derivadas del cerdo como caldos de carne. El crédito lo usó para comprar cerdos en pie y luego procesar los caldos, así como especies y bolsas de plástico. Ella es madre de un hijo pequeño y su esposo es carpintero y le ayuda con los gastos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para tener más seguridad y proteger más a su familia.

Doña Suyen de los Angeles es una joven mujer vende helados, gaseosas, frescos, con esta actividad ayuda a los gastos del hogar, con el crédito compro frutas, azúcar, bolsas. Sus ventas se han mejorado porque ofrece de todos los sabores. Su esposo le ayuda ya que vende truchas en Costa Rica y viaja tres veces a la semana.

Doña María Milagros vende productos varios como: pan, café, leche preparada, etc.es casada pero no tiene hijos, sueña con tener su propia vivienda para cuando tenga un hijo. Con el crédito ella ha logrado capitalizarse en su negocio.

El grupo está comprometido con quedar bien a Adim para seguir obteniendo créditos y seguir trabajando mejor.
texts.en:
The Cereza group has three members, all of whom come from Masaya city. They are, as seen left to right in the photo, Linda Urania F. L., Suyen de los Angeles H. S. and María Milagros A. M.. They began borrowing from Adim after speaking with other members of the bank who assured them that they could have access to loans despite not having any collateral. Doña Linda Urania is the group's coordinator and she runs a business selling meals in the local market. She makes many types of pork dishes, including stews. She will use this loan to buy live pigs, which she will butcher for her stews. Linda's husband is a carpenter and supports her business. Together, they have a young son. Linda dreams of bettering her quality of life so that she and her family are more secure. Doña Suyen de los Angeles is a young woman who sells ice cream, soft drinks and juices, thus contributing to her household's income. With this loan she will buy fruit, sugar, and plastic bags. Her sales are continually increasing because she offers a large variety of flavours. Her husband has also been doing well. He sells trout in Costa Rica and travels there three times a week in order to do so. Doña María Milagros sells a variety of products like bread, coffee, milk etc. She is married but has no children. She dreams of having her own home for when she has a child. She will use this loan as working capital for her business. As a whole, the group is committed to keeping in good stead with Adim so that they can continue receiving loans and bettering their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and a variety of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es: El grupo Jazmin se encuentra conformado por 12 personas D. la cuales la mayoría se dedica desD. hace varios años atrás al comercio D. distintos artículos como ser: cosméticos, ropa nueva, ropa usada, ropa americana, refrescos, empanadas, pan y comida en general. En el grupo también hay socios como la presidenta por ejemplo que se dedica a realizar trabajos D. sastrería y tiene una experiencia en este rubro D. 36 años. También hay socios que se desempeñan como mototaxistas.
texts.en:
The Jazmin group is composed of 12 members. The majority of them have been involved in sales for several years. They sell various items like cosmetics, new clothes, used clothes, American clothes, soft drinks, empanadas, bread and food. Also, there are members, like the president, for example, who do tailoring work. She has 36 years experience in this field. There are also members who work as motorcycle taxi drivers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: la Sra. Catalina L. R. se dedica a esta actividad, teje mantas de vicuña, alpaca y huanaco, desde hace más de 20 años, ella tiene un hijo con problemas de salud, que aún lo mantiene economicamente, ya que los mayores tienen sus propios hogares, el esposo viaja constantemente al campo por ser agricultor.La Sra, Catalina trabaja con Emprender desde el año 2006, saca montos pequeños a plazo largo debido a esa actividad del tejido, ya que ella compra lana en bruto y procede al hilado y luego al tejido, además los gastos que ella tiene con su hijo enfermo, es una cliente bien puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina L. R. has been knitting woolen cloaks of vicuña, alpaca and huanaco for more than 20 years.
